40797271.review:
The game is presented as if you were watching a cheesy 70s sci-fi movie with commentary by the director and, I suppose, a sort of interviewer. The last chapter puts a bit of a twist on this premise.
The commentary itself is legitimately funny, if sometimes in a sort of eyeroll-inducing manner - which is likely intended - so that alone makes this worth playing.

There are three playable characters which unlock as you progress in the game, all of them fairly early on. They all share a set of special abilities and each one of them has one ability that is specific to them. You collect a variety of weapons to choose from, although some are objectively better than others. If upgraded, you will still get by with whatever suits you best.
Upgrades are done with collectibles, gears you can find all over the place, some in your direct path and as enemy drops, some a little more hidden, which makes exploration an interesting part of the game.
Completing certain challenges (like shooting targets or jumping through hoops) and progressing also lets you assign character points. For each "level" you can choose between three upgrades, for example more health, health regen, more ranged damage etc.

Gameplay consists of combat - melee or ranged - and platforming.

The combat is alright, there are many different types of enemies, but only some actually require something other than "Shoot/smack it until it's dead" (like having to shoot them in the back or [spoiler]cutting their strings in the last chapter[/spoiler]). Their design is more interesting than actually fighting them, and getting swarmed/stunlocked by hordes of weaker enemies while stronger ones eat away at your health bar can be frustrating, though it doesn't happen too often. It's also not always clear how to defeat an enemy that can't just be whacked in the face until it falls over.
What's interesting is that there's a dodge mechanic which can be used to parry attacks if timed right, and it also lets you parry projectiles.
The platforming has some issues. You can't control the camera; the game rotates it in ways that it [i]thinks[/i] will help you, but sometimes it doesn't. You vision can occasionally be obstructed by terrain and enemies can and will attack from off-screen. What's more frustrating is when you're trying to jump somewhere and the camera rotates mid-jump, or was positioned so that you couldn't gauge distance or height in the first place.

It may sound like I have a lot of issues with the game, but some are non-issues, and overall it was still fun and enjoyable (plus not long enough to make any of these issues tedious).

(Note: I didn't have any performance issues. Sometimes it looked like it, but that was due to the weird thematically appropriate stop-motion movement of some enemies in the game, which threw me off a bit in the beginning.)

40705487.review:
Los juegos del estudio chileno ACE Team se caracterizan por su marcada originalidad, por tener siempre diseños estrambóticos, como también por saber dar muy acertadamente una vuelta de rosca a todo tipo de géneros (desde el beat’em up, pasando por la defensa de torres, estrategia o, en el caso que nos ocupa, un juego de acción disfrazado de plataformas). [b]The Deadly Tower of Monsters[/b] tiene poso a clásico no sólo por la temática que aborda de forma muy simpática (existe un discurso metalingüístico sobre el cine de serie Z que inunda toda la experiencia), sino también por sus mecánicas jugables. Aunque éstas no se limitan a copiar las de tantos y tantos títulos dentro del género, sino que recoge acertadamente sus mimbres para construir sobre ellos una experiencia (alcanzar la cima de una torre mientras nos liamos a tiros y espadazos contra enemigos de lo más variopinto), que se siente fresca, diferente y autorreferencial con otros juegos del estudio.

[b]The Deadly Tower of Monsters[/b] no es un juego redondo, existen unos cuantos bugs aquí y allá, o la campaña es demasiado corta (en torno a las cuatro horas de juego, sin exprimir todos los secretos), pero son aristas que quedan diluidas entre un mayor número de aciertos. Que no son pocos. Si se está buscando un juego de acción que sea divertido de jugar, sorprendente a cada minuto, que arranque unas cuantas sonrisas, y que presente nuevas formas de entender el género… con [b]The Deadly Tower of Monsters[/b] uno tiene una buena elección que a buen seguro no defrauda

40536881.review:
This game is... IDK
------ Pros: -----------------
It has an excellent premise. Like Viewtiful Joe, but focused entirely on OLD Sci-fi.
The music FITS LIKE A GLOVE!
The animation and enemy design complements it super well.
It starts out really good introducing a wide array of OLD sci-fi tropes, the abilities and beat 'em up style work well enough.
The scenario of climbing a Tower and a lot of gameplay based around it, like being able to jump off the tower and sky-dive down, works in a really pleasing way.

-------- CONS: -------------
The execution is bad or maybe just not good.
The narrator being the director commentary is good at first, but gets old fast, with the characters being extremely one-sided in a bad way.
The game feels like it should be co-op with the character switching, or at least have the option, but it's not.
The abilities and combat methods never really have enough time or challenges/puzzles to get fully fleshed out.
Combat gets boring and stays way to simple, besides finding ways to win fights faster. <--- BIGGEST PROBLEM
The story and characters are all so one note, with writing that doesn't really grip me or make me laugh for most of the game. (Although, there were a couple parts that genuinely got a good chuckle out of me.)

To put it simply:
This game feels like it was really close to being something of a hidden gem, but it just falls short on so many aspects that I don't think I would recommend it to most people. BUT, if you're the type of person who wants to see a game with a lot of really close to being good ideas, but coming up short, THEN this game is for you.
(I like it, but I also don't like it.)

39804302.review:
This is a brilliant little gem of a game.

I'm really surprised that it didn't make a bigger splash when it was released, but The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a terrific production.  

The whole setting- a schlock 50's sci-fi movie, complete with re-used sets, "stop-motion" enemies, and all of the goofiness of films of that era- is pulled off graciously and perfectly, and the game is, well, fun!  Combat is arena-style third-person, but with true freedom in a lot of zones- the Tower's not just a set-piece, it's an object you can climb up and down on and explore.  

I doubt if I'll ever explore the vast majority of the Tower's secret nooks and crannies or get all of the Achievements, but after completing the game on the basic difficulty, I can say that it was a great experience where the designers very carefully made the game get harder, but didn't ever make it feel unfair or take cheap shots.  

They clearly understood that a game like this is meant to be an enjoyable experience and the story (as told by the Director and the Sound Engineer) is very fun and spoofs these kinds of movies in a loving, yet sarcastic fashion.

Each of the characters is interesting, has enough difference to reward players for taking them in some areas but not others, and there are very few points where the player is forced to take one character rather than another.

For what it costs (even when not on sale, it's cheap) it's a steal.  It's also entirely kid-friendly (well, provided your kids don't get all of the jokes, which they won't) with B-movie violence, rather than horror and gore.

I got this with a pack of other games and I really hope that other folks will give this title a go; it's just about perfect to play with a tween who's smart enough to get the themes and is nerdy enough to get most of the humor!

39709713.review:
[h1]The tl;dr[/h1]
Fun game with an interesting storyline. Graphics engine a bit choppy at times

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
  [*] Game has a fun storyline which keeps you engaged through out.
  [*] Game is actually beatable. I have many games in my library that either are exceedingly difficult to beat or perhaps just take way to long. This game is beatable and provides achievements that are [i]easily[/i] attainable.
  [*] The game takes place on a tower and the whole map is continuous. Loading scenes are few and far between and the game presents itself as an open-world game in the form of a giant tower.
  [*] Good variety of weapons that let you have play the game in a unique way using whatever fancy pants gun or beating stick you'd like
  [*] [i]"RPG"[/i] like upgrade system that allows you to power up your weapons and your character.
[/list]


[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
  [*] Graphics engine seemed to struggle a bit. May be a relic of my PC but no matter how I tweaked them, there always seemed to be a bit of a choppyness to them.
  [*] Camera angle can be a bit funky at times. Having the ability to control the camera would've gone a long way.
  [*] After beating the game, there's not really a good reason to come back to it.
[/list]

39544510.review:
I recently completed this game, it wasn't to difficult (Though there IS a hard mode, but I'm not the best at dodging and all that so I think I'll be leaving that be) and I may go back to try and find all six of the hidden movie reels in the game. I will say though this was a fun game! Excellent to pick up when it's on sale for sure. 

Are you a fan of amusing narrators? Does the idea of listening to the commentary from someone who should probably be going for worst director of the decade amuse you? If so this might be a game for you! It's definitely high in comedy and it totally is a B movie (Or worse even) old Sci-Fi, down to occasionally seeing the little threads used for space ships and flying critters. It even has a VHS setting so the video feed is a little more grainy and blurry like an old VHS tape being watched. 

The premise of the game? You're basically watching along a movie with the director and the one recording with him as they make the commentary for a DVD rerelease of this film that the director was super proud of. The game itself contains a lot of hidden things, a lot of laughs, good fun boss encounters, and plenty to explore... oh and LOTS of fun free falling action too for those enjoying such. 

I found the game very enjoyable and definitely recommend checking it out if you're looking for some laughs and being reminded of some really old Science Fiction movies from the edge of Black and White and Color movies.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters è un gioco simpatico, non mi viene altro termine per definirlo in breve.
Visuali isometriche, "effetti speciali" e minacce aliene, condite con una buona dose di difficoltà in alcuni frangenti. Già questo dovrebbe bastare ad incuriosirvi.
Tuttavia c'è stato un aspetto che ho odiato profondamente di questo gioco: l'enorme richiesta in termini di risorse grafiche. Non ho un PC della NASA, questo no; ma supero di certo i requisiti consigliati (e di molto anche). Eppure, anche settando tutto al "minimo sindacale", la visuale non era certo fluida come mi sarei aspettato, anzi a tratti addirittura scattosa nelle fasi di gioco più affollate.
Detto questo, l'avventura rimane comunque godibilissima e vi terrà compagnia per circa una decina di ore, volendo spulciare fino in fondo un po' tutto quanto.

Voto: 7

39147056.review:
[h1] Готовьте ваши лучевые пушки, кристаллические мечи и лазерные кнуты — вас ждут мурашки по коже и бешеный пульс! Вас поразят живописные киноэффекты — стоп-кадры, ротоскоп, наложение изображений и даже проработанные костюмы с настоящим мехом! [/h1]
-Разработчики маленько не к той игре описание написали. Какие мурашки? Какой пульс? Какие киноэффекты?
-Это дико однообразная и монотонная игра. 3 часа прыгаешь вверх башни по платформам и бьёшь монстров, которые отличаются только внешним видом. Никакой тактики не надо. Атаки одинаковые даже.
-Сюжета тут нет. Хотя... Если то, что мы в очередной раз спасаем галактику...
-8 пушек дальнего боя и 8 ближнего. НО ОНИ ТАКИЕ УБОГИЕ. Я ходил с двумя всю игру, не меняя. Потому что с остальными ты ни чё не сделаешь. Если бить врага вблизи он тебя ударит, ты вниз слетишь. А дальние требуют весь заряд на 1 выстрел. Баланса у оружия нет.
Со 100% гарантией заявляю, что вы будете бегать с каким-нибудь посохом и "Теслаганом". Потому что посох бьёт на расстоянии и оглушает, а теслаган наносит урон большой сразу нескольким целям. Без всего этого враги просто будут убивать.
-Боссы для галочки. Они валятся за 30 секунд без урона.
[h1] Ах да, и не пропустите ироничные режиссёрские комментарии![/h1]
-Разработчики, вы адекватные? Как подавать такие игры? Поиграйте в Gunslinger, Bennett Foddy, The Magic Circle, UnEpic.
Когда идут комментарии разработчиков, либо ставится пауза автоматически, и идёт диалог. Либо на экране ничего не происходит, и можно бежать и читать. Нахрена во время боя вставлять свои комментарии? Или читай комментарии или дерись с десятками врагов. Это во-первых
Во-вторых сценарий школьники составляли? Столько воды в этих комментах. 
-Юмор. Юмор. Юмор. На какую аудиторию рассчитана эта игра? В стим надо ввести показатель возраста для игр, что бы адекватные люди не тратили время на такое.
"Я думаю, Дик не должен так держать оружие, когда он говорит о мире. Возможно, в один прекрасный день он поменяет его на бутерброд" АХАХХАХАХЫВАПВАРИТПВЗШР

38667422.review:
In the Deadly Tower of Monsters, you play as Dick Starspeed, a hero who's crash landed on the alien planet of Gravoria... Wait, actually you play as Jonathan Digby who's playing the role of Dick Starspeed in the movie the Deadly Tower of Monsters... Wait, actually you're playing as three different people in the DVD commentary of the Deadly Tower of Monsters by Dan Smith, the director of the movie, accompanied by an audio engineer Patrick.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a unique and weird action-adventure game that is an homage to old school B-movie sci-fi films, it is quite short but it more than makes up for it with the quality of the overall experience.

Pros
- Weird and unique.
- Visuals, effects, sounds and the commentary make you really feel as if you're playing the DVD commentary of a sci-fi B-movie.
- Well-executed humour that will make you smile.
- Voice acting is amazingly bad but in a good B-movie way.
- Gameplay is fun whether you're bashing man-apes on the head with a giant mace or shooting them with a ray gun.
- Climbing higher and higher on the tower over the course of the game is quite epic.

Cons
- I played the game relatively quickly and didn't go out of my way for collectibles but I beat the game in 3h.

If you like unique and weird games, if you're a fan of ACE Team (Rock of Ages, Zeno Clash, Abyss Odyssey), if you're a big fan of B-movies especially science fiction then you can hardly go wrong with the Deadly Tower of Monsters.

37987314.review:
The design concept - not just sharing the setting of 50s B-Grade Sci-Fi movie, but actually being a B-Grade Sci-Fi movie, complete with "DVD commentary" - is a good one and works well for the first 80% of the game. However the addition of an unnecessary plot-twist, poor keyboard-and-mouse controls and generally paint-by-numbers game-play mean that, while the game starts out well, the fun quickly leaches out of the game.

On the positive side, the game looks good - in a suitably bad sort of way - and it doesn't feel as though it has a lot of filler (despite the afore-mentioned poor plot choices). The dangers of playing on a tall tower with few railings is mitigated with a button that will teleport you back to where you fell off and a jetpack that lets you land softly. There is also a teleport mechanism to move between check-points, but it is rarely necessary (and unfortunately easy to forget when you do need it).

On the bad side the poor controls come face-to-face with some platforming sections where the 3D relationship of the platforms you are on is not obvious. The boss fights are generally low-challenge affairs with little creativity (although the giant octopus was at least fun). In game-play terms you will have seen it all before, the monsters follow all the usual patterns. The power-ups don't feel like they give much of an advantage and you have to complete challenges or find objects to gain them.

The merely mediocre is the character changing mechanism, they all play differently, but there is little reason to change characters for 95% of the game until you reach the points that require a certain characters skills. Similarly the weapons don't give you much of a reason to swap around once you have found a favourite (there are exceptions: dinosaurs vs. rocket launcher being one of them).

Overall it is a game with a good concept that starts off feeling good, but slowly stops being fun as you realise there is little other creativity involved.

37822005.review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]

Using "an old scifi b-movie made into a game" as a setting, The Deadly Tower of Monsters is about 8 hours of fun action platforming that manages to utilize most of the potential of that idea.

[h1]In detail[/h1]

As a fan of funny-bad b-movies and scifi-movies where people's imaginations are way bigger than their budget or means, this game felt like it was tailor-made for me: The concept is you're playing an old, unintentionally humorous b-movie with the director's commentary track enabled. The title probably gives away enough about what happens in the "movie".

The game is viewed from an isometric angle most of the time, but there are some sections where you're flying or shooting downwards that have a different viewpoint. Basic movement of running around and beating or shooting stuff with your main and sub weapons feels fluent enough. Although there's a main objective to go for the game gives you a bit of freedom in exploring the accessible areas where you can find materials for upgrading your weapons.

There are three playable characters and you can switch between them at-will at certain points in the game. They do have some movement and ability differences and you're required to use some of them in order to progress through some sections. The best part though is that the characters are voice acted and at least for the hero it's done in a hammy, William Shatner-esque way.

The visuals also keep with the theme and have some nice touches to them like emulating the good old movie goof of being able to see the strings that move the enemies around. Speaking of utilizing the setting, most of the enemy animations also look choppy in a stop-motion -kind of way and there's even an option in the game settings for applying a VHS-type grain on the picture.

There aren't too many negative things I can bring up. My biggest complaint is that it could've used more music on the soundtrack as you tend to hear the same themes a lot after playing for a while. I also didn't like the ending (or maybe about the last 10% of the game) but the positive bits far outweigh the negative ones.

[h1]Recommendation[/h1]

I'm not sure if I'd recommend it to someone who doesn't find the concept appealing but I thoroughly enjoyed it. Comedy is a difficult thing to nail as it depends so much on who you're trying to target with the jokes and the game succeeded in making me laugh out loud a good amount of times.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters - это DVD-фильм-игра с единственной звуковой дорожкой с комментариями режиссера, созданная людьми, которые подарили нам лучший на свете симулятора камня (aka Rock of Ages).

+ Система прокачки, хаб миссий

37331732.review: A sort of twin-stick shooter that combines combat with exploration and platforming while ascending the titular tower and murdering loads of aliens. the aesthetic here is 'cheesy 60s sci-fi flick' and it extends that to having the director of the film commenting as you play as if he was recording director's commentary for a DVD release. The visuals are solid with all the enemies looking like guys in monkey suits or plastic alien masks and it's all very well put together. You get a multitude of different weapons, each with upgrades, and three unlockable characters to play with. They even take good advantage of the tower climbing mechanic in that sometimes you need to change your viewpoint to look down to lower levels of the tower and murders flying aliens as they approach which makes for a nice change. Sounds good right? Yeah, no so much. On paper everything's there but the execution really isn't great across the board. The in-game currency required to upgrade weapons is really hard to come by so you're not going to see much change there; which doesn't really matter because the clunky repetitive combat renders all the weapons pretty similar in use (especially the melee weapons which are almost completely interchangeable). Talking of repetitive, aside from a couple of missions set off the tower which give more room to manoeuvre, climbing the tower itself become a bit of a chore after a while. The visual design does change things up admirably and you'll very often get new enemies to fight, but nothing actually changes as you spiral your way up the tower so it doesn't help much. Boss fights are rare and boring; the 'shoot down the tower' stuff is unwieldy and annoying; the platforming sections are an arse-ache due to some quirk of the pseudo-isometric viewpoint rendering vertical distances pure guesswork; the three characters are exactly the same to play with except having unique specials which are almost never used (except in random rare cases where you need to switch to a different person for five seconds to get past an obstacle); etc. It's actually more fun to play than I'm making it sound there but there's just so much of it that's completely half-baked. Less weapons (or more upgrade currency), proper twin-stick shooter combat and a little bit more variety and it could've been something really special but I can't really recommend it as it stands.

36554227.review:
Das Spiel ist sehr gut.

Das wichtigste Charakteristikum dieses Action-Spiels ist, dass so getan wird, als wäre man in einem SciFi-Film der 50er oder frühen 60er Jahre des 20. Jh. Aus dem Off hört man die Kommentare des Regisseurs bei diesem Re-Release dieses Klassikers dieser Filmepoche.

Lässig erfährt man so, welche billigen Tricks angewandt wurden, um bei dem niedrigen Budget noch einen halbwegs spannenden Film zu produzieren. Die großen, King-Kong-ähnlichen Monster werden in Stop-Motion animiert. Zur Not werden auch handelsübliche Staubsauger zu Monster umfunktioniert. Viele blinkende Lichter, fliegende Untertassen und Dinos dürfen nicht fehlen. Läuft mal etwas schief sind das eben rausgeschnittene Szenen des Films, die irrigerweise gezeigt wurden.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1202587620

Wir agieren wahlweise als einer der drei Helden des Films, D.ick Starspeed, Scarlet Nova oder Robot, die leicht unterschiedliche Fähigkeiten haben. Meist ist es aber egal, wen wir nehmen. Neben den Kämpfen ist Jump 'n' Run und das Einsammeln von Objekten unsere Aufgabe, auch um unsere Waffen und Fähigkeiten zu verbessern.

Der Weg ist zwar im wesentlichen linear, aber es gibt auch auf Abwegen viel zu finden. Ein (tragbarer?) Teleporter kann uns jederzeit zu bestimmten Stellen des Weges bringen. Dies ist auch sinnig, weil gewisse Dinge erst mit späteren Methoden gemacht werden können.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1202591837

Die Pfade führen uns oft in luftige Höhe. Stürzen wir mal ab, was manchmal auch absichtlich passiert, um Dinge einzusammeln, gibt es eine spezielle Funktion, die die Zeit etwas zurückdreht, damit wir wieder festen Boden unter den Füssen haben. Sterben wird doch mal, meist im Kampf, wird der Film am letzten Kontrollpunkt wieder aufgenommen.

Man kann bis zu drei verschiedene Spiele anfangen, man hat aber nur je einen Speicherstand. Die Kontrollpunkte sind manchmal etwas ungünstig gesetzt, so dass man manche Passagen oft wiederholen muss, wenn es zum Ende hin schwierig wird.

Ist das Spiel am Anfang noch sehr leicht, wird es später doch anspruchsvoll.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1202590126

Die Grafik ist gut. Die Schwächen, beispielsweise das Ruckeln der Stop-Motion, ist ja Absicht. Die Darstellung ist (vermutlich absichtlich) manchmal merklich verschwommen, das hätte man sich sparen sollen.

Die Sprecher sind sehr gut. Die Musik und die Geräusche sind passend zu der Epoche der Filmgeschichte.

Die Steuerung ist sowohl mit Controller als auch mit Tastatur/Maus möglich. Bei Jump 'n' Run fand ich Controller besser, bei Kämpfen die Tastatur/Maus.

Es gibt viele Errungenschaften, für die man einiges tun muss.

Pro & Contra:

+ Unterhaltsames Setting als alter SciFi-Film
+ Amüsante Kommentare des Regisseurs
+ Gutes Gameplay (Kämpfe, Jump 'n' Run, Sammeln)
+ Schöne stylische Grafik
+ Gute Musik

- Zu wenige Kontrollpunkte

Wertung: 9/10

Mit seinem SciFi-B-Movie-Setting der vergangenen 50er Jahre ist es ein erfrischend unterhaltsames Action-Spiel. In seiner Art ein kleines Meisterwerk.

36490583.review:
This is a very enjoyable 3rd person action game, that lampoons the vibe of cheesy 1950's movies. 

It's presented as if it were the director of a movie called "The deadly tower of monsters" giving an audio commentary for a dvd release. So he will make amusingly droll asides about how bad the animation is (which is superb at looking like old stop motion animation), or how naff the design of everything is (beautifully naff - perfectly captures that era)

Everything about the production of this game is spot on when it comes to mocking its inspiration. The graphics are tasty, the music is gloriously retro, the voice acting is cheesy, and it is pretty funny too.

Gameplay wise its a responsive mixture of shooting / melee and platforming, with some nifty boss battles and cool little touches. This element is strong, but fairly straightforward. I wouldn't say the presentation is carrying this aspect, as it is fun on its own, but there's no question that its campy vibe  elevates everything on the whole. 

I really liked it - it has something that AAA games lack. Beyond the sense of humour it is doing a lot with a little, and somehow seems more impressive than (most) games that cost four times the amount. At around 6 hours to finish I don't think it's bad value for the price, considering there's no filler or duff bits and it's good fun.

36489081.review: Giochino sfizioso, che parte da un concetto base molto originale. Il gioco è divertente e vale la pensa di essere giocato, ma sicuramente non ai 15€ del prezzo base, tenendo presente due fattori: 1) Non è per niente difficile, ma nemmeno un po'. 2) Tutti gli obiettivi (tranne quello legato al Survival Mode) si sbloccano in 5/6 ore. Riassumendo: gioco consigliato, ma occhio al portafogli

36105825.review:
つい先ほどクリアしました。ビジュアルと世界観に強く惹かれて購入しましたが、60年代SF映画をリスペクトして奇を衒う事無く非常に丁寧でセンスのある作りでとても満足。フィールドはシームレスに繋がる想像していたよりも規模の大きな塔となっており、登って行くにつれて雰囲気が変わります。塔の上層からのフリーフォールはなかなかの爽快感。ファストトラベル移動はローディングを挟みますがポイントも多く用意されており、移動ストレスはありません。随所にコグや的が配置され立体的なフィールドを探索する必然性を加味しているのも良いと思います。

難易度は抑え目なので、どれにするか迷い先延ばししていた能力アップグレードを全くしなくてもクリアできました。故に世界観に惹かれるけどゲームはあまり得意ではないという方にもおすすめ出来ると思います。自分はサバイバルモードのアチーブメントのみ難しそうだったので諦めましたが…。

心に残るお気に入りの作品となりました。Zeno Clash シリーズも好きなので、ディベロッパーの次回作にも期待しています！

35909342.review:
On some rare occasions, a game is found which seems not only close to flawless but proves an absolute joy to play. A game like this stands up in a crowd and says, "Hey! You remember fun? Try this, maybe!" The Deadly Tower of Monsters is such a title. In perfect honesty the author nearly feels an aversion to publishing any opinion on The Deadly Tower of Monsters, as it feels like it would fall short of doing the game justice.

To summarize, The Deadly Tower of Monsters is effectively a platforming video game incarnation of Mars Attacks: a perfectly satirical nod to the greatness that was the pre-3rd millennium sci-fi B movie. Looking at it, one gets a vague notion that the developer ACE Team may have originally intended a slightly different product, and partway through the life cycle decided, "You see these stitches? That faulty lighting? Yeah, we do too!" and ran with it in a new direction like it was out of style. Every cliche and trope of 19xx's science fiction makes an appearance while the indomitable protagonists Dick, Scarlet, and... Robot, in the interest of saving the downtrodden population of an oppressed planet of ape-people, try to overthrow a maniacally space-evil space tyrant in space.

Where The Deadly Tower of Monsters shines is its decision to not simply center on a sci-fi tale released to DVD, but the story behind FILMING the kitschy goodness of the same.

To expound, the game's every aesthetic choice leans toward showing the strings holding up miniatures, throwing way too many antennae on absolutely everything, overlaying the player's actions with metanarration by an offscreen hilariously delusional production team, and universally displaying film grain over the camera's vignette. From the game's start screen, an over-the-top director Dan Smith is offering commentary on the making of the ersatz film and the history behind the characters, plot, actors, props, and completely irrelevant trivia about the filming process. The running commentary is a solid part of what makes the game amazing; from hilarious one-liners about the stars experiencing mid-life crises behind the scenes to Bastion-esque dynamic descriptions of the player's actions on a moment-to-moment basis. Voice work for the whole "cast" is actually the weakest part of the game in places (trying just... a little too hard for a cheesy effect and overplaying its hand), and it's still perfectly suited to the whole experience. The Wilhelm scream makes a mandatory appearance in numerous places, and other stock sound effects are mixed into an original library just enough to show self-awareness while keeping accusations of being lazy or uncreative all the way in the next town over. Meanwhile, the score could be thrown over any Godzilla feature ever created without anyone the wiser - an odd but compatible choice for action-platforming adventure.

Visually the game manages to pull off a neat trick by adopting a Duck-tape-and-prayers asset style, and lavishing an inordinate amount of effort on the quality of both the Duck tape and the prayers. Disparate sci-fi movies from decades past are united in a weird, compelling blend. Within minutes of starting the player encounters soldiers with needlessly decorative armor. They run into stop-motion dinosaurs. They may get eaten by a giant fish thing right at home in The Creature from the Black Lagoon. They swat little flying bat things that have actual wires holding them up. They will almost certainly stop and gander at the trees throughout the environment, as most of them are shiny enough to give away a faux nature (which is doubly clear when rampaging foes sometimes just topple them over). There are dozens of smaller touches one notices over time, like how the cursor actually faintly lights up the environment in dark spots, interspersed title cards straight from a silent movie, and fingerprints smudged all over a perfectly good lens flare. Eventually the player will be forced at length to admire the modeling of Christmas light covered dogs stuck in vacuum cleaners, people stuck in too-small squid costumes and squirting ink everywhere, and a gigantic sawblade wielding mechanical space chameleon. It is distinctive, it is ludicrously self-aware, and it knows exactly what look it wants to achieve... and it nails it flawlessly.

In terms of gameplay, The Deadly Tower of Monsters divides itself into two very well defined zones delineated by most action platformers: action and platforming. In the former camp lies interesting, slightly awkward combat with close-range and long-range elements, and occasional set-piece scenes involving climbing parts of the Tower just ahead of rising danger. Said awkwardness in combat is one of the few things about which complaints exist; not that it plays badly, but that it looks... profoundly unnatural at times. Regardless, foes are ludicrously varied, and might do things like repulse grainy blaster fire, or highly encourage use of specific characters' special skills. Dodge based parrying is perhaps unnecessary for most of the fighting one does, but the supplication to "get gud" should be heeded by the midpoint at the latest. Branching and linear upgrades allow one to really carve out a niche style, and establish particular rhythms with favored weapon/skill combinations, in spite of the "merely human" method of ungainly swings of maces and antennae swords and the like. Switching one's tools becomes a necessity at times, though, and although the combat controls are generally extremely simple it remains fresh for a really long time. In a very neat touch, the game has a vertical shooting gallery element; get close to an edge, and the protagonist of choice leans over with a special ray cannon, able to demolish targets far below, or prevent enemies from ascending to their altitude and reinforcing an already vicious group of adversaries.

In stark contrast to the fighty stuff, the titular Tower must be climbed so as to unseat the overlord ruling it with an iron fist. This involves going up and down between teleport checkpoints at times, as well as more conventional running around to explore the many hidden and less hidden locales. Perhaps the single most iconic aspect of the game, though, is the free-fall. Head to a high spot, leap off, and plummet at a rate where dodging and weaving out of the way of oncoming projectiles is possible, but foes can also be dueled with blaster fire on the way back to earth (Sorry, Gravoria) just before triggering a recall function that returns one to the original jumping spot. In a word, awesome. It manages to combine the tension of aversarial scenarios with a really profound sense of just how big the scale of the Tower actually is. One of the better organic moments in the game was one point during an encounter fight where a stronger foe managed to land a heavy hit with a space flail, knocked poor Dick Starspeed off his precarious ledge about forty or fifty stories up, and initiated a completely unnecessary but exhilirating descent through several layers of fire breathing pterodactyls and UFO attackers, ending with a just-in-time jetpack touchdown on terra firma. It was that altercation in particular that really hammered home just how much care went into this title when ACE Team embarked on its quest for producing more amazing games.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters is truly excellent and deserves recognition for the spectacular efforts in making it look and sound a notch above the rest. It shows that, when a team decides to undertake a project, cut out anything like an attempt to take themselves seriously, and polishes the thing so much the previous paint job begins to come out, the result is not simply space-great, but space-magnificent.

35836739.review:
A fantastic attempt at a sci-fi b-movie video game. The whole story is narrated as a "Director's Commentary" with funny notations ala Mystery Science Theater. The gameplay itself is a combination of top down, twin stick, and at times brawler games. One of the more innovative features is the ability to "aim down" when you are at a cliff/ledge with the click of a button your perspective changes and you can angle your shots downwards. Use of a jetpack brings in platforming elements and a pseudo-open world opens the door to replays. I recommend this game to anybody that likes Ed Wood films, Mystery Science Theater, or just retro b-movies in general. 

Nominated this game for Steam awards.

35501284.review:
[h1]For the sake of brevity..[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Genre tags:[/b] Action, Overhead shooter, Satire
[*][b]Value Proposition:[/b] It's kind of simple, short but it's alright on sale. 
[*][b]BSERC[/b] - (Borderline Sardonic and Extremely Reductive Comparison): Destroy all Humans, [spoiler]The end of Saints Row 3 when they are in space.[/spoiler] 
[/list]
[h1]Concomitant Exposition and Summation[/h1]

[b]The Deadly Tower of Monsters[/b] is a satirical game. A sort of sci-fi B-film of the 1960's. Complete with director commentary! This is intentional, not an extra feature of some special edition or what not. The director commentary actually consists of how the 'movie' was made. Not the game.

The gameplay is quite simple, consisting of a very generous auto aim for the various weapons. A melee attack and a roll. As well as some abilities for use with mostly getting past obstacles to climb the tower. Though, they can also be used in combat to a lesser extent. 

The animation is interesting. Some of the creatures having extremely low frame rates as they were filmed in 'stop-motion'. 

The game starts a little slow in my opinion but gets more interesting as you go along. With some twists to be had approaching the end. The soundtrack is also very good though it seems a little of of place at times. It almost becomes genuinely epic and space faring while the rest of the game continues on it's quite comical path. 

[i][b]THE GIST 
It's a quaint game. Never really earning a true laugh out loud moment but consisting of many smirks with acknowledgment of cleverness. It can be a bit clunky at times. However, that may be intentional with it's emulation of b-movie themes.[/b][/i]

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/25764029/][i]Follow my curation page for more.[/i][/url]

35480734.review:
The ultimate B-movie homage game. Recommended for every fan of 50s-70s schlock. The Deadly Tower of Monsters is not that amazing of a game, but it is very unique, has great stylized visuals and audio, while featuring amusing commentary by the fictional director of the imaginary movie.
The game's biggest innovation is probably the eponymous tower, which is a continuous structure and can be jumped off at any time (encouraged to find secret areas, collectibles and powerups). Other than that it is a decent action game that will keep you entertained for 5-6 hours, if you are able to forgive its slightly clunky controls and isometric-view platforming.

35022798.review: Un excellent jeu qui n'a pas le succès qu'il mérite selon moi. Le jeu est un homage à tous les vieux films de science fiction américains. L'humour est présent tous le temps via l'aspect graphique du jeu qui donne l'impression de regarder une vielle VHS. Les commentaires du réalisateur du supposé film sont hilarants. Juste un petit regret sur les sous titres qu'il est parfois difficile de lire en plein combat. Le monde regorge de petits secrets cachés ici et là. L'escalade de la tour est trs bien pensée et les nombreux points de téléportation permettent une grande liberté pour explorer la zone en sautant librement dans le vide. Le gameplay est très bien pensé avec de nombreuses petites astuces. 10 armes à distances et 8 au corps à corps à débloquer et à améliorer. L'ambiance du jeu est vraiment terrible et les musiques y participent grandement. Une seule envie une fois l'aventure terminée, recommencer pour rester un peu plus dans cet unviers. Dommage qu'il ne soit pas possible de relancer le jeu dans un mode "partie plus" en conservant l'inventaire précédement amélioré. En bref un excellent jeu pour les nostalgiques et pour tous les autres ^^.

34583272.review:
[h1][b]Get ready... for a tower... a tower of perilous twists so hard- so big! It'll penetrate the vast reaches of space itself[/b][/h1]
[i]Join Dick Starspeed, Scarlet Nova and 'The Robot' as they ascend this treacherous tower of horror, overcoming the many challenges they face to get as high as possible and defeat the evil emperor. Don't leave that seat or label me an autistic spaz just yet because it's time for... The Deadly Tower of Monsters![/i]

(I hope you read that with an over-the-top epic announcers voice)

So in all seriousness this game definitely exceeded my expectations. I thought it'd be a relatively stubby tower full of dull monsters... nope. The enemy variety was extensive and it was kind of refreshing to see most of their animations done in a stop-motion type of way. Without the cause being framerate issues [strike]ba-dum-tss[/strike]. The gameplay was solid; The jetpack platforming, weapon variety, the combat, how the enemies drop pickups and not to mention the collectables... It reminded me of 3D platforming games from the good old days, with a top-down/isometricish twist. Needless to say this game gets you pretty high, and free falling once you are is fuckin majestic!

The story was interesting to say the least... I'd elaborate on that some more but it'd just be spoilers. However, I will say I liked how this game played on all the major cliches of B-movies. Even for someone like me, who doesn't frequently watch b-movies, I still understood the humor. The commentary did actually make me laugh a few times, and I went in thinking it'd be cheesey/cringe-city. It was, but not as much as I thought it would be. It was the misogynistic humor that got me the most.

Right when you start the game, before even getting to the main menu, the games either gonna make you smile or annoy you with its commentary gimmick. If you're part of the group that smiles, you're in for a good time.

34385716.review: 一个有着美国80年代科幻片，B级片，还有些无厘头风格的游（戏游戏中有许多向老电影的致敬）。准确的说游戏整个过程就是在拍电影，有导演的评论（吐槽自己）音轨，说出拍电影的种种不易（逗逼过程）。整个流程很有意思，很多地方让人会心一笑。游戏难度不大，4个小时左右的流程，有一点升级和人物技能要素作用不大但基本直接怼就可以。但有时候视角的切换有点别扭。整体上来说是不错的甜点。推荐推荐！

34277916.review:
Really fun action/adventure game set in a 50s sci-fi movie, with a director's commentary being recorded as you play. You're climbing a (deadly) tower (of monsters) while killing stuff and foiling evil plans and upgrading your weapons. The world is 3D but you have no control over the camera, but I didn't notice any point at which I'd say the camera worked against me. And if you manage to misjudge a jump you just hit a single key and all is well.
The combat is pretty ok. Sometimes I felt I was being slapped around, but at worst it meant repeating the scene.
What I really loved is the game's audiovisual side. You can see the nice graphics and retro-sci-fi design in screenshots, then there is the director's commentary going on whose humour I liked, and a lot of nice touches like monsters that in the movie would be guys in suits moving normally, while the big monsters' moves are choppy as a stop-motion puppets would be and you might spot strings on flying enemies.

Você consegue imaginar dinossauros, extraterrestres, homens-macaco, robôs e claro, um amor galáctico sem deixar tudo uma grande bagunça sem nexo? Pois é, The Deadly Tower of Monsters consegue organizar e encaixar uma excelente história com todos estes elementos. 
 Basicamente o jogo é um filme, onde o jogador é Dick, o ator principal. Com sua nave quebrada e seu robô perdido, logo, nosso protagonista descobre que está em um planeta chamado Gravoria, onde o imperador tirânico quer dominar e escravizar os homens-macaco do lugar. 
Dick encontra Scarlet, filha do imperador, e se junta a ela depois de saber que ela não compactua com os pensamentos do pai, e claro, depois de ser salvo por Scarlet de um King-Kong intergalático...

33575739.review:
Having a blast with a friend in co-op mode. While the game was not designed for this (most objects only react to player 1), it still holds up pretty good in terms of design. 

The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a top-down sci-fi twin-stick action game with RPG elements. Collect gold and resources along the way to upgrade your stats and weapons while battling monsters, stop-motion dinosaurs, FECES FLINGERS and guys in spandex suits. A director often comments on what you do along the game (like Bastion) but slower and more of a mocking, humour tone towards other tropes and series.

Recommended if you want a good time.

33552827.review:
Excellent game

The monster design offers a variety of all the clichés of B movies, from stop motion dinosaur toys to people in weird spandex suits, and the environment changes as you climb the tower, making it a really good game visually.

Sound design is good, the musics aren't really something that'll stick with you but they're good. As for the game sounds, they''re varied and I especially like that they put the wilhem's scream on enemies you push down the tower, really good point here :D

The gameplay surprised me for how solid it was, smooth controls, convenient powers to allow you to jump down of the tower and get up to it without making exploration and risk-taking a hastle. They also took good advantage of the verticality of the terrain combined with fixed camera angles, which makes for interesting search for hidden objects/places/easter eggs

Took me about 4-5 hours to finish it, I'd say it's definitely something you should buy if you're looking for a good action game.

33496917.review:
The Deadly Tower of Monsters – это стандартный beat ‘em up платформер с множеством багов, которые не хотят и не будут исправлять. Разработчикам лень, и я не преувеличиваю. В этом [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/353700/discussions/0/1326718197220362991]посте на форуме[/url] речь идет об исправлении корявого китайского шрифта, но отношение разработчиков к уже выпущенной игре можно понять по их ответу.
И тем не менее я рекомендую эту игру. Игру спасает юмор и стилистика. Похожая ситуация была с игрой Deadpool, вышедшей задолго до фильма.
По сюжету игры на DVD выпускают старый фильм категории B. Для записи аудиокомментария к фильму в студию пригласили его режиссера. Собственно, вся игра – это «просмотр» фильма с комментариями автора. 
Фантастический фильм категории B под названием «The Deadly Tower of Monsters» вышел в золотой век научной фантастики. Режиссер фильма некий Дэн Смит, аналог Эда Вуда, снимал фильм на ограниченный бюджет, не особо отвлекаясь на качество сценария и кинематографию.  Он нашел в автосалоне поддержанных автомобилей актера на роль главного злодея - Императора Гравонии. Он использовал дешевые декорации для фильма. Он не платил каскадерам и художникам. Он зачем-то снял множество сцен смертей главных героев. Каждая смерть в игре – это якобы вырезанная сцена из фильма. Он даже снял в фильме щенка, надев на него костюм из пылесоса.
Игра, а точнее режиссер фильма, не стесняясь заимствует атмосферу и стилистику фантастических фильмов 30-50х годов, таких как The Fly, Earth vs. The Flying Saucers, The Blob, Flash Gordon, King Kong и многих других. Заимствования на этом не останавливаются, в игре отлично переданы ограниченные возможности кинематографа тех времен. Особое умиление вызывают покадрово анимированные в стиле Рэя Харрихаузена динозавры и «Кинг Конг», а все летающие объекты заботливо подвешены на еле видимых лесках словно инопланетные аппараты в War of the Worlds.
Геймплей игры необычайно прост. Стрельба, рукопашная, спецприемы и прыжки с кувырками. По сути, всю игру можно пройти только прыгая и стреляя. Использовать оружие ближнего боя сложно из-за неудобного уклонения от ударов. То ли из-за задержки геймпада, то ли из-за чего-то другого, но у меня не получалось эффективно использовать уворачивания и блокировки. Я полностью забил на них и использовал только стреляющее оружие. Кстати об оружии. Несмотря на разнообразие, всю игру я использовал только одно оружие - Тесла Ган. Все остальное заменялось, как только появлялась новинка. Тоже самое со спецприемами. Ускорение действует слишком коротко, мины устанавливаются долго, силовой щит слишком слаб, а электричество годится только для открывания электрических дверей. Все это можно было бы исправить одним патчем. Патчем можно было и исправить баги с зависаниями в воздухе при прыжке в сторону препятствия.
Понравилось, что в игре нет четкого деления на уровни. Вся игра — это подъем. Подъем на Смертельную башню монстров, с которой можно спрыгнуть вниз или телепортироваться в любой момент. Этого я не ожидал и был приятно удивлен такому отличию от других игр этого жанра.
Рекомендую. Хотя бы ради стилистики голливудской фантастики середины прошлого века.
P.S. не умею писать связные отзывы. Отныне про игры буду писать в виде «pros\cons и вердикт» как большинство рецензентов в Steam :)
P.P.S. обновляю рецензию ради значка. Извините :)

33195835.review:
I just polished off The Deadly Tower of Monsters.  The premise is simple:  You are watching a VHS of an old low budget 50s pulp sci-fi B movie while the director records the commentary for the DVD release.  

You control the characters (leading man, space woman who has never seen a man, robot) through a sort of 3D action-shooter-platformer, complete with VHS video artifacts, cheesy sci-fi soundtrack, and the director commenting on the actors, the filming, and the oddities that don't make any sense (like how player deaths were just footage accidentally left in, or how much the prop guy hated having to re-build all of the crates that got smashed.)  The gameplay was fun, challenging at times, but not really tough on normal difficulty.  There were optional collectibles, weapon upgrades, basics skills, and special abilities.  The story has you climbing a massive, massive tower that goes from ground level to orbit, and at any point you can look down and see the entire thing, or even jump off and fall all the way down to any point you'd been at previously, landing with your trusty jetpack at the last second (and you could always teleport back.)

They pull off the B movie schtick brilliantly.   The VHS effects really work, and the look is spot-on.  The 'monsters' you fight are obviously guys stuck in a rubber suit, and if anything flies you can clearly see the wires.  When larger monsters appear, they're animated in such a way that they look like the were filmed using stop-motion photography.  You carried two melee and two ranged weapons from a large selection, all typical fun sci-fi nonsense (including one blaster that was obviously an electric razor, and one gun that was a small vacuum.)

My only real complaints were that the last chapter's narrative kind of went off the tracks, and that some of the special abilities were never really communicated to the player (I still don't know exactly what the big bubble thing that everyone had actually did.)  It was a little too easy at times, but again, I played on normal.  It was still tough enough that boss fights required some effort, but never to the point of being dull or frustrating.  It was the perfect length for that, too, being maybe 4-5 hours.  Any longer and it would have gotten tedious, but it was fine for that length of time.

Not a perfect game, but a ton of fun and a great setting.  Maybe a 7.5/10.

33073378.review:
This game is a big love-letter, campy tribute to old, old movies. However, as a game, I would say it's very reminiscent of game design and 'game feel' from the early 2000s. You know the kinds; really loose in terms of combat and platformer. It plays like Psychonauts, at times, like Voodoo Vince or Blinx the Cat, and I'm not totally sure that it's intentional. There are many weapons, most of which either feel the same in terms of damage output, or are incredibly similar even in term of usage (some melee weapons feel like clones of others)

But what I am sure of, is that this is a parody game at its heart. I laughed a fair amount of times. I did about the minimum amount of things required to finish the game, which took me just over three and a half hours.

If you love old campy movies from the 50s - 70s, and can get this game for under 5 bucks, I will say you'll enjoy the heart of it, but don't expect a totally enjoyable 'game'.

32326086.review:
[b]The Good[/b]
[list]
[*]the b-movie art direction is just perfect and never got old for me; every weapon, every character, every enemy and even every single platform is made to look like something out of a low budget sci-fi flick from the 50's or 60's, and it all ties in nicely with the game's premise of it all actually being a movie
[*]jumping off of the previous point, the fake "director's commentary", which serves as both meta humor fuel and actual narration, is mostly entertaining (though there are exceptions; see further below) 
[*]three playable characters, one of which is a chunky "Robby the Robot"-style robot, which brought tears of joy to my eyes
[*]creative enemy designs and a very diverse beastiary 
[*]the actual world/level design is more complex, intricate and unique than I initially expected; the *entire game* is literally one massive towering structure that the player is constantly ascending, and while this isn't exactly a novel concept on paper, Deadly Tower's execution of it results in a very unusual sense of ascension and vertical progression, because everything is one big seamless piece; if you want, you can climb all the way to the top and then let yourself drop all the way down to the bottom again, and it will be one long, consistent fall, completely uninterrupted by load times or level transitions
[*]some minor exploration elements; while this game is fairly linear, you can stray from the beaten path at times and look for "collectathon" extras and upgrade materials
[*]a very broad and very fun selection of ludicrous space weapons, both melee and range; among my favorites are a tentacle whip, a black-hole shooter and a frog-shaped gun that shoots swarms of homing radioactive flies
[/list]

[b]The Not So Good[/b]
[list]
[*]while I appreciate the whole idea of the director's commentary and the voice acting, it actually can get a bit annoying and distracting at times, especially when the man decides to crack a long-winded joke right in the middle of a hectic action sequence; plus, some jokes just fall flat
[*]the game expects you to do at least a little bit of jumping on occasion, which is a shame, because any kind of precise platforming is borderline impossible from this zoomed-out perspective; you get a greenish glowing effect beneath your character to help you better judge distances and heights while in the air, but it's still an awkward affair most of the time; the platforming was definitely my least favorite aspect of the game
[*]the camera and aiming system are not always your friends; you do not have full control over either, which can lead to frustration when you're trying to aim at something that's clearly within your (the player's) field of vision, but somehow still outside the character's aim
[*]the music is quite good and appropriate, but tragically repetitive; there is one theme in particular that you'll likely end up hating halfway through the game due to its constant repetition
[/list]

[b]Overall[/b]
"The Deadly Tower of Monsters" is a fun little diversion that banks it all on the player loving the humor and the undeniably well-executed b-movie style just enough to overlook some shortcomings in the design. This certainly did pay out in my case, as I've often found myself enjoying the movie references, the jabs at b-cinema and just the game's overall art direction, which is consistently on point and never truly runs out of ideas, moreso than I did enjoy the actual action. Not to be misunderstood, I had some legitimate fun blasting "stop motion" dinosaurs, underpaid extras in monkey costumes and space alligators, especially with that colorful arsenal of ludicrous sci-fi weaponry, but there's still no denying that "Deadly Tower" is not an excellent action game by any means. The twin stick shooting is a bit bland, the platforming can be utterly atrocious (luckily, there are only three or four rather brief mandatory jumping sections in the game) and the camera can be a nuisance at times. Still, though, the good outweighs the bad, and so I recommend this game to anyone who's looking for some twin stick action with style, especially to those with a knack for old b-movies and low budget sci-fi.

32307852.review:
Pros:
1950s B movies are a relatively underexplored genre for video games (although there is Escape From The Planet Of The Robot Monsters, which may have been an influence on the title)
The idea of the game being a movie commentary is novel. 
There is a lot of thought gone into it with the stop motion and other effects. 

Cons
The actors playing the movie characters are intended to be bad, so I can't complain about them, but I also didn't find the actor playing the director to be very believable. 
I understand that doing a commentary making fun of an old movie is a popular thing (Mystery Science Theatre I think the yanks call it?) but unless the movie is really really unimagionabky bad I don't see the appeal of that. This movie is just plain bad, and I don't feel Inclined to play through a bad story, even if there's an ironic commentary. 
Even after I turned VHS mode off and vsync on, the game still seemed to have vsync glitches. I don't know if these are an intentional old movie effect or not so I found them annoying. 
So far the gameplay is just mindless button mashing. 

I'm undecided so will give it another chance if I can fix the vsync.

32178905.review:
Rating: 7.5/10
Overview: Top down shooter 

The Good: 
+  A funny premise where you play in a campy 1970’s B movie filled with robots, aliens, dinosaurs and monkeys along with directory commentary to provide some humor. 

+ Plenty of melee and range weapons that can be upgraded by finding blue, silver and gold cogs scattered throughout the game 

+ The overall level design is cool. You start at the very bottom and work your way up the tower. You can also jump off and skydive and reach hidden platforms below

+ Good enemy variety 

The Average:
+/-  A short adventure lasting anywhere between 3-5 hours.

+/- Camera can be a bit problematic at times

+/- The overall gameplay doesn’t change too much so there is a somewhat repetitive feeling by the time you reach the end of the game. 

Conclusion:
A fun light-hearted game that should keep you busy for a little while. Ace makes some really creative games and this one is no different. Worth playing at a discounted price.

32090914.review:
I grew up as a kid watching Creature Doube Feature, a weekend show that'd play two horror/sci-fi films back to back.  Of course, most of the movies played came from the 50s 60s and 70s, which is how I came to love Godzilla, the Forbidden Planet, and a host of other B movies.

I saw this game advertised, and thought it looked a little silly.  As I watched the videos, though, I decided it looked awesome; the right blend of self-deprecating humor, action and nostalgia.  I made the purchase - and I'm glad I did.  The running commentary (as you play the game) between the director and the sound engineer recording it is inspired.  The developers/designers put some serious thought into entertaining the gamer, and they ended up making a game I never would have thought I'd enjoy as much as this.

You can play one of three characters, and can switch them back and forth throughout the play-time.  One thing to be aware of is that unlike the weap[ons you pickup throughout the game (which can be used by all characters), the special abilities apply only to the character who discovered them.  It's a tiny inconvenience at worst, but it does give each character more flavor than the differences between the voice actors and some graphics.

There's some overlap between missions/quests and game achievments, which I thought was a bit odd/lazy - but this game is hardly the only one to do that.  While there's action, the game is more of a puzzler than an action/shooter.  I've found that playing on hardmode makes it a good challenge.  The graphics bring the nostalgia to life, and on my system they do the game justice, cartoony lush and fun

I love this game, but I sorta doubt that this kind of genre has legs.  Instead, it has the feel of being original/unique, and something that an imitatation would invariably screw up.

Bottom line: fun and casual and full of references to the kind of stuff I loved as a kid.  Well-worth the purchase :)

La trama (che si porta a termine in 4/5 ore circa) è volutamente molto semplice e banale in quanto vuole mettere in primo piano i continui commenti del regista e del suo aiutante, molto spiritosi, l'intero gioco, come piace a me, è ricco di citazioni ad altre opere. Il gameplay non è nulla di innovativo ma con delle trovate molto carine.

32035060.review:
Despite the occasionally clunky controls and unruly camera, I can't help it I loved this game.  It legitimately felt to me as though I were playing a B-movie and I as the player was present in the sound booth where the obnoxious director was telling horrifically hilarious anecdotes of his time on the set.  How you will feel will depend on how forgiving you are to a game in which you can kill a claymation Apatosaurus with a lightsaber while the director says he didn't believe the scientists who said they were carnivores.  To me, a few missteps in gameplay and interface are forgivable if the concept is unique, the dialogue is well-written, and it all looks and sounds great.  The Deadly Tower of Monsters isn't a great work of art that will shake the medium of video games for years to come, but if you like meta-humor, hammy actors, and the B-movies of yesteryear, this may be a game for you.  It's a fun romp through a movie I really wish was real, and when you've played it you will wish that too.

Pros:  
+ Hilarious writing
+ Great Weapon selection
+ B-Movie Aesthetic
+ Epic feeling of the Tower

Cons:
- Clunky controls
- Erratic camera
- Lackluster survival mode

Read the full review here:  https://www.keengamer.com/article/16368_the-deadly-tower-of-monsters-review

31854368.review:
Un titolo che parte da un'idea originale e che fa dell'ironia, dello sfondamento della quarta parete e dell'ambientazione fanta-vintage la sua forza. 

In pratica ci troveremo a seguire il processo di rimasterizzazione su DVD di un vecchio cult di fantascienza, a metà tra il Pianeta Proibito e Flash Gordon, ma di fattura più trash Asylum ed economico, con tutte le ingenuità del tempo e le trovate immaginabili di un prodotto di serie C. Oltre a seguire i commenti fasulli e cinici del vecchio regista, chiamato per aggiungere degli extra audio al prodotto, dovremo impersonare durante il riepilogo delle riprese del tempo, i tre protagonisti del film; un esploratore dal nome vincente, una principessa scorbutica e un robot dalla camminata rumorosa. Durante il percorso parleremo con qualche evoluto schiavo scimmia e raccoglieremo armi da mischia e da fuoco che potranno essere potenziate raccogliendo e spendendo  ingranaggi. Tali ingranaggi si dividono prevalentemente in 3 specie, quelle blu per lo più perse da alcuni nemici sconfitti e da alcuni vasi/casse distruttibili, quelle argentate posizionate in punti di medio-facile accesso e quelle dorate, utili per massimizzare l'equipaggiamento e poste in punti meno notabili e più difficoltosi, a cui per accedere dovremo spesso ritornare sui nostri passi dopo aver ottenuto un potere sbloccabile con l'esperienza accumulata. Tutto ciò che di spendibile guadagneremo nel gioco necessiterà delle apposite stazioni per essere utilizzato. L'apparecchiatura  gialla e verde serviranno per potenziamenti e cambiamento delle armi, quella blu, che simboleggia una camera criogenica permetterà di cambiare personaggio, mentre quella rossa, un pò meno presente rispetto alle altre, di spendere i punti guadagnati dalla lotta, in aumento vita - energia - danno. 

Oltre alle armi, varie più d'aspetto che d'efficacia, lasciata tra l'altro alla scoperta del giocatore viste le descrizioni buffe e la mancanza di parametri veri e propri, saremo dotati di alcuni poteri che andranno ad espandersi durante l'avventura. Questi poteri sono fondamentalmente l'unica cosa, eccetto qualche dialogo pilotato a prescindere dal personaggio in uso, a distinguere realmente la scelta tra i tre personaggi giocabili. Ad esempio il robot potrà dare una scarica elettrica per aprire alcune porte, la donna potrà accelerare per andare contro corrente coi pavimenti mobili e l'uomo potrà piazzare mine per distruggere alcune barriere.  Questi descritti sono i tre poteri più rilevanti, ma non gli unici, vi sono anche possibilità di rallentare il tempo intorno al personaggio o di creare una barriera difensiva, ma vista la resistenza e la facilità generale non li useremo granché.

Il gameplay ci offirà poi, oltre all'action-platform di base, anche delle micro sfide con attraversamento di anelli in caduta libera e raccoglimento di pellicole collezionabili.

L'esplorazione della torre e dei suoi dintorni ci richiederà di tornare spesso sui nostri passi, ma ciò verrà agevolato oltre che da una struttura verticale semplice, anche dal teletrasporto, disponibile fin da subito premendo il tasto Select. Esso ci permetterà di selezionare uno dei punti di controllo, rappresentati da una grande antenna parabolica, che avremo attivato col nostro semplice passaggio. Superfluo dire che saranno generosamente sparse per la mappa.  

Riguardo al tipo di nemici che ci troveremo pian piano davanti a noi, sarebbe un peccato entrare nel dettaglio e rovinare la sorpresa, mi limito a dire che sono abbastanza vari per specie e grandezza e incoerenti nell'insieme. A parte rari casi non necessiteranno di tattiche particolari nonostante la differenza di numero, del resto anche i mega boss non brillano per pattern d'attacco, che comunque sarebbe ostico soddisfare visti i nostri movimenti non esattamente al top della reattività e con un Jetpack di scarsa durata e spinta.

Il finale è a suo modo geniale e adatto a tanta assurdità.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters è un prodotto che ho gradito molto, nonostante i suoi grossi limiti, spero che più avanti l'idea venga ripresa con una maggiore ampiezza della struttura ed un comparto tecnico superiore, in ogni caso lo consiglio caldamente.

31838933.review:
Quel pied!
Tout fan de films de série B et/ou de vieux films de SF se doit de jouer à ce jeu. Les références sont innombrables, chacun y retrouvera avec plaisir les siennes en fonction de ses gouts et films visionnés. C'est aussi bourré d'humour et de second degré (mises en abîme multiples).
Les contrôles sont au top, le bestiaire varié et drôle. Le fait de pouvoir incarner 3 personnages différents avec chacun leur spécificité et pouvoir spéciaux est bien pensé. Pas besoin de refaire le jeu (mais on peut, hein!) avec un autre perso une fois fini, on passe régulièrement par des checkpoint où l'on peut changer de perso en fonction du niveau et des besoins. La verticalité des niveaux apporte des éléments de jeu nouveaux et intéressants (cibles à trouver et descendre, chute et cerceaux, certains endroits accessibles qu'en chutant du haut de la tour, etc...)
La difficulté est plutôt facile (mais il y a aussi un niveau hard et un mode survival qui est assez velu).
Niveau durée de vie, c'est assez court mais chaque seconde est un pur bonheur!!!
The Deadly Tower of Monsters est une excellente surprise et je le recommande les yeux fermés!

31823782.review:
Pour apprécier The Deadly Tower of Monsters, il faut avoir un minimum de culture cinématographique concernant les films de science-fiction des années 50-60 et de la série B. Sans cela, le jeu perd 80% de son intérêt tant les développeurs ont voulu faire du jeu un véritable hommage au genre.
En effet, TDTM raconte l'histoire du tournage d'un film de série B ou Z sf de cette période. Tout l'univers se base sur ce concept avec des personnages clichés à souhait et ultra kistch. Les monstres sont animés comme à l'époque ou sont designés comme des acteurs portant un costume. L'effet VHS (désactivable) renforce cet aspect. De ce point de vue, les graphismes sont de bonne qualité.
Les développeurs ont poussé le délire très très loin avec le réalisateur du film qui fait un commentaire audio durant tout le jeu. C'est souvent drôle même si parasité par les phases de gampelay. Et oui, cela reste un jeu d'action typé beat them all. Quand il faut castagner du vilain, c'est un peu difficile de suivre ce que le réalisateur peut dire sur le tournage fictif.

Côté gameplay, il fait le minimum syndical à savoir que ça ne casse pas trois pattes à un canard. Ultra classique malgré l'enrobage assez délirant avec des armes toutes plus débiles les unes que les autres. Il existe aussi la possibilité d'améliorer lesdites armes (corps à corps et distance), ainsi que les personnages jouables. Ils sont au nombre de trois et seuls des pouvoirs spécifiques à chacun obligeront le joueur à en changer pour avancer. Dommage.

Le déroulement du jeu tire parti du fait que le joueur doit escalader une tour. La verticalité est utilisée pour pouvoir tirer vers le bas et même chercher des petits bonus ou collectibles. Le souci vient plus du fait que le jeu est composé d'arênes et la progression se limite trop souvent à une porte fermée qui se débloquera quand tous les ennemis de la zone seront éliminés. Il y a quelques bonnes idées comme des téléporteurs, le jetpack et la possibilité de se téléporter quand une chute arrive malencontreusement.
Le bestiaire est assez fourni même si les armes sont tellement pétées qu'ils offrent peu de résistance. Les boss sont un peu plus coriaces. Leur look réussi ne parvient à cacher le manque d'intérêt de les combattre.

Les musiques collent parfaitement à l'ambiance du jeu et la durée de vie d'environ 5H sans trop se presser. La durée de vie est un peu rallongée artificiellement à cause de checkpoints pas toujours bien placés qui obligent à refaire certains passages lourdingues et se coltiner de nouveau les phases de dialogues même s'il y a la possibilité de les accélérer.

En résumé, les développeurs ont poussé le délire très très loin (La fin est un modèle du genre) et c'est ce qui sauve le jeu parce que le gameplay est vraiment trop basique. Je conseillerais aux joueurs qui sont prêts à se laisser prendre au jeu tout en étant capable de faire abstraction de la partie jeu justement. 
Personnellement, j'ai apprécié ce délire qui va jusqu'au bout de son idée et se permet quelques petites piques bien senties au passage.

31787121.review:
This games biggest problem are its battle mechanics. Even though there is a big variety of weapons and special abilities, they do not really matter because the enemies are just too easy to kill and too predictable in their movements.

That said, the gameplay does not feel bad in any way. Controls are very fluent and satisfying. Survival mode also shows that the game could have been more challenging in Story mode if the game would throw a greater variety of enemies against you.
Battle therefore is very easy but not annoying although can get boring after a while. But then just do a pause.

The main draw of the game is obviously its presentation and it is truly superb. It looks good, it sounds good and its funny.

If you are a fan of old monster movies and you like brawlers and hack&slash and you have no problem with the low difficulty this is a wonderful game and most certainly worth a buy.

31781822.review:
This is pretty much Mystery Science Theatre 3000, the Game. If you're the type that loves laughing along to cheesy sci-fi films, as well as have a chance to play through the film and beat up tons of stop-motion monsters, you will enjoy it. 

The tower itself is impressively huge, and free-falling from the very top is extremely satisfying to me. The whole game has lots of good jokes about sci-fi movies and movie-making in general. (my favorite gag is when the director commentary talks about sloppy camerawork, and you can see a giant fingerprint glaring through the lens flares.)

However, the gameplay is rather lacking. The game can be finished in a handfull of hours with relatively little effort, and the ending leaves hardly any replay value. Many of the features in this game (switching between characters, unlocking powerups, grindign for pieces to upgrade weapons, ect.) led me to believe that this game was much longer than it actually is, so most of these features come off as half-baked,

The fun factor for this game lies with the commentary and self-aware cheesiness of the "plot", but the gameplay is little more than a beat-em-up

I had this game on my Wishlist since I saw it back in Early Access.  I watched with glee as I saw them announce local co-op.  The only reason I did not buy it is because I had a a big back-log of games both in my library and in my Wishlist, plus a nagging fear the game was a great "game experience" wrapped around medicare "gameplay".

When I saw it on discount on Humble Bundle it made me finally jump.

Well I'm sad to say that my fear is real.  While I applaud the developers for making a wonderful and unique experience crafted with great love, ultimately what we have under the great experience is a buggy beat-em-up that won't stop crashing.

I was prepare to thumbs-up the game even though it isn't all that riveting, but the fact that it keeps crashing on a fresh legal Win 7 64 bit installation really turns me off.  I feel that publishers are too eager to deploy to multiple platforms without taking proper care to port them and I think that explains the crashing and overall poor graphical performance.

31751501.review:
Remember the movies with the top notch special effects from the 50s (e.g. "They came from out of space")? No? Never mind, now you get to play the game of the film, sort of. This is a 3D top down type shoot-em-up/beat-em-up (someone somewhere has problably spent ages making up a genre name for this) set in a 50s style sci-fi movie. This allows the developers to keep the graphics effects to a minimum to replicate the 50s movie theme and this should run on just about anything, including those computers from the 50s that took up a whole builidng.

Funny at times, but there are also times where it probably tries a little too hard and the game isn't quite as funny as the writers think/hoped. It is also fairly short, you can complete the whole thing in around 5 hours and although you probably won't pick up all of the achievements in one run through, unless you are an achievemet nut you probably won't be bothered to do another run through to mop up any missed achievements. 

The game probably could have done with a little more polish but with all said and done, a worthwhile addition to your collection. Better if you can pick it up when on sale for a few pounds, but if you like this type of game, few will complain if paying full price.

31714895.review:
¿Amante de las viejas películas y series de ciencia ficción? Puede que hayas encontrado una gemita para tu total disfrute.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters es un sencillo juego que mezcla acción con plataforma y comedia; y tiene una ligera sensación a arcade que se intensifica en el segundo de sus modos, pero vamos por partes.

El juego es relativamente corto, me tomó unas cinco horas completarlo, aunque no con todos los logros (lo que sin una guía, asumo me tomará varias horas extra, quizá más de las que espero). En sí es bastante fácil y no te castiga por perder, así que si buscas un gran desafío, puede que te decepciones; mas si buscas pasar un buen rato, sigue leyendo.

La idea es que estamos jugando una película de ciencia ficción de clase B, mientras el director realiza los comentarios para el DVD. Así que tendrás las voces arriba bastante seguido, si la idea no es de tu agrado, chequea videos primero para ver qué tanto te pueda o no molestar. En lo personal, lo he disfrutado mucho, más si eres amante del cine de género y notas las referencias que hacen. Verás cláramente a Flash Gordon como base, King Kong, El Planeta de los Simios, La máquina del tiempo, Star Trek (serie y pelis de J.J. Abrams), Star Wars, entre otros. Además, si has hecho algo de cine independiente, te identificarás con alguna que otra cosa.

Ya sé que dije que el juego es corto, pero puede que eso le juegue a favor (vamos, que en la Nes, Sega o SNES nos pasábamos los juegos en un par de horitas y no nos quejábamos). A lo largo de todas sus horas, el juego arroja suficiente variedad como para sentirse fresco. Los distintos actos tienen estéticas muy diferentes y los enemigos son originales y continúan introduciendo nuevos hasta el final, literalmente. Si bien mecánicamente no se distinguen demasiado unos de otros, es entretenido y agradable ver con qué se salen; tenemos desde los clásicos insectos gigantes hasta hombres reptil a lo Star Trek, perros aspiradora y mucho más.

Dijimos que acción es parte del baile, así que bien, ¿qué hay de las armas? ¿Cómo es mi arsenal para enfrentar esta torre de monstruos? Te estarás perguntando. Pues contamos con dos tipos de armas: melé y de rango. Lamentablemente las armas de melé se sienets muy parecidas entre sí. Con todas damos un par de golpes o cargamos un ataque más fuerte que podemos soltar en tierra o en el aire. No hay grandes combos ni nada parecido, tampoco propiedades que requieran usar una u otra dependiendo de la situación. No obstante, es en las pistolas donde encontramos las cosas interesantes, ahí sí cada una trae algo diferente; y aunque bien puedes usar una sola durante toda la aventura, no está de más probarlas todas y divertirte con ellas. Verás desde una rasuradora hasta una rana escupe moscas, u otras cosas no aptas para menores que no mencionaremos aquí.

El sistema de niveles con el que mejoras a los personajes (sí, tenemos tres, pero todos comparten los mismos niveles y sólo se diferencian en el diseño y dos poderes especiales) es bastante interesante; en lugar de ir con la clásica experiencia que tantos juegos implementan, The Deadly Tower of Monster ha atado el progreso de los personajes a sus achievements, así que te verás sacándolos para subir esos nivelcillos. Por cada achievement conseguido, recibirás un punto de habilidad (skill point) que podrás usar para elegir un entre 3 mejoras en cada nivel, para un total de 24.

Además, una vez que termines el juego (o antes, si quieres), puedes taclear el modo survival que promete sacar unas horitas más de entretenimiento. Este modo apenas y lo he provado, pero parece ser desafiante. Te arrojas a una arena y tienes que superar la ola de enemigos de turno. Entre ola y ola, regresas a una base en la que puedes comprar las armas y poderes que consigues durante el juego para hacer frente a las siguientes y más difíciles tandas.

Por último, puede que te lleves una pequeña sorpresa con la historia, al menos yo definitivamente no esperaba lo que era.


Entonces...

PROS:

- Una estética y diseño geniales

- Tramos de plataforma entretenidos

- Comedia

- Caceria de ítems y cosas por toda la torre, buscando ingeniosamente

- Chistosa variedad de enemigos

- Modo survival

NEUTRAL:

- Corto

- Fácil

- Local coop (misma computadora)

- Música poco destacable

CONTRAS:

- Combate algo repetitivo

- Las armas melé se sienten iguales

- Jefes mecánicamente simplotes y nada desafiantes


Espera a encontrarlo en oferta. Vale la pena,;y más si eres un fan del cine de ciencia ficción y las viejas películas.

31606084.review:
笔记本双显卡玩这游戏卡顿的同学，有可能游戏会默认使用集成显卡，请按以下方法设置：

右键桌面选择“NVDIA控制面板”--“全局设置”的“首选图形处理器”从“自动选择”改为“高性能NVIDIA处理器”
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
游戏有几个bug严重影响游戏体验：

1. 走到有地形差的地形边缘，容易卡模型，什么操作都做不了，尤其是某些boss战，明明是很简单就能打完的，睁着眼看挨打，简直就是要气炸。

2. 用手柄，在选择武器或者升级这样的界面时，按键经常无故失灵。

[strike]3. 攻击时优先选择的是距离最近的怪，无法按照威胁程度优先使用针对技能消灭特定怪，你只能调整走位优先去杀比较有威胁的怪，然而许多情况下根本没有走位的条件。[/strike]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
这个游戏流程挺短的，关卡设计重复性比较高，bug挺多。少数的亮点，一个是游戏过程中导演的评论音轨，然而并不像史丹利寓言那么容易听懂，老是盯着字幕看的话，分分钟被怪搞死，另一个是镜头效果，比如接近火焰时屏幕上的指纹。
