31551451.review:
I very rarely write reviews for games, but this is, by far, the most unique, enjoyable, humorous experience I have ever had playing a game. I believe I played for ten hours, and I didn't play a single other game until I finished this one. Moreover, I will most definitely be revisiting it soon.

Usually, when game journalists say a game has a unique story, they're just compensating for crappy gameplay and trying to elevate games to the "true artform" they wish it to be (even though every game is already clearly art). This game has it all: a story that is unheard of in the gaming universe, humor to please you endlessly, fantastic gameplay that ramps up in difficulty when you're ready, 24 different and upgradeable weapons, and a look that you just won't find anywhere else.

Basically, you are playing through a 1950's B-level sci-fi movie (with absolutely hilarious and true-to-life "commentary" from the "driector" nd his "interviewer" throughout every scene and even the menus, as if the game is actually a DVD of the "movie" through which you're playing), and the sheer creativity in what they have done with the concept is astounding.  Some of your powers are ever based on the fact that it is, in fact, a B-level sci-fi movie. You also have three unique characters you can play as at any time. You have multiple special powers, some unique to their characters and required to solve puzzles to get pieces for upgrading your equipment.

The game also has extremely enjoyable and organic-to-the-setting side-missions that you can complete for the chance to upgrade your skills and abilities. It forces you to try new tactics to defeat enemies and search every nook and cranny of the eminently treversible terrain to find all the game's secrets.

Ultimately, I give this game my highest recommendation. I've prbably bought over 400 games in my life, and I've only ever finished maybe less than a dozen of them. Not only did I finish this one, but I did it without playing any other game until I completed it!

You simply must get this game. It has everything: combat, puzzles, exploration, and everything else you expect from a triple-A game, but with the most unique aesthetic and story I have ever seen. Try it now, and reward the developers by buying it at full price (I don't know if I've ever said that before....)!

30985352.review:
This is just a brilliant game, despite my avoidance of beat-'em-ups. The jabs at low-budget studios' practices were the best bit, in my opinion. This genius was supported by the vibrant high-detailed visuals, from the shiny set design to the "post" effects.

The only downsides to this adventure are the superfluous/pace-killing shoot-down-at-enemies mechanic, as well as the lack of replayability (apart from the okay Survival mode). I absolutely loved the story, but feel that a second go would only be a slog.

I highly recommend purchasing this game to support these idiosyncratic developers, even if that means having your brother gift it to you for your birthday.

30325132.review:
An action/adventure game the way I like it. Pure fun, no frustration. One could call it 'casual', but this term is heavily used on low quality flash games nowadays. And this game is far from that. 
It excels in almost every aspect: very beautiful graphics, pleasant music, quite smooth controls, a funny narration. Full controller, local co-op support. A creative, rewarding gameplay with a variety of weapons, clearly designed for amusement purposes: extermination is just their side-effect.
Many film references and stereotypes are there, creating a feel of movie parody that adds up to the fun. Some are even intentionally twisted, like the 'gal saves guy' concept. 
Yes, it might feel short, but that's mainly because it doesn't force you play the same stage ten times all over.

A joyful experience. A new quality standard of what we should expect of indie games.

30222969.review:
Небольшая и увлекательная забавная игра на выходные, хорошо подходит для того чтобы повеселиться, понастальгировать и даже поиграть вместе со своим чадом - благо практически всё здесь проходится легко, быстро и весело.

К недостаткам можно отнести переодические фризы без причины, несколько скомканный финал, очень плохой подбор сцен для вставок сюжетных комментариев - прямо в разграр битвы или сложных акробатических номеров - и не почитать и не поиграть, а также не самое удобное управление. Стоит отметить, что отдельные моменты, свзяанные например со скоростным карабканием, проходить без джойстика очень тяжело, а джойстики от PS3 и PS4, куда более популярные чем Коробки на территории Матушки-России, игра не поддерживает. Так что, если решитесь на покупку, имейте в виду, что несколько моментов заставят грызть клавиатуру.

Из плюсов - в первую очередь стилизация и увлекательный геймплей 3D аркады! Больше удовольствие получат все, кому интересны старинные фильмы, да что-там, фильмы начало девяностых и двухтысячных с жирными пенопластовыми и зелёными приведениями, многочисленные изобретательных отсылки к всевозможным явлениям поп-фантастики: "Планета обезьян", "Марс атакует", "КингКонг" - их вы встретите только за первые 15 минут игры.  На своём пути к стратосфере на верхушку 65ти этажной башни вы встретите огромное число разнообразных припятствий - от катящихся огненных брёвен, до высокотехнологичных космических модулей. А пытаться сборосить вниз вас будет порядка полсотни видов вражин всевозможных форм и размеров: от гигантских муравьёв до щенков, засунутых в пылесос.
А если вам надоест восхождение, то поиграйте в симулятор парашютиста - прыгайте вниз и наслаждайтесь полётом, исследуя окрестности башни!

30157174.review:
How many games let you climb up from the surface of a planet, passed moons and asteroids, into space?

To fully appreciate this game you need to have some sort of knowledge about B-movies (how they were made, common tropes, etc.).  This game never takes itself seriously--in fact the most serious moment of the game is the very beginning and from there the game gets less and less serious until you reach the ending, which I found to be rather dissapointing, but at the same time absolutely genious.  The game is very smart and I would say the best spoof.

This game is particularly easy.  I only died in combat three times (all at the very end).  I died more just jumping off the tower or trying to climb the tower than I did in combat.  If you are looking for a challenge, this game is not for you, but this game is fun and very enjoyable.

I wouldn't pay the full $14.99, but if you can catch it on sale for $3.74, definately get it!

I highly recommend this game if you have fondness for its theme. No es mal juego, bastante entretenido y muy gracioso con su ambientación de película de serie B. El sistema de combate es muy simple y combina ataques cuerpo a cuerpo con armas a distancia.

A pesar de resultar divertido tiene unos cuantos problemas importantes. A veces da la sensación de no estar bien pulido en cuanto a jugabilidad. De hecho es más normal resultar herido por estar peleándote con el propio juego que con los monstruos en sí. También resulta algo corto. Te lo pasas en dos tardes o incluso en una sesión muy larga.

A favor, el desenfadado sentido del humor que tiene de principio a fin. Imita ser la edición especial de una película de culto de serie B, y el director va comentando en todo momento cosas sobre el rodaje. Que si a ese monstruo se le ven las cuerdas, que si el actor principal nunca fue bueno con las escenas de acción, que si a ese otro actor le sacaron un ojo con una de las armas de juguete. La pega es que no está doblado al español, así que quien no entienda bien el inglés de oído va a tener que gastar tiempo mirando los subtítulos en lugar de avanzando. 

6 de 10

29912414.review:
Deadly Tower's theme is its strongest attribute. However, the whole I thing was over unexpectedly quickly. Sure, you can go back for all the collectibles and achievements, or try Survival mode, but without the director commentary it quickly becomes apparent that the game is an average action experience, at best.

The characters are a bit clunky to manoeuvre, and the game-controlled camera delights in giving you the most awkward, useless angle whenever possible. I especially hated having parry and dodge roll on the same button. Missed the window on deflecting that attack? I hope you enjoy rolling into a clump of enemies instead.

Worth playing once? Sure. Just don't go in expecting an epic length story or Platinum/Sony Santa Monica quality action.

29912057.review:
First and foremost, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes science fiction. Bare in mind, however, that when I say science fiction, I mean the totally kooky, unbelievable sci-fi of yesteryear. The story, set pieces, characters, enemies, all of it will put a smile on your face as you shoot, zap, whip, bash, or whatever else you want to do through the game and up the tower. 

-Gameplay-
 The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a solid piece. It is your standard 2.5D shooter, but this game is really polished. One of my favorite parts of this game is you can tell how much the team cared when they were making it. There is a large variety of both projectile and melee weapons to become aquianted with, all of them suited to one's own playstyle. The variety is SO different that I guarantee you can find something that suits your taste. I kept getting new weapons but there was a certain foursome of weapons that I would keep going back to throughout the game because of the balance I found between them. The three-character system also works suprisingly well, and I enjoyed each of the characters. The biggest (and pretty much only) complaint I have is the bloody awful checkpoint system. Its a unique system in that it serves both as checkpoints and as teleport locations if you want to go back down and explore the tower a bit. However, either the checkpoints need to happen a bit more often or there needs to be an independent checkpoint system for boss battles. MULTIPLE times I found myself dying pretty far after I had beaten the boss on a platform and being reset at a checkpoint where I had not beaten them yet, which is INCREDIBLY frustrating after it happens a few times.

-Story-
The story in this game is really quite good. Don't get into this game expecting a narrative and a coherent plot. This game is much more about breaking the fourth wall as much as possible and poking merciless fun at every trope it can find from low budget science fiction to video games. The characters are all solid, but I would highly recommend the robot - as he is by far my favorite. My least favorite would have to be Dick Starspeed. I'm not sure why that is, I just never really got into playing as that character unless I had to.

-Music-
The music in this game is absolutely superb. All of the instruments sound clear, but the traditional science fiction soundtrack absolutely kills it. The iconic wail and warble is all there, and often times it sounds like you're watching an old episode of Star Trek. The developers absolutely NAILED the soundtrack.

-Art Direction-
Absolutely fabulous looking game. I can't really rave enough about how unique and interesting this game looks. The classic sci-fi theme is held up throughout - ranging from crocodile-headed flying men (held up by strings no less) to stop motion dinosaurs to a subtle but nice VHS effect on the screen throughout the game. 


-Overall Quality-
This game is lovingly put together. All of the pieces work in a way that makes this game a really solid experience to play through. The campaign is not very long at all, but the replayability factor is there. I played through the main game in about 6 hours. However, I have by no means seen and collected everything in the game, and I would recommend you do that if you want the full and complete experience.


-Summary-
In summary, I would highly recommend this game to both someone who is a huge fan of science fiction as well as the average gamer who is looking for a solid all-around 2.5D platformer to play with for a few hours. The campaign does not take very long, but the extra length in the game comes from searching around for collectibles and grabbing achievements. I would recommend this game at full price but I would absolutely INSIST you buy it if it was on sale. Too good to pass up.

Gameplay: 8/10
Visuals: 10/10
Audio: 10/10
Overall: 9/10

29907726.review:
[i]The Deadly Tower of Monsters[/i] è un bellissimo [i]divertissement[/i]: un omaggio al cinema di fantascienza di serie B, C (e anche Z) degli anni '50 e '60, quello girato con pochissi mezzi, con attricette semisconosciute rapite dal mostraccio alieno di turno, preferibilmente scosciate mentre l'eroe, in costume scintillante e con l'espressività di una lattuga, pronuncia battute improbabili e contemporaneamente tenta di salvare il mondo e la suddetta fanciulla. Il tutto tra fondali di cartone, ufo fatti con piatti da torta, scenari coi fili e così via. Il bello di [i]Deadly Tower[/i] però è proprio che sono questi i nemici, i fondali, le astronavi e il nostro eroe, Pipino Starspeed, è il classico eroe monolitico bidimensionale. Ad accompagnarlo nella sua avventura (costellata da innumerevoli buchi di trama - assolutamente [i]voluti[/i]) troviamo la bella Scarlet Nova, altrettanto bidimensionale quanto Pipino, e il robot... Robot! - una scopiazzatura del ben più famoso Robbie de [i]Il Pianeta Proibito[/i]. Obiettivo dei nostri eroi, sconfiggere il malvagio imperatore e il suo scienziato pazzo, che hanno invaso il pacifico pianeta di Gravoria per rubarvi le sue ricchezze. Tutto raccontato dalla viva voce del "regista" di questo capolavoro del cinema, Dan Smith, che impegnato a realizzare il commento audio del DVD del suo film in compagnia dello scazzatissimo tecnico audio Patrick, racconta aneddoti divertenti e freddure per nascondere i difetti del suo "film" e la sua cialtroneria.

Come si può vedere, il plot riflette esattamente i cliché del cinema di fantascienza ai suoi albori, e proprio in tutti questi piccoli omaggi più o meno velati a questo cinema che viene progressivamente rivalutato sta la vera forza di questa operazione: appassionati più o meno esperti si divertiranno a trovare quella tale citazione o quel particolare omaggio, il tutto corredato da una giocabilità molto divertente e mai stancante. Ognuno dei nostri tre eroi ha dei poteri speciali che diventano particolarmente utili nel superare determinate sezioni di gioco - tuttavia proprio questa parte risulta meno sviluppata, limitando l'utilizzo di questi poteri a poche, piccole sezioni - oltre che un vasto campionario di armi più o meno improbabili (un rasoio elettrico stile shotgun laser, una spada laser aggiornabile al "lato oscuro" e così via) molto divertenti da usare. I nemici sono rielaborazioni tristanzuole dei più scontati classici dell'arrangiarsi: tizi in costumi da scimmia, lumaconi e dinosauri in stop-motion, insetti che volano su fili trasparenti e tizi con maschere da mosca di cartapesta.

Il gioco forse sfugge ad una difficoltà particolarmente elevata, e non è molto lungo (completarlo con tutti gli achievement non prende più di 5 o 6 ore), perciò forse il prezzo pieno di 15€ è un po' eccessivo, ma scontato a meno di 10€ è un acquisto quasi obbligato per un piccolo gioellino indipendente veramente scoppiettante e coloratissimo. Spero in un sequel.

29901426.review:
The Deadly Tower of Monsters caught my attention from the trailer on Steam, but I figured that it was being clipped together as more interesting and funny than it really was.  I was mistaken.

The gameplay in this action-clicker is average at best, but it shines in its heart and ingenuity.  The voice actor for the director doing the audio commentary captures the character perfectly.  While I didn't do a lot of lauging out loud because I was furiously trying to keep everything from apes to dinosaurs off of me, the constant half-drunk comments were what made this game work.    Even if you die or are just standing still, the director has something to say about it.  

The "VCR" graphics overlay gives it an old crappy MST3K feel (but you can upgrade to "DVD" if that bothers you) and I loved it.

There are plenty of "extras" that you can try to achieve in the game that are littered all over the game landscape, but personally I just wanted to enjoy the main story and burn through it like I was watching the original "movie".  I don't think this is a game that could be replicated again with the same success because its charm is in its originality.

29791081.review:
[H1]Zo slecht, dat het goed is[/H1]
The Deadly Tower of Monsters is een actie/platform spel waarbij je met een arsenaal van 8 schietwapens en 8 slagwapens een mengeling van B-film monsters te lijf gaat. Het spel doet zijn best om je de illusie te geven dat je naar de DVD uitgave van een oude B-film uit de jaren 50 zit te kijken, inclusief commentaar van de regisseur en een jonge assistent. Monsters zien eruit als acteurs in een kostuum, je ziet sommige monsters aan touwtjes hangen en sommige monsters bewegen alsof ze met stop motion tot leven zijn gebracht.
TDToM probeert een hoop elementen te combineren en dat werkt slechts gedeeltelijk. Het is allemaal net goed genoeg om vermakelijk te zijn, maar het is ook duidelijk dat er veel meer uit gehaald had kunnen worden. Je hebt gedurende het spel de keuze uit drie personages. Deze spelen echter voor het overgrote deel exact hetzelfde, alleen heeft ieder personage een aantal vaardigheden die nodig zijn om specifieke puzzels op te lossen. Zo kan Dick rotsblokken opblazen, Robot kan de tijd vertragen en Scarlet kan hard rennen. Maar verder gebruiken ze dezelfde acht schietwapens en acht slagwapens. Je kunt van beide soorten slechts twee wapens bij je hebben en sommige wapens zijn effectief tegen bepaalde tegenstanders en ineffectief tegen andere, dus je moet opletten dat je een goede mix van wapens meeneemt. Jammer genoeg zijn veel wapens onderling inwisselbaar en het spel geeft alleen een vage omschrijving, dus je moet zelf uitzoeken welke wapens wanneer nuttig zijn. Om van personage te wisselen, moet je in een slaapcabine stappen, wat soms betekent dat je een stuk moet omlopen enkel en alleen om langs een bepaalde puzzel of obstakel te komen. Opwaarderen van wapens gebeurt bij een terminal en het wisselen van wapens bij een andere terminal. Dit is wat omslachtig, maar gelukkig zijn er veel terminals en slaapcabines verspreid door het spel.
Verder ontsluit je gedurende het spel teleportatieplatformen en je kunt met een druk op de knop naar ontgrendelde platformen reizen. Hierdoor kun je gelukkig snel terug naar een eerder gedeelte van het spel als je een nieuwe vaardigheid wil gebruiken om verzamelvoorwerpen te pakken die eerder onbereikbaar waren.
Zoals de naam van het spel al aangeeft, beklim je een hoge toren en je moet regelmatig omlaag mikken om tegenstanders neer te schieten. Er is ook een vaardighedenboom die je kunt ontsluiten door achievements te behalen, bijvoorbeeld door bepaalde voorwerpen te verzamelen, een bepaalde tegenstander met een bepaald wapen verslaan, bovenop 10 vijanden springen enzovoorts. In deze vaardighedenboom kun je de personages sterker maken door uit verschillende opwaarderingen te kiezen (bijv. 5% sterkere schietwapens, 5% meer gezondheid enzovoorts). Je vindt ook gekleurde tandwielen die je kunt gebruiken om de wapens op te waarderen. Sommige tandwielen zijn goed verstopt of vereisen een specifieke vaardigheid van een van de drie personages.
Al met al is het spel tot nu toe leuker dan ik had verwacht na het lezen van een aantal kritische reviews. Vergeleken met andere spellen uit dit genre (bijvoorbeeld Headlander) blinkt TDToM nergens echt in uit. Maar het weet voldoende afwisseling te bieden om niet te gaan vervelen.

29763008.review:
Upon first playing this, I was surprised at what a high quality game it is. Although checking the developer, I saw that they had made a couple of other games I really enjoyed, Zeno Clash 1 and 2 which are fantastic. 

TDToM has got a lot of polish and everything looks and feels great. There's a lot of variety in the gameplay and combat and the level design is very innovative. Since you are climbing a giant tower, at any time you can just jump over the side and plummet through the air in freefall, picking up secrets and diving through rings as you fall. Then when you hit the bottom, just teleport back up to where you jumped from. Sometimes you'll want to backtrack to access previously locked areas with a new tool or weapon - no problem, just leap over the side and hurtle towards the general direction of where you want to end up. 

The humor is pretty clever and will make you smile as you hear references to old and modern movies. The Director says some funny things and the art design is set up to look cheesy and fake. There are strings connected to the flying monsters and the robots are made from vacuum cleaner parts. 

All in all this is a very innovative and cool game. If you like top-down ARPG's like How To Survive or Torchlight, you'll love TDToM. If you're looking to play something fresh and new you'll probably like it as well.

29759214.review:
The game was fun for about 15 min because of the theme and some creativity. 
Then it became a dragged out, boring chore.
The permanent narration of the 'director' is as forced and unfunny as can be. The jokes are below average and the delivery is so cumbersome it sucks the fun out of the few good ones too.
The constant disruptions of pure gameplay with cutscenes is absurd.
The often occuring unwanted change of weapons from your chosen upgraded one to a non upgraded new one is infuriating.
Your chosen character often isn't the one used in the cutscenes which rips you out of any immersion you managed to create for yourself.
Plattforming is unprecise because of the view angle and the indirect reaction to your controller inputs.
Combat is just shoot and slash(roll), you can learn some skill if you're motivated but it's nevertheless more than enough to mindlessly press two buttons over and over to succeed.
4/10. 4 points because some ideas were interesting and creative but the execution overall is pretty bad and no gameflow ever comes up because the game constantly interupts with it's 'funny' aganda.

29076991.review:
以B级片为主题的动作游戏。如果对这类电影感兴趣，应该会很有感触。
为了营造这种效果，游戏自带模糊透镜，敌人也都是故意做成套着演出服以及模型之类，一些敌人甚至会模仿逐帧拍摄，特意做出低帧数的效果，让怀旧情怀爆满。
这也就像现在一些导演，虽然现在电影特效非常发达，仍然特意做出复古的劣质效果，以突出一个情怀的效果吧。
剧情方面，存在感几乎为0，几乎就是一个勇者斗恶龙的简单粗暴的故事，就是稍微有些不按常理出牌的地方而已。倒是结尾有点超展开，不至于让人对剧情完全没印象。
核心的玩法方面，就是类似暗黑的视角，主要的攻击方式就是近程、远程和特殊技能。虽然玩起来切切切突突突还是有些爽，但并不是一个很丰富的系统，玩久甚至有些无聊。还好，正常难度下游戏5-6小时的流程，基本可以你完全玩腻之前就通关了。
武器系统也很鸡肋，近战和远程武器每样都有八种之多，但都大同小异，升级也就外观和攻击力有所改变，感觉并没有什么升级和特意更换的必要，跟着剧情捡新武器用就好了。
人物方面也挺尴尬，男主、女主、机器人三个角色，性能差异也不大，只是需要一些专属技能来解开机关障碍才会想到换人。要说的话，机器人战斗力最强，特定的技能时间放慢和连锁闪电在途中会需要，但在战斗中也都不俗。而男主冲刺技能则比较逗逼，地雷比较被动，女主的加速技能在战斗中也没啥用。
综上所述，是一个打折时购入不错，原价买就有点贵了。还算值得入手的有意思的游戏。
哦忘了说了。游戏中的导演评论——也就是自带的解说吐槽也颇有意思，让这样一个简单的流程和剧情不至于太无聊。这样自带旁白和吐槽的设计在现在的游戏中似乎也不算少见，如《堡垒》、《史丹利寓言》、《木偶历险记》、《ICEY》、……不知道未来会不会成为一种很常见的东西。

29006717.review:
This is a really goofy game, which you will probably have guessed if you have watched the trailer. Basically it's a parody of the old sci fi/monster flicks of the 50's and 60's, with their camp stories and dodgy special effects. In fact, the game actually recreates the stop motion style animation from those old films. The effect is actually pretty good and like a lot of other stuff, really sells the premise. I normally hate effects like film grain in my games, but with this title, it's just such a part of the atmospere they are aiming for that for once I kept it on. Another amusing feature is that the whole game is themed as a commentary by the director being recorded in a studio for the upcoming release of the movie on DVD. It's pretty funny stuff and the director himself is an over the top caricature of the cliche egomaniacal self deluded Hollywood mogul. It's all pretty corny but it fits the vibe and made me smile.

I just wish the game behind everything was as good as the premise. Its pretty much standard action adventure fare. You'll collect different weapons, collect different coloured cogs with which to upgrade those weapons. You'll solved side missions that will get you skill points that you can use to upgrade basic character stats like energy and health regeneration. You'll do some basic platforming and beat the crap out of a whole ton of monsters. There are some basic puzzles, some of which can only be solved by one of the three playable characters/ None of it is actually bad, its just not anything you haven't done in  other games before. I think it just feels like more of a shame because the premise begs for a more solid gameplay experience. It never really rises above okay. Probably the best and most unique part of it is climbing the tower itself. The tower really goes way way up, and you can jump off and pretty much fall all the way off back to the ground levels where you started without seeing a single loading screen (And to get some secrets, you will have to). This really adds to the tower's sense of scale and is definitely a highlight.

I do recommend this game if you dig the theme. I had fun with my playthrough, but I couldn't help wishing for a more unique gameplay experience.

7 out of 10

28892122.review:
I like it.  It's a bit too over-the-top at times (the director can get a little annoying with his commentary) but overall this is quite an enjoyable action game.  The B-grade sci-fi movie trope is a lot of fun, and while the jokes are juvenile at times, it wasn't enough to make me dislike the game; But do expect to groan loudly at the purile humor.

I very much enjoyed the ability to upgrade weapons and character traits, and while most of the powers were underutilized (most of the time being used as plot-drivers, ie: Need ability X to cross here), they were varied enough to give you some relief from using the same tactics over and over.  It was possible to mix it up and that's fun.

The vertical component to this game coupled with the open-world-like map feels great and helps the game from wearing out its welcome too soon.  Back tracking is necessary if you want to unlock everything, but a liberal spread of teleporters and the ability to teleport back to a ledge you fell off of makes this fairly painless.

The downside?  The camera.  You have no control over it and at times it feels like the camera is out to get you.   The first problem is that it can pick strange angles to view the action, but mostly what got to me is how slow it transients when you are falling.  For example, some of the jumps required strict timing, and when you leap into the air and the camera sort of pauses before adjusting -- and does so at a leisurely pace -- it would mean I'd miss something or crash into a pipe or ledge I had no idea was there.  This becomes particularly frustrating when you're looking for secrets;  I spent most of my time just trying to trick the camera into showing me something so I could learn if it held a secret or not.

The game also feels a little too easy, but the developers have a Hard Mode (I recommend enabling if it you're a vet of twin-stick action games like this) and a Survival Mode to offset that.

A very solid game worth about 10 hours of play, with an enjoyable tongue-and-cheek subject matter and enough hidden secrets to make you want to take your time and really get to know the world.  I recommend it.

28822339.review:
I recieved this as a gift and had zero initial expectations, but was warmly surprised by its playfulness and detail. It's an absolute delight!

The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a third-person action game based on the styles of early b-movie sci-fi. The gameplay is in fact meant to be a tape of one of those early films that is now being narrated over by the Director for an audiotrack on some 'upcoming DVD release'. This means there are regular gags, motifs, and dialogue based on the assumption that your gameplay is all part of some 1950's movie set. It's humorous and engaging.

The campaign focuses mostly on climbing the Deadly Tower of Monsters! which is an insanely tall tower reaching from sea-level up into space. Each section of the tower is themed after a different sub-genre of b-grade sci-fi, and one of the things I appreciated most was how thorough the game was with its art direction. The game touches on a lot of instantly recognizable genres with instantly recognizable costumes, weapons, and creatures/enemies.

The game is on the fence for me as to whether it holds much replay value in the campaign. The gameplay is short, but it's an appropriate length for the simple combat mechanics. There is an accompanying survival mode and a set of non-trivial but easily attainable achievements which will likely keep your attention for a short while after the campaign.

As a minor criticism, the weapon system, while just as beautiful and humorous as the rest of the game, is mostly superficial. There are some different effects of using different weapons, but for the most part there are only two weapon types and the late game weapons are only moderately more deadly than the early game versions. This becomes most obvious in survival mode. The weapon system however does incentivize you to explore the map for upgrade parts, and in that regard is a wise design decision as it introduces the player to more of the map, but it does little to make combat more interesting.

Many of the negative reviews are critical of the 'Director Commentary'. I personally found it an entertaining and welcome edition to the game. I felt that it added a lot of flavor to the milieu. The humor is very tongue-in-cheek though, which I appreciate is not everyone's cup of tea.

Do I recommend The Tower of Deadly Monsters? Absolutely, 100%, if you enjoy playful humor and retro-futurism I wholeheartedly recommend this game!

28771369.review:
The Deadly Tower of Monsters è un bel gioco che si basa su un concetto molto originale, saremo infatti chiamati ad impersonare uno dei protagonisti di un film di avventura fantascientifica in stile anni '50 del quale si sta preparando il commento audio del regista in occasione dell'uscita dello stesso in edizione DVD. Dunque ci troveremo catapultati in un mondo fittizio fatto di alberi di plastica e di creature riprese in stop motion nel quale ci muoveremo cercando di venire a capo della situazione. Come il regista stesso dice, la forza del titolo sta soprattutto nell'azione, infatti la storia del gioco è sostanzialmente un sottofondo, non la fa mai da padrona (tranne forse nell'ultima parte), tuttavia non se ne sente né la mancanza né una vera necessità.
Fondamentalmente il gioco lo si potrebbe definire una sorta di hack 'n' slash atipico con elementi platform e da top-down shooter, dove la frenesia viene in larga parte attenuata per lasciare un respirio più ampio all'espolorazione degli ambienti, la quale, come il nome stesso lascia presagire, avviene soprattutto verticalmente.
L'esperienza di gioco è sostanzialmente un grosso omaggio al cinema fantascientifico dei decenni passati, senza disdegnare anche citazioni e riferimenti ai B-movie più famosi divenuti cult nel corso degli anni, il tutto condito dal simpatico umorismo del regista che ci accompagnerà lungo tutta l'opera.

Il titolo non è affatto pesante, il gioco scorre liscio e l'avventura procede fluida e senza intoppi di sorta. In sé, il tutto è semplice sia nel gameplay che nella difficoltà, infatti nemmeno la modalità Hard è poi davvero così difficile, inoltre l'esperienza di gioco, nonostante la già citata semplicità, risulta piacevolmente variata.
Probabilmente la giocabilità del titolo si adatta meglio ad un gamepad piuttosto che alla combinazione di mouse e tastiera che ho usato per cimentarmi con l'avventura, tuttavia, devo comunque ammettere che non ho avuto particolari problemi una volta fatta l'abitudine al sistema di movimento e ai vari tasti.

Il gioco è, appunto, molto bello e lo consiglierei senza troppi indugi, tuttavia non è esente da difetti, il titolo infatti presenta due pecche in particolare, la prima, e più grave, è la telecamera di gioco che è perlopiù dinamicamente controllata dal sistema (il giocatore può a malapena aggiustarne un po' l'angolazione) e in diverse situazioni non è ben gestita e fa storcere il naso spostando l'inquadratura in modo poco amichevole nei confronti del giocatore, talvolta volutamente, e ci sta, talaltra proprio casualmente e lì, pur trattandosi di una realtà che si fa più frequente in alcuni punti dell'avventura rispetto ad altri (grossomodo tre quarti del gioco, per esempio, è più evidente) da abbastanza fastidio.
La seconda pecca, sicuramente meno grave della prima, ma comuque fastidiosa, consiste proprio nei commenti del regista o, meglio, nei sottotitoli dei commenti del regista, perché purtroppo il gioco non dispone di un doppiaggio in italiano e l'espediente principe su cui si basa il titolo fa leva proprio sul fatto che il regista del film commenti quanto accade a schermo mentre noi giochiamo, pertanto, o si ha una conoscenza tale dell'inglese da poterlo ascoltare, capire e contestualizzare mentre si è concentrati sull'azione di gioco, oppure si sarà costretti o a prendere un po' di botte (in genere non grave, per carità) per leggere i sottotitli o a glissare sugli stessi perdensodi così i divertenti retroscena del film, il che sarebbe un peccato visto che la pecualirità del gioco è proprio quella.
Parlando di traduzioni, per quanto sia una bella citazione sia tardo altomedievale che tolkieniana, tradurre il nome del protagonista, in questo caso da Dick * a Pipino, non è stata necessariamente una genialata, anche se, in fin dei conti, l'effetto, visto il disuso del nome proprio in questione, è coerente con lo spirito umoristico del titolo, e in questo contesto può ancora andar bene, ma, ad esempio, tradurre Dick * Tracy in Pipino Tracy sarebbe, in altri termini, quantomeno ridicolo :D

Inoltre, il gioco, per quanto dichiaratamente non pensato per essa, dispone anche di una modalià co-op locale fino a 4 giocatori, nella quale il giocatore 1 è il protagonista e viene seguito dalla telecamera, che fornisce una divertente alternativa alla modalità di gioco single player, in più è disponibile una modalità Survival, nella quale il giocatore deve affrontare ondate di nemici vieppiù numerose e difficili all'interno di un'arena, guadagnando oro per acquistare, nell'hub tra un match e l'altro, le armi e abilità del gioco per poter sopravvivere meglio e proseguire con le ondate.

* Edit del 16.10.2017: Ho notato soltanto ora che Steam ha infelicemente censurato l'equivoco nome proprio del nostro eroe e del grintoso poliziotto con l'impermeabile giallo degli anni '30.

28632241.review:
Some games are bad, some games are good, some are so good you just feel that you have to tell everyone around about them. Especially about such games like DToM which are unfairly unknown to the wide audience.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters is one of my best purchases in Steam in all times.

It's hard to describe its genre: it's a platformer + hack'n'slash + metroidvania. Set in a sci-fi B-movies setting with odd but amusing plot. But the most brilliant thing in this game is its concept:

there is a high, INSANELY HIGH tower, and you have to reach the top of it. It has different sections with unique enemies, challenges and platforms, but at the same time the whole tower is a single solid level. You can always go back without any loadings. At any time you can just jump off the tower and reach any section of it you've already passed (to unlock items and gain collectibles with the help of new characters and their skills) and then just teleport back and make your way to the top! It's just absolutely mind-blowing to watch how you start from the ground and end up in space among planets and stars. And you can always jump down, fly for couple of minutes and safely land with your jet pack. Absolutely genius idea!

Music is great, voice acting is awesome, retro movie style is provided with the help of different effects like film grain, claymation style animated monsters... everything to make you feel you are in a 60's sci-fi B-movie.

Do you know that feel of being bored in the last part of most games? When you just can't wait for the game to end? Playing DToM I didn't even notice how the time passed and suddenly the credits began. Finishing the game took me 7 hours and I really felt like I need more. Completing all achievements with the one from Survival Mode took me 2 hours more. By the way, achievemеnts are rather easy to unlock and some of them are pretty fun.

I would recommend this game to everyone. If you seek some fresh entertaining experience this is definitely your choice. You can even buy this game at full price to support the devs. I heard that this game was free in PSN and it's really sad that corporations like EA or Activision get tons of money for their generic AAA crap while really talented studios get nothing for their work. 

Bravo, ACE Team! Amazing work! I am really looking forward to the sequel!

28037099.review:
This is a little gem of a game where the isometric 3D shooting and fighting and platforming isn't that innovative but the sheen on the game is clearly a labour of love.

    The premise of the game is that this is a schlocky 1950s sci fi movie undergoing a DVD release with a director's commentary.  So the entire artwork for the game uses the most modern technology to duplicate sub Harryhausen stop motion animation.  This is great fun and during the course the game there is barely a cliche from the genre that doesn't get thrown at you.  I can't over state how much the overall look and feel of the game adds to it.

   Gameplay is good.  For most of the game it's not the most challenging so you rarely get stuck for very long anywhere in the game.  There's one of the later monsters that becomes tough because it is only vulnerable from the rear and nearly at the end there's a tricky platforming session where even the guy on the Let's Play video has to have three goes at it.  The layout is incredibly linear for the most part taking place on a narrow staircase leading up the tower but there is the odd location where I've had to backtrack to complete another section of the game to maintain onward progress.  Pay attention to instructions where given and if you find yourself at a rocket you can't activate retreat backwards to the large platform below you and go through another exit to find one of the best series of scenes in the game.  You have the choice from part way through the game of playing as the rather wooden All American hero, the blonde bombshell Emeror's daughter, or the man in a suit style robot.  They have unique special abilities and sometimes you'll need to use one rather than the others to progress.

   The inventory and upgrade screens don't have the visual imagination of the main game.

   This game is as far from shovel ware as it's possible to get.  A clear labour of love the developers love for the genre they are parodying comes across in every scene and the director's commentary keeps the game fresh even when gameplay doesn't vary that much.  Definitely worth buying when it goes on sale.

S.x.

28011958.review:
[h1]Captains Log, 23.11.2016[/h1]
Setting sail for uncharted waters! Destination:  [b]The Deadly Tower of Monsters [/b]. Have you ever watched old sci-fi movies that were made on a tight budget? Do you know “Mystery Science Theater 3000”? Yes? Then continue to read, please. If you don´t know what I am talking about – consider this: You are about to enter a world of far beyond silly and very questionable humor. Continue at your own risk!  

[h1]First look at the game: [/h1][url=https://www.twitch.tv/captn3mo/v/103205120]also available as VOD on twitch[/url]
The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a beat´em up game in a Flash Gordon Setting with borderline MST3K Humor. Need I say more? Of course!:
[list]
[*]There are many things I cannot say in this review without spoiling the game to death. Just add “silly” to all things I write. 
[*]You start the [spoiler]silly[/spoiler] game with one [spoiler]weird[/spoiler] character from a 3rd person perspective view that automatically adjusts and follows you. In a [spoiler]loopy[/spoiler] good way. You can unlock 2 more [spoiler]silly[/spoiler] characters throughout the [spoiler]harebrained[/spoiler] story.
[*]You follow a [spoiler]weird[/spoiler] story that is presented as a movie plot and unfolds as you progress through the game. There are areas to come back to with more [spoiler]space[/spoiler] skills and [spoiler]laser[/spoiler] equipment.
[*]	You collect experience and can upgrade your [spoiler]hilarious[/spoiler] skills, your [spoiler]space[/spoiler] abilities and your [spoiler]laser[/spoiler] weapons. It is a rather limited, straightforward no options grind to upgrade. But it does not bother the player much. It feels added without much thought. But it does not hurt either.
[*]	There are secret areas in the game. Those are advertised and not really secret.
[*]	You can play this [spoiler]funny[/spoiler] weird space game in solo story-, [spoiler]gigantic[/spoiler] co-op-, [spoiler]monstrous[/spoiler] hard- and [spoiler]alien[/spoiler] survival mode. And you should go for co-op if you can. Way more fun – like in every brawler out there.
[/list]

The game is plainly and straightforward completely over the top silly and not to be taken seriously in any way. That does more good than bad. But it can hurt after too much time spent in-game. Be advised: Short sessions only! 

[h1]Look and feel and sound:  [/h1]
The Deadly Tower of Monsters has a nice cliché soundtrack, [spoiler]wonky[/spoiler] space sound effects and [spoiler]alien[/spoiler] squish sounds. But most of all [spoiler]hilarious[/spoiler] voice acting. That is the bread and butter of this game. And of course, the seamless connection of thousands of [spoiler]trash[/spoiler] sci-fi movie jokes. The controls are ok. Jumping is a little off. Luckily the automatic camera adjustment works quite well. That could have ruined the game.

[h1]Captain´s Orders: [/h1]
If you enjoy the humor of this game, you get a real treat for your ears and eyes. A lot of nodding into the direction of a multitude of movies from an era past takes place in The Deadly Tower of Monsters. If you don´t like aliens, flat jokes and trash sci-fi you really need to be a diehard beat´em up fan to enjoy this game. But if the above is answered with: Oh yes! Well….enjoy!  

[h1]Verdict: [/h1]
Cargo! Because I can enjoy the humor once in a while. The gameplay is repeating itself in a fashion that does not motivate me enough to really crave the next session though. Just a very entertaining time spent every so often – if that special mood hits me.

[h1]For more Reviews visit  [url=https://captainnemoweb.wordpress.com/]CaptNemo's Log[/url][/h1]
[h1]For Gameplay Videos and live streaming visit [url=https://www.twitch.tv/captn3mo]CaptN3mo's twitch channel[/url][/h1]

巨大な塔の最上階を目指し男女プラスロボットの3人！？を適宜に切替えて攻略しよう。難易度はやさし目の部類で、クリアするだけなら初回でも7時間程度、収集要素をYouTubeとかで見てこなしても10時間程度だろう。
武器は近接武器とビームライフルなどの遠距離攻撃武器をそれぞれ2種類ずつ装備出来る。武器強化の要素もあり。それとプラスしてYボタンで発動する固有技が各キャラクターで2つと固定技が2つの計4つのスキルが有る。
ゲームそのものは極めて普通…と言うか取り立てて難しいテクニックが要求されることは無いが、特筆すべきはやはり60～70年代のダメSF愛に溢れた（cheesySci-Fi）演出だろう。デストロイオールヒューマンズや映画のMIBファンならニヤニヤせずにはいられない。
せっかくATLASがパブリッシャーなので『完全日本語吹き替え版』を切に願うばかり。（監督役の吹替は大塚芳忠でお願いします）

27781374.review:
4 out of 5 stars -- Pleasantly surprised at the game's high quality, despite lacking certain features.

Pros: 

1) It's quite an original concept with classic anisotropic top-down style combat, similar to Enter the Gungeon (but nearly as unforgiving). 

2) The director commentary is hilarious is you like a mix between dry wit and silly humor. Imagine Fred Willard being... Fred Willard. You know that role he plays in every movie? It sounds just like him and he acts just like him. That's basically the director commenting throughout the whole game. Some other reveiwers got tired of him, but I personally loved it, so your mileage may vary.

3) The soundtrack is perfect. It sounds like it belongs in a Rick and Morty game.

4) While reminiscent of retro movies (and brilliantly so), I also got a very strong retro platformer vibe from it. The game frequently reminded me of Banjo Kazooie. It pushed a LOT of nostalgia buttons for me.

5) The style is beautiful and captures old low-production sci-fi thrillers to a T. It's extremely well done. Some monsters even move in claymation style, which I thought was a fine touch.

6) Supports 1920x1080

Cons:

1) The camera is a bit stiff. I wish you could pan it just a bit to see a little farther off the tower, since in this game you often have to jump off the tower you're climbing to get collectibles, so not being able to fully see where you're going gets to be a little tiresome. On the plus side, you can respawn up on the ledge you jumped from with a simple button press. And eventually you'll be able to see everything if you just go high enough in the tower, so it's not like the camera is barring you from getting that. 

2) This game is a lot of fun with a gamepad, but unfortunately they didn't see the need to make the buttons rebindable (keyboard users can rebind at will, don't worry). For some reason they didn't bind anything to the left trigger, which would be perfect for cycling through your specials. I'm not sure why they dropped the ball on that one. Otherwise the stock controls are pretty good, though of course rebinding buttons would be ideal.

3) Can't change the mouse sensitivity. I have no idea why they didn't include this.

4) The rings weren't programmed very well. It's hardly an issue, but it can take you out of the fun when you pass through a ring and it doesn't register. (This is more for people who have already played it).

26604550.review:
Have you ever wanted to play a B-Movie?  This game gives you the opportunity.

Altus/Ace have perfectly captured the environment and overall vibe of low budget science fiction movies in the middle of the last century's American Cinema.

The game is built using the Unreal Engine, so all the capability of it's graphical system is present.  However the presentation is different from typical unreal game, instead of a first-person or third-person view point, TDTOM is played from a third-person isometric perspective that can shift when needed.  (During jump/freefall sequences in particular)  
I feel that's one of the game's strongest points..  it feels stunning visual sense, as you continue to play you really get a sense of the height of the Tower.  At any given moment the players jump off the ledge and free fall all the way to the surface.  There's a wonderful sense of vertical space to the game, I feel that the level design is imaginative and quirky.  Incorporates physical puzzles, a bit of platforming, and character specific obstacles.  The setting never left me bored.
In addition to an interesting overall design scheme, the game has two choices for post-processing of the overall visual aesthetic.  "DVD or VHS", I played the game using both.  In "DVD" the visuals are pristine and crisp, giving the player the feeling that they are looking down at a live diorama starring yester-years fantasy of the future.  In "VHS" It Coats the experience in a veneer of nostalgia, Conjuring the atmosphere of an old CRT monitor.

The dialogue and cutscenes in the game are somewhat minimal, but what is there absolutely nails the feeling of classic Sci-fi Cinema.   it brought to mind many late nights in my youth spent watching old movies about robots and aliens on my black-and-white television.

The opinions on the next subject mixed in different reviews, but I'm going to give you my take..  throughout the game there is a running "director's commentary".  I found it to be smart funny and well written, hitting the bullseye, sounding like a has been movie director from several decades ago.
Even with a couple dozen deaths I didn't find it to be too repetitive or find myself wishing to turn it off.

The combat is fun and works well with a controller, not the highlight of the game, but enjoyable.  

There is a weapon and character upgrade system to help in your survivability toward the end of the game, along with unlockable special abilities, some of which are required to pass certain points in the progression.

If you're looking for a game that strays off the beaten path, and takes a detour to places strange and distant.  Here it is.

25999674.review:
I've never reviewed a game before, despite having hundreds of games and being a Steam member since Steam was a thing.  I'm lazy that way.  Deadly Tower of Monsters is a game worthy of promotion.

I normally find twitch-and-jerk jump-and-shoot type games boring.  This game is the sole exception.  Just the sheer goofy fun, the retrofuturism and 'googy' design, the self-referential fourth-wall breaking humor all combine into a game that is a joy to play.  And when you think you're mostly through, you find out there's a lot more to go.  When you get high enough, diving off to shoot targets, catch rings, or reach hard to achieve platforms is fun.  Well worth the price.

That's not to say there are no Cons.  The three characters are largely interchangeable.  I rarely wanted to go back to a swap station to change to another character just to get their 'special ability'.  The weapons were cool and fun, but the melee weapons were all very similar.  The ranged weapons worked differently enough that some were better for certain attacks than others.  I got through the entire game without levelling my character up more than 1/3 of the skill levels necessary, so the game lacks a difficulty level option to make opponents tougher (or easier).

If you've ever watched Flash Gordon, Buck Rogers, or any retrofuturistic video and smiled, you will like this game.

25996050.review:
'The Deadly Tower of Monsters' is a fantastic game with a very original new concept and an outstanding implementation. Slip into the role of 'D-i-c-k Starspeed', his robot 'Robot' or 'Scarlet Nova' to ..., well I'm not going to spoil the end of this game because actually, 'The Deadly Tower of Monsters' is a movie and you are the leading actor. 

A remastered version of the movie, that was filmed in the 50's or 60's and reminds of 'Planet of the Apes', 'Flash Gordon' or 'The War Of The Worlds', is about to be released on DVD and the director was asked to comment the scenes. So while you are playing the game - that is actually a movie - the director keeps talking in the background and together with the deliberately somewhat blurry and flickering graphics, flying saucers on strings and men in alien and ape costumes, this makes the game very funny.

In this top down, isometric, action, role-playing, twin-stick shooter you have to fight your way up an enormous huge tower on an alien planet. It's actually an open world game so you can move everywhere anytime. Teleporters help you to return to previously detected areas. You will encounter plenty of different aliens and the whole experience is very enjoyable and a lot of fun.

Pros:
- lot's of fun
- magnificent science fiction parody
- open world
- perfectly captures film stereotypes of the 50's
- good music
- many varied opponents
- clever dialogue
- dinosaurs, King Kong, radioactive giant ants, giant robot lizard, ape-men, etc.
- fight with 'Kylo Ren's lightsabre
- upgrade your heroes and activate special abilities
- collectables
- very unique setting
- great, surprising end

Neutral:
- gameplay is not challenging (but that's OK for me)
- director comment only in English, so in order to fully enjoy this game you should understand English

Cons:
- the game is rather short

Es wurde nach einem ganz bestimmten Stil erschaffen. Dies betrifft auch den Soundtrack im Spiel. Zuerst einmal möchte ich sagen, dass alle Sci-Fi-Fans hier genau richtig sind und sich auf eine nostalgisch gefilmte Atmosphäre freuen können. Auch Rückblenden und unterhaltsame Kommentare zu vielen verschiedenen Stellen sind vorhanden. In der Geschichte geht es darum, auf einem fernen Planeten im Weltall einen wahnsinnig hohen Turm zu erklimmen, während man der Geschichte eines damals gedrehten Films folgt. Dieser Turm wird natürlich in vielen verscheidenen Abschnitten unterteilt. Aber auch auf der Oberfläche des Planeten gibt es einiges zu tun. Viele  verschiedene Gegner, Fallen und Jump ´n Run - Hindernisse sind zu überwinden, bis man zu den jeweiligen Endbossen gelangt, die es sich auf dieser Welt gemütlich gemacht haben. Das Spiel besitzt Humor und eine relativ große Spielwelt, in der man sich jederzeit an viele verschiedene Punkte teleportieren kann. Die Grafik ist zudem sehr angenehm. Man kann als Astronaut, als Roboter und als eine Astronautin spielen, die viele verschiedene Fähigkeiten und Waffen besitzen, die man je nach gesammelter Erfahrung immer wieder upgraden kann. Es wäre gut, sich erst mal ein Video zum Spiel anzuschauen, um ein ungefähres Gefühl für das Spiel zu bekommen. Für einen Preis von 14,99 Euro ist das ein sehr fairer Preis, da man neben der Geschichte auch Übungsmissionen auf verschiedenen Stufen üben kann. Ich kann das Spiel nur weiterempfehlen, wem es jetzt schon gefällt. Ein echter Klassiker !

25956018.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

Unless you grew up watching old movies like Clash of the Titans, 20 Million Miles to Earth, The 7th Voyage of Sinbad, Jason and the Argonauts and any other number of Ray Harryhausen or Harryhausen-esque pictures or you love film in general, you'll really be missing the point of The Deadly Tower of Monsters which would be a shame; strip away the B-movie aesthetics of the game and you're left with a mostly unremarkable but mindlessly enjoyable top-down beat-em-up that pits you against everything from evil apes to flying saucers to giant ants

The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a game developed by ACE Team and published by ATLUS. The scenery looks cobbled together from cheap rubber and styrofoam. Enemies are either obviously stuntmen in suits or stop-motion effects. Many times, you can see the strings holding them up or the boom mic appearing in cutscenes. The plot is authentically nonsensical. Every facet of the aged Hollywood magic that made those films what they were is present, correct and jammed full of obscure references and Easter eggs; rarely has a game shown so much devotion and love to its subject matter

Not quite as endearing, however, is the commentary track that runs throughout the playtime. The Deadly Tower of Monsters is presented as a DVD re-release with the director and his production assistant firing out quips every thirty seconds or so and while it's been exhaustively written and is fairly humorous on occasion, there is just far too much of it. A lot of times, the two voices will be jabbering on, fully subtitled, while you're trying to hack your way through a major battle or set-piece so you wind up missing what they're saying by way of trying to concentrate on not getting crushed by a plasticine brontosaur

There's a metric arseload of weapons to grab as you go, some far more useful than others, which can be upgraded with cogs that you find as you progress. Annoyingly, your loadout only allows for two ranged and two melee weapons at a time which wouldn't be a huge deal if the game didn't force you to find a terminal every time you wanted to change them. The worst part about this setup is that every time you pick up a new weapon, one of your current ones gets elbowed out of your inventory. Having fun with your ultra-powerful Tesla cannon? Not any more! Have this crappy flamethrower instead! Even better, have it while you're being literally SWARMED by waves of killer ants! 

The character stat upgrade system is more pleasing and innovative. You're not rewarded with skill points by way of XP; rather, the game has you complete various objectives, many of which are completely optional. While you'll usually get one for killing a boss, taking down a giant dinosaur with a knife is all on you. It adds depth to a game that is, at times, lumbered with mechanics that sorely need it

Still, The Deadly Tower of Monsters has more than enough style and bare bones playability to be worth a try, especially for fans of the genre it inhabits. It's a forgivingly easy game; you can make it through without a good deal of the upgrades available but as a love letter to those creaky, weird and wonderful pictures that entranced me as a kid, you'll find none better!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

25951055.review:
Is this a good game?

Well, I played it through to completion (no MP), and there were no bugs or crashes.

As twin-stick shooters go, it works well (though the camera could be better) and there is a strong element of platforming too.

Adding the ability to easily go back to previously explored areas to find more loot pushes this game to a solid 7/10 for people who like twin-stick shooters.

I don't like twin-stick shooters much. Its just not my favourite type of game.

I love '60s sci-fi B movies though, and this game takes everything from the genre, mashes it together and serves it up in one great package. The animation, the graphics, the storyline, everything is done so well that I just love this game to bits. I have not seen smacking stop-motion plastic dinosaurs in the face with a futuristic night-stick done so well! 11/10!

Final score. 9/10

25950939.review:
Difficult decision, since the game is not awful, but there's just too much frustration involved for a 5 hour game, so it's barely a "no". Get this during a discount perhaps.

So, the game's goal is to climb the deadly tower of monsters. In order to do so you will have to fight, fight, fight and jump occasionally, but mostly fighting...and walking. The problem with the fighting is that it's awful...god awful. It's not a real brawler, it's not an ARPG, it's "something". You basically control your character from a weird elevated camera position that is 95% fixed (you can wiggle a bit, but that's it). The camera will screw you over multiple times I guarantee you. Apart from that you have a basic melee and ranged attack, as well as a dodge roll (block if you time it right) and a few special abilities, which are mostly pointless in combat. Doesn't sound THAT bad until you actually get to fighting stuff...let's just say the combat is not fleshed out at all. Hitboxes, attack animations, tells, etc. all of those need more work, especially the interaction with your character. It just feels jarred and as a consequence you'll take more damage than necessary. That in itself wouldn't even be the worst part, but some (most) attacks knock you flat on your ass and your character takes about 5 seconds to get back up...this happens quite frequently. I know you can dodge or block the attacks, but when it feels like that it's easier to do that in Dark Souls, which is pretty unforgiving in that regard, something went wrong.

Not to mention that some checkpoints are pretty far away and if you die, everything respawns. Also, some enemies can also be (very slowly) defeated by special abilities. At least I didn't find a weapon that would make a dent in them. Extremely time consuming and annoying. Oh, also, fuck the targeting in this game...seriously.

Apart from the combat you will collect different coloured cogs, complete "missions" (aka achievements) and gather gold. Gold is left behind by enemies or in breakable objects...you will have way too much of that. I think I had 40,000 at the end and couldn't upgrade anything anymore, because...to do so you need said cogs, which you can find throughout the game. Not sure how many are in there, but I only got enough to upgrade about 4 weapons to maximum. Nowhere near enough to make use of the 12 or so weapons you actually get access to...especially later in the game. You also need gold to upgrade your character, but wait, you can ONLY do that once you get an achievement. That's right folks, you need to complete achievements to get more damage or more life or whatever. I got to level 11 of 30 or so. It's basically busy work if you want to get stronger. Maybe an interesting idea, but I don't like it.

The main reason you will be playing this game, however, is the story and writing. While the story is that of a C class sci fi movie you're actually replaying the movie with the director's commentary (and that of the audio technician), which can be pretty hilarious (do not turn VHS audio mode on or everything is completely garbled and sounds horrible). It does drag on at the end though, so even this isn't 100% great...

Graphics are ok (activate VHS mode here for the real deal). And that's pretty much it. If you are a patient player and don't get frustrated that easily, pick this up when it's on sale.

25918586.review:
Acabo de terminar este juego y debo decir que es... una maravilla!. Hace demasiado tiempo que no me divertía tanto con un juego, es muy gracioso gracias a que tiene un estilo muy particular que parodia películas de ciencia ficción antiguas cómo "El Planeta Prohibido", que tuve la suerte de ver antes de jugar este juego. 
La jugabilidad no es lo mejor del mundo, pero le queda bastante bien al juego, teniendo la posibilidad de correr, saltar, volar (aunque muy poco), disparar armas, golpear con armas cuerpo a cuerpo, rodar, bloquear ataques y usar algunas habilidades o armas especiales, incluso puedes sólo saltar sobre los enemigos "cómo en los videojuegos".
Si bien el que el juego consista en escalar una torre parece una idea aburrida en un principio, el que se pueda fácilmente teletransportar entre puntos, o simplemente lanzarte de la torre para llegar a zonas anteriores hace que el juego no se torne tedioso. Además existen muchas zonas por explorar, algunas ocultas ya sea en la torre o fuera de ella, a las que no es fácil acceder y tendrás que lanzarte de alguna zona superior para llegar.
Me sorprendió bastante la cantidad de armas, hay para todos los gustos y estas pueden irse mejorando. Además existe un sistema de misiones secundarias con las que se puede subir de nivel al personaje y subirle vitalidad, daño, entre otras opciones.
Creo que es un juego excelente que, aunque corto, tiene mucho por explorar y además un modo supervivencia que puede extender algo más la vida del juego. Lo recomiendo totalmente.

25918130.review:
「トップダウン視点のアクションアドベンチャー」

<独創的で確立されたデザイン>
ジオラマ風デザインとB級SF映画風BGM、ブリキのロボットなどのコンセプトは魅力的。
メタなナレーションや、わざと古風なアクションを取り入れている点も、製作者のこだわりを感じられる。

<ゲーム内容>
・メンバー構成や、キャラクターごとの能力などは順番に増えていく構造。
・システムとしては「レゴゲーム」に近い。
キャラクターそれぞれの能力を活かしたアクションでアイテム収集や道を切り開くという概念があるため、
変更しながら進めていくことになる。
・コンバットシステムは、「Yによるスキル、Xによる打撃、Rトリガーによる射撃、Bによる回避(防御)」等分かりやすく
難しいアクションを要求されない。
・武器は近距離専用・遠距離専用と分けられており、三種のギアを収集すればカスタマイズ可能、消費量は武器によって違う。
キャラの強化は、実績解除でスキルポイントを取得、スイルポイントを消費し「体力、アーマー、打撃or射撃攻撃力」を強化できる。

<個人的な感想>
惜しい作品でありながらセールで503円で購入したので、何ともいえない。
定価でも十分すぎる内容だと思います(特にデザインに惹かれた方には)。
COOPは楽しいと思います。
大人が喜んで、「コレやろう」って子供に誘うような作品ですね(子供は喜ばないかもしれませんが)。

・惜しい点
メンバーとの掛け合いがなく、ほぼ単独行動なので協力しているのか分からなくなる。
キャラごとの目立った違いがないため、使いっぱしりのキャラもいる(ロボ)。
能力が必要なだけで使っていたりとか、そこで初めてレゴゲーのような・・・と感じた。
いくら収集が楽になるとはいえ、いつでも変更できたら良かったのに。

・難易度ハードでノーマルの難易度。
それでも簡単に感じる。戦闘は強引にでも進められる。

・武器が増えても、能力の違いがあまり無いように思える。
下手すると好みの問題だけで変更することになり、以降変更する必要性があまり感じられなくなる。
個人的に武器一本一本(打撃＆射撃)で、強化の方向性を広げてあげたら多様性が高くなったかもしれない。
結果、武器が増えるたびに武器の説明を楽しむことになってしまった。

・コンバットシステムが単調。
基本、撃った方が身のためになる。

メタゲーといえば、「デッドプール」。
でもこちらもヒーローではない、彼ほどスタイリッシュで超人でなくてもかまわない、ただ頑張っているアクションが欲しかった
(ディックとロボの攻撃アクションが一緒って・・・そんな・・・しかもディックに鞭を装備させたら、全く腰の入ってない攻撃モーションに泣けた)。

・「下から襲ってくる敵を撃ち落とせ!」
あんまり面白くないイベントのように思えます。
これ入れるのだったら、仲間と協力するイベントが欲しかったし、
戦闘時にメンバーとの協力アクションが欲しかったですね(それだけで物語は盛り上がったはず)。

・メタゲーなので物語はあってないようなもの
別にメタな内容じゃなくてもよかったような。

惜しい点は以上ですが、普通にプレイしていたらクリアはできます。
収集はした方がいいですが、こだわる必要はありません。

僕はオススメしますが、好みが分かれるでしょうね。

25917620.review:
ok, Let me start by saying I am a huge fan of the 'B' movies of the 50's, 60's and the 'made for TV movies or the 70's. I was brought up with them and know the props, effects and language diction of those eras having lived them. 

This game is argueable one of the funniest and fun games I've played in years. The only caveat being that I wished the director (who narrarates his 'movie' throughout) had stuck more in line with the slang of this era.  

Saying that, all the movie references, the visual effects or incorporating the poor visual effects of sci-fi/fantasy from the 1930's to 1960's was amazing.  Brief stints of black and white and stating that they couldn't afford color for that scene was hilarious.  The stop motion dinosaurs and the jittery stop motion of the King Kong-esque was beautiful.

Game play was clearly geared for the console or game controller users and left us PC users having to jump to the key assignment option to see what the onscreen commands were refering to. But once that hurdle was jumped, it was a great deal of fun to play.

Extras in monkey suits, killer bats where you can see the strings suspending them and inumerable props and sci-fi movie references from Buck Rogers to Them, makes this game a laugh-fest.

So if you'll excuse me, I'm going back to enjoy this gem some more.

25912391.review: This game had me hooked from the start! I was pleased to find some unexpectedly fun combat for a top-down, arcade-style game. At first, the commentary felt a tad forced, but as I progressed through the story, the banter between the "director" character and "Patrick" became more and more hilarious. The throwback, B-Movie style looks fantastic, and the unique vertical element of the game provides players with some fun sequences to play and great scenes to watch. Loved it! Pick it up.

25910237.review:
This game is fantastic. I am a massive fan of classic science fiction and this game just oozes the hallmark cheesiness of the era.

The art style is wonderful (along with all the little touches like visible strings and rigs to make it look like a badly done movie), the characters are wonderfullt cliched and cheesy and the writing is geninuely funny.
Monsters are made up of a menagerie of science fiction cliches. You'll fight fire breathing dinosaurs, towering apes, telepathics squids, lizardmen, and just about anything else you could find in an old monster film.
As for the gameplay itself; the platforming and combat is nothing groundbreaking, but interesting enough that I wanted to keep on playing. In particular I really the like various weapons that I kept finding, which kept combat interesting.
I truely enjoyed the breadth of the game world as you ascended the tower, there were just so many secret areas or alternate routes that you were properly rewarded everytime you explored off the main pathway.

I highly reccomend this to any who enjoys the cliches cheesiness of old science fiction films, as The Deadly Tower of Monsters is most enjoyable while soaking in its ridculous art-style and setting.

25892811.review:
The Deadly Tower of Monsters is the best ACE Team game I’ve played so far. It seems fairly well polished, has a neat theme, a funny out of touch narrator, and a great sense of scale through its use of the vertical space since you are making your way up a gargantuan tower. TDToM does come with a handful of issues though that can be mitigated somewhat.

The combat is a mostly pleasurable experience. You have basic attacks, a strong attack (charged basic), a jumping attack, a roll/parry button, powers, and ranged attacks. One of the more satisfying things is how enemies will often harm each other. You can use it to your advantage with smart footwork and the ragdoll physics only make it better. It can feel simple at times, but nailing down the parry allows for some satisfying counters because it’ll group parry. If 3 close projectiles come at me, I can reflect them all back and that works on multiple melee enemies too if they’re close enough. Understanding the enemy’s timing is the only hard part since there are plenty of enemy types.

Progression occurs as a good pace. As you play, you’ll discover a variety of weapons. They all have different properties from each other and are introduced in a way with the most powerful ones being acquired last. You can upgrade your favorites to make them even stronger and change them visually. Upgrades are acquired by spending cogs that you can find hidden around everywhere. These weapons are shared across the three different characters that you’ll control one at a time. Each character also comes with a different power that they can use to overcome the occasional obstacle or overwhelm your opponents. Powers are unlocked over time and can be a chain lightning attack, a dash, a mine, an AoE push, and more.

I’m a big fan of the theme of this game and how it presents everything. The narrator is there speaking as if he were providing audio commentary on a DVD. Many of the enemies are presented as an old, cheesy sci-fi movie type of deal with guys in various monster suits, bats on strings, and really big bosses. You’ll see some stop-motion animation going on with some of them too. The level design really lets you know how high you are the further you go into the game.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=775966953

The ending was uh… weird. Not sure how I feel about it. I guess it was okay.

The game does have some negatives that made me sigh a couple times. You need to touch a checkpoint in order to save progress which makes accidentally falling to your death taste real bad after finishing a big battle or completing a large platforming section. You can teleport to any previous checkpoints at will, so use that to your advantage and don’t forget to touch one before doing something risky such as skydiving a long way down with little health. There are a few easily killable enemy types that can completely stunlock you into death if you’re cornered by two of them. Stay in the open and away from the walls when you run into them and don’t forget about your powers. Finally, there was one section that involved plenty of stairs that went by real slow. Thankfully, that was the only portion of the game that had me bored and it isn’t too long.

So, if you’re looking for a good 5 hours or so of some quirky fun that was fairly consistent throughout, The Deadly Tower of Monsters would be a fine choice. If it’s on sale, definitely consider giving it a go.

25874687.review:
Il gioco omaggia in chiave ironica e vintage il cinema di fantascienza degli anni Cinquanta: Il pianeta proibito, La guerra dei mondi, L'esperimento del professor K, Il pianeta delle scimmie, Il mondo perduto, The time machine...
Scenografie di cartapesta, robot mossi da nani, pupazzi e animazioni a passo uno, pterodattili appesi ai fili.
Il gioco si pone come un'edizione dvd commentata dal regista di un B Movie classico, un po' platform, un po' hack and slash.
La singolarità si trova nell'ambientazione con effetti da vhs distrubati, suono rimasterizzato male, mostri che sembrano per davvero pupazzi animati, scenografie traballanti, attori non proprio eccelsi, fotogrammi ritoccati, fotografia incerta e trama ridicola.
Tutto è funzionale alla finzione; le cutscene possono essere saltate come se fossero fast forward, la morte del nostro personaggio è giustificata come errore di montaggio, l'approssimazione di certe animazioni e dettagli come problemi di budget. Si vedono le ditate sull'obiettivo e i piedi che spuntano dai costumi dei mostri.
Gioco cinefilo e divertentissimo.

25871759.review: Pure B-Movie madness best describes this game title! If you've ever endured painfully bad older sci-fi films from the late 50's through to the early 70's you'll see the novelty of this game, and probably enjoy the daylights out of it at the same time! The gameplay takes some getting used to, but it isn't all bad since the "clunky" combat is offset by many weapons both melee and laser based, and each weapon does unique amounts of damage, and have varried speeds to them. The Deadly Tower of Monsters stands out in it's tower climbing style, and uses fun features like character upgrades, weapon upgrades, and seperate character abilities to mix things up a bit along the way/climb. The best of all is the game is filled with cheesy tounge in cheek humour alluding to sci-fi movie making of the mid 20th Century, and that makes it all the better, and a win for playing!

25859007.review:
It pains me to downvote this, as I think ACE Team is one of the most inventive developers running. I bought this on day one--a thing I seldom do. With the price down to $5.09 and the rating up to "very positive", I feel like I need to say:

1) The artwork is fun, but as has been said elsewhere, not quality on par with the concept.
2) The narrator is a one-trick pony, and annoying after a very short run. Profoundly annoying.
2) The animations and controls feel wooden. Some have excused this as a function of its "vintage look" aspirations, but I don't buy it. Those monster movie days were days of practical effects. It should feel "real world", not... "modern poorly optimized". I see nothing that looks like it's even trying to be stop-action. Which made me sad.

When I bought the game, I played and dropped it in an hour or so, for the reasons described above. I didn't review, because I was optimistic, thinking updates would improve it. But every time I come back, it's that same old feeling: great idea... disappointing execution.

25858230.review:
An exciting game from beginning to end. Full of cheesy 60's B-movie comedy.

It's your basic hack-n-slash gameplay but in a narrative world with aliens, mutants and dinosaurs in one large open world planet.

You have 3 playable characters to switch between, a man, a  woman and a robot. Each has their own unique special ability. Add to that weapons you unlock that you can upgrade. Tons of collectables and secrets in the game too.

The point is to climb a tower and get to the top. While that sounds rather easier than it is, you'll face all kinds of obstacles such as traps, mazes, bosses, puzzles, etc. A bit of everything which keeps the game moving along.

It's on sale right now so check it out!

25759489.review:
It's a nice game, I really like the graphics and the setting, it's supposed to be some type of parody of horror movies from back in 50's, the entire game it's supposed to be the film, you have three characters to choose from all with different power ups that matter just in very specific situations, frankly i've just been using the robot because I like how he looks, the characters don't trascend into the custscenes, in them a specific character will be used, that being said, the cutscenes are ok, they're clearly are trying to be funny, mimic certain aspects of the "b-movies" from back then, all of this is perpetually narrated by the director of the supposed film that you're playing, I think this game it's enjoyable mostly if you know what the game it's referencing and making fun of, or rather, paying homage in it's entirety.

Altho the other thing that keeps me playing it's it's simplistic gameplay mechanics, you can carry two regular melee weapons, and two ranged weapons, but there are tons of different weapons that you'll get by just progressing through the game, frankly the thing that kills me it's that there's an upgrade system for this weapons that's extremely difficult to use, mainly because the upgrades are only obtained through playing the game naturally, but mostly, through exploring and finding secrets, etc... The game it's so massive and convoluted tho, that finding this secrets proves to be a rather jarring chore, be that as it may tho the upgrades are incredible changing not only the damage outpout of your weapons but also changing how your weapons visually look, it's great.

The weapons are also pretty varied, you may have at one point a simitar, or a flamethrower, my favorite so far it's the whip, which it's great for staying on the outside while still hitting hordes of enemies.

The enemies are pretty varied, each and every single one of them satirizing some movie, or monster from the horror films from the 1950's, it's great, at one point you might be fighting some monkeys like in Planet of the Apes, or in another moment you might be fighting a fly with doctor's clothes similar to the original fly movie, the game even makes a reference to it by having the director saying it's paying an homage.

It's really a nice game, I do however recommend playing it with "hard mode" set to on, it made my experience immensley more enjoyable than when I started playing the game just without it. Plus it's not impossible, it's actually pretty balanced and engaging, I really like it.

Overall I really think it's a very nice game, it's just a very fun game to play casually and the commentary from the director it's hilarious for the most part, it can get repetitive after a while, but overall it's been great, I really feel as if we need more games like this one that take risks while satirizing films in a decade in which films ironically enough took risks, not so much because of taking them as much as because the filmmakers were always experimenting with them.

24450974.review:
[b] If you enjoy this review please consider following my Curator page [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31067175-ParanoidAndroid-Picks/] here [/url]. [/b]

The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a wonderful subversion of pulp sci fi movies of yore.


The game is narrated by the (fictional) director of the (fictional) movie, The Deadly Tower of Monsters. Without a doubt, the strwength of this game, and the main reason to play it, is the tremendous ambiance and tone. The devs clearly have a strong affinity for cheesy, B-movie sci fi and boy does it show. From the VCR film grain to the not so subtle strings attached over pterodactyls, this game nails it’s aesthetic and hits it out of the park. It has cheesy one liners, an evil doctor, and a main hero named Dick Starspeed. What more could you want?!


As far as the game itself plays, it’s perfectly serviceable, if nothing special. It’s your standard fare third person action game where you get two melee weapons and two guns.  Your arsenal is varied enough that it keeps the game fresh but there are clearly ones that you should use (the flamethrower). In addition, there is a sizeable amount of enemies that you encounter each with increasing difficulty as you ascend the deadly tower. My main gripe would have to be the checkpoint system, it’s not great. Many times I was set back two or three confrontations earlier that led to somewhat tedious moments. Thankfully, this didn’t happen enough that it severely hampered my experience but it was definitely annoying.



The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a blast to play if you have any affinity towards The Twighlight Zone or old sci fi movies. This alone carries the game through its 5 hour runtime. If you have no connection to that setting, then the game may be a bit dull for you, however. That said, I am excited to see what this studio does next and would love a follow up to see what shenanigans old Dan Smith is up to.
