20843055.review:
So, as you can probably tell, this is a tongue-in-cheek action platformer sci-fi game. You play as three different heroes, all with mildly varying powers, and you can use and upgrade a variety of melee and ranged weapons, most of which are bad. 

So, the presentation is rather nice, with the audio commentary from the "director" of the game talking about how he "filmed" the "movie," and some random audio engineer that makes comments for whatever reason. The commentary, which extends throughout the game, is entertaining enough, and it makes plenty of references to old and new filmmaking. The visual style of the game adds to the presentation as well with "stop-motion" enemies that move at lower frame rates and wacky enemy designs. 

So why don't I recommend this game?

Well, for one, I beat this game first try in 2 hours and 45 minutes approximately. Now, even for a 15 dollar game, that is fairly short. But length isn't all that matters, right? Well, that isn't the only problem I had with it.

The soundtrack for the game is alright, but I can only remember two main songs that got repetitive after some time. There is the main combat and adventure music, and the jarring music change that plays every single time you enter freefall. And you will hear those songs for the entirety of this short game, except when the music seemingly breaks or perhaps just randomly stops playing for whatever reason, which makes the game really uncomfortably silent. 

The game also randomly crashed near the end for some reason.

Graphically, this game is not bad. It is colorful, varied, and presents itself well even though the texture quality isn't particularly impressive. The animations can leave a bit to be desired at times, but it is alright.

Now, onto the gameplay. One of the primary things this game sells itself on is the freefall mechanic. In short, it is really bad. You can jump off ledges and move around slightly and then instantly teleport back to where you just jumped off like it never even happened. It just feels so disconnected from the rest of the game. The only real advantage to it is to fall through rings for skill points and achievements. Otherwise, it serves little purpose whatsoever. Even in the boss fights, at the very end of some of the bossfights, the boss falls down and you get to shoot the boss a whole bunch, but it doesn't even seem to really do anything at all. I wouldn't be surprised if not shooting the boss had the same outcome as shooting them. I honestly can't say anything more about it because there really isn't anything else to it. Freefalling feels like a slapped on mechanic, and I would have much preferred if the game didn't pretend like it actually matters at all.

Another "mechanic" of the game, if you can even call it that, is that you can shoot down the tower. I don't mean shoot the tower down, but rather you can look over the edge and shoot at enemies that are coming up the tower. The game will alert you when enemies are climbing/flying up the sides, and you can look over the edge and click them a whole bunch. Also, you can shoot targets and if you shoot enough you get a skill point. That is literally all there is to the "mechanic." It feels so disconnected from the rest of the game that I honestly can't see why it is even in the game.

So now that the whole "looking down and clicking things a whole bunch" mechanics have turned out to be boring, repetitive, and disconnected from the rest of the game, you are left with a more basic action adventure platformer game. So, how does that fair? In short, not much better.

To start off, you have two weapon types, ranged and melee. You can carry four weapons, two of each type, and you can collect and upgrade the different weapons throughout the game. [strike] The different weapons have different advantages and disadvantages that you must learn to utilize in order to fight the varied enemy types.[/strike]

 Actually, scratch that last sentence because it is a big fat lie.

 So, you can use different cogs you find throughout the game to upgrade your weapons. But some of the weapons are so ridiculously strong that I cannot possibly imagine why you would use any of the other weapons. The mace/hammer weapon allows you to annihilate everything in your path with jump attacks. It can hit enemies twice, and when you land, its shockwave hits multiple enemies at once. Pair that with the fact that it does a ridiculous amount of damage even to single enemies that I am pretty sure it is more versatile than any pair of weapons in the game. The game quickly devolved into jump attack, jump attack, jump attack, win. It even works well against bosses, so every time I picked up a weapon I would switch to my other junk weapon so I wouldn't lose my hammer when the game forcefully changes my weapons. Then I would continue jump attacking to victory for most of the game.

The ranged weapons are in a similar boat. There is one lightning gun that does so much single target damage that it instantly kills even many medium strength enemies in one shot at range, and at the very least two shots them. There is also an energy mechanic where if you shoot too fast, your energy runs out and you have to wait to use your gun again, but the lightning gun doesn't even use too much energy for the insane amount of damage it does and it upgrades to max very quickly. The worst part is that the weapon can hit multiple densely packed enemies at once so I never felt hard pressed to switch to a faster weapon to kill weaker mobs because I could kill two to three at once anyway. The ranged weapons are less terrible than the melee weapons, with the machinegun, rocket launcher, and a couple others being okay but the lightning gun is just so good I had no reason to ever use my secondaries.

 Each character has powers that I can barely even comment on because I never felt the need to use them except when the game forces you to use them to open up a gate or move past an obstacle. The only one of note is at the last chapter of the game and lets you instantly kill any enemy that is being held up by strings, and it recharges very quickly. [i]Surely,[/i] we needed more enemy types to become completely trivialized.

"What about the enemy designs?" What about them? Thematically they are varied with apes that throw feces and robot samurai and dinosaurs and so on, but most can be summed up as: Small mob creature that dies instantly, medium strength melee guy, medium strength ranged guy, big slow guy. Oh, and the "enemy that flies up the tower and you click a whole bunch as it dies helplessly" enemy type. Again, the "shooting down the tower" mechanic is so disconnected that those enemies are hardly worth mentioning. The hammer and lightning gun make short work of all of the main enemy types anyway.

The platforming is extremely basic. You can jump, and you have a jetpack that allows you to hover for a short period of time while also preventing fall damage. Basically, its not a selling point either.

And the bosses, along with the rest of the game, are laughably easy. The last "boss," if you can even call it that, is basically one last middle finger to the player as it is the easiest of them all.

All in all, unless the presentation just seems [i]that[/i] appealing to you and the game is on sale, I wouldn't recommend it. I even got it for 10 bucks and I [i]still[/i] wouldn't recommend it.

EDIT: I completely forgot there even was a dodge roll mechanic until I looked at the achievements because it was so insignificant.

20828457.review:
Comedy is incredibly difficult to pull off in a video game. Most gags rely on precise, directed timing, and taking control away from a player in an interactive medium usually results in a bad game, frustration, and few laughs in the process. Through clever narration, smart satire, and an unflinching 100% commitment to it's jokes, The Deadly Tower of Monsters plastered a perma-grin across my face for my entire playtime. It's an entertaining, creative hack n' slash puzzle/platformer to boot.

  Your ultimate goal in The Deadly Tower of Monsters is to climb the deadly tower of monsters. Standing underneath the imposing structure and looking skyward (or taking a peek at the map) gives the deflating feeling that you're in for a near impossible test of will and patience. Once you take a few steps toward that journey, however, it becomes clear that many design decisions are in place to keep player convenience at the forefront. Fall off a ledge? Press “LB” and you're right back to solid ground, no penalty incurred. Getting lost? Pull up the map and you can warp to any point in the tower you've previously visited at will. (Protip: go up.) This isn't some hardcore, griefing, reflex litmus test. That wouldn't be funny. You're encouraged to fall, explore, and generally just have a good time in the campy sandbox, and you should take the game up on that offer.

  On the base level the game reminds me of console-centric action/RPGs like Marvel: Ultimate Alliance or Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance. From an overhead view you have a standard melee attack which can be charged for a heavy attack, and a ranged weapon. As you progress you gain access to about a dozen different kinds of both types of weapons, and these can be upgraded by collecting components dropped by enemies or scattered around the environments. There are also perks like max HP increases, regenerating health, improved melee/ranged damage, etc. that can be earned by completing missions (main quests or side activities). You can swap between three different characters that have some unique skills needed to access certain areas, so there's also a bit of Metroidvania going on here.  Other options include the ability to parry attacks, extend your jumps with a jetpack, and shoot downward when near a ledge (that one good feature of Dark Void). It all adds up to a surprising amount of depth in a fairly short, decidedly goofy comedy game.

  Even the title screen of The Deadly Tower of Monsters is full of jokes. Upon booting the game, you're immediately greeted by a narrator who is “in studio” to record a commentary track for a truly awful Sci-Fi B-movie he made some years back, and he's going to be cringe-worthingly candid and let it be know just how much of scumbag he is. You're greeted at the start with a fairly typical though beautiful movie poster of the movie, where a 50's Hollywood space man is cradling an attractive, unconscious woman. The director remarks how proud he is of the poster. Boot the game up a second time, and the gender roles are swapped, with the woman rescuing the man. “I didn't approve of this change”, the director protests. His assistant chimes in to inform him that the studio execs shot an alternate take, foreseeing a future demographic where swapping the sexes would appeal to the masses. That's some pretty poignant and fucking funny social commentary. Not content to stop there, an alternate title screen shows a robot holding the man instead... for the future robot demographic.

  I debated whether or not to spoil the above gag, but the riffs are just so nonstop throughout the game that it's a small drop in a large pond of punchlines. You're controlling the “movie”, the perfectly voiced director is giving behind-the-scenes anecdotes nearly the entire time in rapid fire fashion akin to the densest, snappiest of MST3K episodes. This is more than fitting since the movie in question would feel right at home in a crappy Mystery Science Theater show: dinosaurs are convincingly stop motion animated, bats are held aloft by visible strings, nothing is shown that couldn't be created with practical effects from that era which usually means men in rubber suits. There's even more than a few cameos from (in)famous(ly bad) real movie monsters. Every environment and creature is lovingly crafted from people who are clearly fans of the genre, and the affection for the movies we love and love to make fun of is sincere and hilarious.

  I'm not usually a fan of “meta” comedy, but The Deadly Tower of Monsters is so out there it absolutely worked for me on every level. The DVD commentary presentation is excellent, and it breaks the fourth (and sometimes fifth) wall with such reckless abandon you just have to laugh. From a pure game perspective it's completely solid with enough fresh ideas to be enjoyable on it's own, but smiling and giggling like an idiot while playing elevates it to a must play game. It's one of the best surprises I've encountered in a long time.

20822342.review:
Удивительная и неповторимая игра, в своем роде.. и с самых первых слогов, она, дает понять что это вовсе не то, чем может показаться ;) а реально стеб, на все творения фантастов, прошлых лет..
Очень глубокий, погружающий мир, и это музыкальное сопровождение.. вкупе с очень, ну очень привлекательной графикой, и подколами вокруг гг [spoiler] и человечества в целом[/spoiler], дают понять, что тут не все так просто, и за юмором кроется гораздо более глубокий смысл) который не вполне очевиден с первых минут.. ну или может это просто такое впечатление сложилось сначала)
В общем пока я первые два часа слушал интру, и наслаждаясь мелодией рассуждал о смысле бытия, вместо щелчка на "старт", у меня почему-то возникло желание таки, дать деру, но старая привычка, или быть может простое любопытство, приказали увязнуть, и уразуметь, что в этой загогулине, несмотря на выкрутасы камеры и прочее, вполне можно комфортно пробежать лунной походкой, как минимум первую часть путешествия. Попутно отвешивая оплеухи, и лупя по-царски в жбан с горы. А также творя что только вздумается, ну кроме чтива увлекательного комментарова, что я никак не мог пропустить, ибо упустил бы суть.
Как итог, после проведения 2 часов в меню, за прослушиванием фоновой мелодии, и часа в игре, могу с твердостью моей арматуры сказать, что попробовать стоит! И это при том, что я перед первым чекпоинтом застрял на шестеренках, в позе Чаки Нориса, и пришлось начинать с нуля..
Как добегу до конца, если таки велит случай, могу написать более подробно, и изложить свое мнение в другой форме) если достопочтенная публика пожелает ;C
P.S.: единственный заказной "сценарий", который я..

20800579.review:
Хотите почуствовать себя актером второсортной фантастики конца 60-х годов прошлого века? Хотите пачками ложить пластилиновых динозавров? А может быть вам доставит радость убить "племянника режиссера в костюме кальмара"? Или того лучше - огромную мегагориллу? Устали от сложных сюжетных поворотов и хотите чтобы диалоги были простыми, а писал их 10-и летний мальчик-аутист? Хотите оружие стреляющее мухами или монстров подвешенных на веревочки?
Вы определенно попали в точку! The Deadly Tower of Monsters осчастливит вас всем этим.
5 часов игры пролетят незаметно, а развеселые комментарии режиссера "фильма" не оставят равнодушным.

10 пластилиновых динозавров из 10.

20796013.review:
This is a lot of fun- not that I was around when these types of movies were new, but I remember watching them on Saturdays. If you like MST3K some of the stuff will put a smile on your face too.  Only thing is there are so many different moves you'll be tested on a keyboard and mouse- if you're a controller person you'll be challenged to remember all the buttons. 20789234.review:
The Deadly Tower of Monsters is what would happen if you took bastion, got rid of the sad themes, kept the narrator but made him full of himself, and threw it in a blender with some 50's and 60's sci-fi aesthetic. My only complaint about the game is its just not long enough. My total playtime is how long it took me to completely finish the game with all achievments. 

The combat is kept from staleness with a wide variety of weapons and different special abilities. The enemies are varied and plentiful, and the story is fantastically well done. 

So if you like:

- 1950's and 1960's sci-fi
- Mystery Science Theater 3000
- Comedy
- Platforming

You could do worse than buying this game.

20788211.review:
Никогда не был поклонником [b]ACE Team[/b], создателей таких работ как – [b]Zeno Clash 1-2, Rock of Ages и Abyss Odyssey[/b]. И причин этому не мало.
Однако, вопреки всем опасениям, я решил попробовать новое творение чилийцев т.к. было на что клюнуть в очередной раз...

[h1]THE DEADLY TOWER OF MONSTERS!!![/h1]
Первое, что стоит понимать, садясь за игру - все это, подтрунивания над научно-фантастической классикой, да и вообще кинематографом 60-80-х годов. Поэтому, чтобы проникнуться, да и вообще получить удовольствие, нужно осознавать, что такое [b]VHS, [i]“Помидоры-Убийцы”, Роберт Хайнлайн и подобные[/i][/b]…  
Вспомнили что-то знакомое и теплое сердцу? Вам сюда. 
Не терпите все, что связано с приставкой [b]OLD[/b] – вам мимо, ибо львиная доля удовольствия приходится именно на “Фансервис”.

[h1]В Прошлое “на все 100”[/h1]   
Планета под гнетом тирании местного узурпатора, “правая рука” в виде сумасшедшего ученого, бластеры, эпичные речи с наигранным голосом, конечно, динозавры с роботами и многое-многое другое, что всплывет у вас в памяти, наверняка отразится здесь. Штамп, штамп и еще раз штамп, который нивелируется в положительную сторону, ведь это, прежде всего, ради ностальгии и, собственно, высмеивания.
Еще даже не начав игру, в меню можно понять, что мы будем героями фильма, т.е. играть за актеров и тут же на нас будут вываливать забавные диалоги закадрового голоса режиссера, который, собственно, будет вещать всю игру и, который, привносит множество гэгов. Однако, видео-составляющая не отречена от аудио и тоже будет наглядно демонстрировать множество забавных моментов, от пластиковых декораций и резиновых валунов – до врагов, подвешенных на ниточках, отпечатков пальцев режиссера на линзе и ч/б изображение и прочее.  Да, “как можно дешевле и проще” на съемочной площадке правит баллом (в те времена, собственно, так и было). 
Однако, самой команде [b]ACE Team[/b], общий градус юмора выдержать, к сожалению не получается. Да, есть шутки способные заставить улыбнуться и даже засмеяться во весь голос, однако, в большинстве случаев это похоже на потуги [b]Duke Nukem Forever[/b], исключая “туалетный” юмор как таковой. Прибавьте к этому не столь виртуозную камеру и музыкальные темы и вот, впечатление смазывается в разы. 
Собственно “олдовость” игры заключается не только в ретро-сэттинге (даже [b]VHS[/b] фильтры есть!), но и в гэймплее. Перед нами изометрический Action в рамках 3D платформера, который отчасти страдает однообразием. Протагонистов аж целых ТРИ, однако, различия между ними сугубо визуальные и в паре навыков, что не оправдывает наличие оных и ненужную беготню для смены персоны. 
Арсенал довольно пухлый и подвергающийся простенкому, но апгрейду. Так мы постреляем из фено и бритво-подобных бластеров, отхлестаем неприятеля щупалцем Кракена и, напоследок, зарядим дробью из духов падших мух прямо из лягушки… Чего еще нужно для счастья!? Врагов здесь еще больше, мало того, что смена бестиария идет со скоростью пулеметного огня, так еще и многие варианты встречаются всего несколько раз за игру, что достойно уважения. Вообще, с бестиарием у чилийцев никогда не было проблем.
Однако, до поры, кажущийся скучным платформер разбавляют интересными элементами, помимо привычных поисков секретных закутков и незатейливых второстепенных задач, у нас здесь небольшой, но открытый мир, снабженный точками телепортации, огромная башня, с верхотуры которой можно, в прямом смысле, десантироваться в любую точку, причем свободное падение с заоблачных высот займет несколько минут реального времени, а так же с любого яруса дают возможность стрелять вниз прицельным огнем, как и в свободном падении.
Так же, здесь прикручена прокачка, которая осуществлена довольно интересно. У нас имеется 24 Достижения, выполнение любого ведет к повышению уровня персонажа. Однако, ввиду наипростейшей сложности и малой продолжительности (8 часов со всеми достижениями), прокачка здесь просто не нужна.

[h1]Итог: Игра, как и все творения [b]ACE Team[/b] на хороший, но один раз, только [u]для определенного круга лиц[/u]. Для меня это первая игра студии, из-за которой, лично я, заострю свое внимание на разработчиках. Здесь есть внимание к деталям и интересные решения, однако главную задачу “развлечь” выполняет она на твердую тройку. Сэттинг, ностальгия, творческий подход разработчиков и малая продолжительность игры, именно те качества из-за которых стоит обратить внимание на столь неровное, но интересное творение.

[b]Вступайте в [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/bestgoodgames]Best & Good Games[/url] и подписывайтесь на куратора [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/bestgoodgames#curation]B&GG[/url].

20782306.review:
[i]The Deadly Tower of Monsters ist eine grandiose Parodie auf SciFi B-Movies in Form eines isometrischen Action RPG Twinstick Shooters.[/i]

[h1]Story[/h1]
Dick  D-i-c-k (Anmerkung an die Steam-Zensur -> ich kann ja auch nichts dafür, dass er so heißt) Starspeed und sein Sidekick der Roboterpilot stranden mit ihrem Raumschiff auf einem unbekannten Planeten, der seltsamer nicht sein könnte. Das Wasser ist türkisgrün und die Erde rot wie der Mars. Größere Felsen sind gerne mal aus Pappmaschee und die Bäume und Büsche sind allesamt aus Plastik. Mittendrin steht ein gigantischer Turm, der bis ins All hinaufragt. Er sieht ein bißchen aus, als hätte man ihn aus Science Fiction Spielzeugresten zusammengebaut und ist der ganze Stolz des ansässigen Superschurken "The Emperor". 

Dessen Tochter Scarlett Nova, die mit der Tyrannei ihres Vaters nicht einverstanden ist, verschwört sich mit den beiden Neuankömmlingen. Und so beschließen sie gemeinsam, mit Laser-Peitsche und Strahlenkanone bewaffnet, den tödlichen Turm der Monster zu erklimmen, um ihrem Vater und seinem verrrückten Wissenschaftler Dr Peculiar die Stirn zu bieten. Auf ihrem Weg begegnen sie vielen eigentümlichen Kreaturen, wie den Atomameisen und den schwebenden Gehirnen, oder den Staubsaugermonstern. Auch ein Riesengorilla und ein Mutantenoktopus dürfen da natürlich nicht fehlen.

Das klingt nach üblem Trash und das soll es auch sein. The Deadly Tower of Monsters wird dem Spieler als digitalisierte und vom Regisseur kommentierte Neuauflage eines 1975 abgedrehten SciFi B-Movies präsentiert. Das Spiel ist bis zum Rand gefüllt mit hölzernen Dialogen und Anspielungen auf Filme wie Formica, King Kong, die Zeitmaschine, Fliegende Untertassen greifen an, der Unsichtbare, Killers from Space, Flash Gordon, Planet der Affen, die Fliege, oder die Reise zum Mittelpunkt der Erde. Die Spezialeffekte sind teilweise absichtlich fürchterlich mies. Manchmal ragt sogar ein Mikrofon ins Bild, oder man sieht einen Fingerabdruck auf der Linse. Viele der Monster sind ebenfalls absichtilich grauenvoll schlecht gemacht. Manche können zum Beispiel nur geradeaus laufen und rotieren auf der Stelle, wenn sie die Richtung wechseln wollen, andere sind absolut großartig animiert. 

Über alledem hört man immer wieder die eingespielten Kommentare des selbstgefälligen und komplett unfähigen Regisseurs Dan Smith, der nicht müde wird, den fiktiven Zuschauer mit schrägen Lebensweisheiten und verrückten Anekdoten vom Film-Set und zu unterhalten.

[h1]Umfang[/h1]
Der "Film" besteht aus vier Abschnitten, in denen man zahlreiche Monster und auch immer ein paar Endgegner besiegen muss. Wer zügig durchrennt, schafft das Spiel vermutlich auch in 6 Stunden. Wer alle Errungenschaften sammeln will und sich etwas mehr Zeit nimmt, diese bunte Welt der SciFi-Parodie zu bewundern, braucht dafür eher 10-15 Stunden.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The Deadly Tower of Monsters ist eine Mischung aus isometrischem Twin Stick Shooter, Action RPG und 3D Plattformer. Für mein Empfinden spielt es sich am besten mit einem Gamepad. 

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist definitiv "leicht". Auch RPG Einsteiger sollten dieses Spiel ohne allzu großen Widerstand durchspielen können. 

Die Helden können auf Basiseigenschaften wie Leben und Schaden ein bißchen leveln. Es gibt eine überschaubare Auswahl von Waffen, zwischen denen man wählen kann und die man für eingesammeltes Gold und Zahnräder ein oder zwei Stufen aufwerten kann.

Besonders ungewöhnlich ist, dass man aus beliebiger Höhe vom Turm springen kann (oder manchmal auch muss). Kurz vorm Aufprall beamt man sich mit dem tragbaren Teleporter einfach wieder hoch, oder man benutzt ein Jetpack, um eine sanfte Landung zu versuchen. Der freie Fall aus einer so großen Höhe ist ganz sicher ein Alleinstellungsmerkmal dieses Spiels. Man kann auch nur nach unten schauen und schießen. Die vertikale Ebene, ist fast eine neue Dimension für ein Spiel dieser Art. Die sich ständig um den Turm und den Spieler drehende Kamera hat dabei alle Hände voll zu tun, einen guten Blickwinkel zu bieten, was fast immer überzeugend gelingt.

[h1]Grafik & Musik[/h1]
Man findet Affen mit Armbanduhren, Stop-Motion Monster, eine glänzende Plastikfauna, unendlich viele Arten von verrückten Kreaturen und einen riesigen Turm mit unendlich vielen Details und Referenzen. Dialogsequenzen kann man vorspulen und es gibt sogar einen VHS-Filter, der die Altersspuren einer Videokassette simuliert. Die Grafiken und Animationen in diesem Spiel sind mit sehr viel Liebe zum Detail gestaltet worden. Es sieht einfach großartig aus.

Die Musik ist, im Stil der alten B-Movies, mit echten Instrumenten eingespielt worden und ergänzt die Parodie durch übertrieben theatralische Konzertklänge und schräge Spacefilmtöne.

[h1]Kritik[/h1]
Spieler mit einer Nvidia Karte haben offenbar immer wieder mal Probleme mit der vertikalen Synchronisation. Mir hat geholfen, meine Grafikkarte anzuweisen, dass sie dem Spiel ein nvidia vsync aufzwingen soll. Von da an lief es flüssig.

Die Charaktere unterscheiden sich nur durch ein paar Sonderfähigkeiten und auch die Charakterentwicklung ist für alle drei gleichermaßen sparsam. Für verwöhnte RPG Spieler ist die Auswahl der Waffen und Sonderfähigkeiten möglicherweise ein bißchen dürftig. Mir war es ausreichend für ein Spiel dieser Art. Man vermisst aber mehr Verstecke und nur für einen bestimmten Charakter zugängliche Bereiche. Sie wären gut für die Ausdifferenzierung der drei Rollen und auch der Wiederspielwert würde davon profitieren.

Die Kameraperspektive wechselt recht oft, während man sich auf dem Turm bewegt, was zunächst ein bißchen gewöhnungsbedürftig ist. Gelegentlich kommt es auch vor, dass manche Ecken dadurch schwer zu erreichen sind.

Es kommt aufgrund der vielen komplexen Ebenen und der zahlreichen Objekte des Turms gelegentlich (eher selten) vor, dass man in der Szenerie hängen bleibt.

Im vierten Teil sind die spielbegleitenden Kommentare etwas seltener geworden, was ich ein wenig schade fand. Ich hätte Dan Smith noch ewig zuhören können.

Die deutsche Übersetzung ist an verschiedenen Stellen leider ziemlich schlecht. Man sollte Englisch verstehen, um das Spiel vollumfänglich genießen zu können, denn man hat oft keine Zeit den Untertitel zu lesen.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Augenblicklich sieht es so aus, als hätten die Entwickler auch in Zukunft noch vor das Spiel zu begleiten und hier und da an der ein oder anderen Schraube zu drehen. Sie haben ebenfalls ein offenes Ohr für Spieler, wie man im Steam-Forum deutlich erkennen kann. Das sind eindeutig gute Argumente für ein gerade veröffentlichtes Spiel, das bei diesem Umfang selbstverständlich noch nicht zu hundert Prozent perfekt ist. 

Wenn du schwindelfrei bist und etwas für Action RPGs und Twinstick Shooter übrig hast, wenn du Englisch verstehst, aber vor allem wenn du ein SciFi-Fan bist und schon viele B-Movies gesehen hast, dann ist dieses Spiel garantiert ein Fest für deine Lachmuskeln. Gerne-Fans kann ich es wärmstens empfehlen. Der Preis stimmt auch. The Deadly Tower of Monsters hat gute Werbung verdient. Einfach großartig, Daumen hoch!

PS: "Deadly Tower of Monsters now with 4-Player local Co-op and Hard Mode!" (14.03.2016)

20773349.developer_response:
Hi Schley. Sad you are having a problem getting past an area and that it ruined your game experience. Is there anything I can do to help?

Notice you can use Scarlet's run power in the treadmills twice of you keep on running and wait for the power to recharge (while in the treadmill). In any case there are certainly no areas which require this, so maybe it's something else?

ADDENDUM: By any chance are you playing the game at a low framerate? There was another user in the forums who reported something just like what you're saying. According to him, when he lowered his settings to improve his framerate, it resulted in the Sprint working normally and allowing him to proceed. I haven't confirmed it in game myself yet, though I plan too once at home with my under-spec laptop. Seems like this might be an odd technical issue we didn't catch.

Besides unique art style it also have unique characters progress system for an RPG game. You can go and kill as many monsters as you wish, but you only get gold coins in return. If you wish to level up you have to do the achievemtns. Well, the level doesn't matter much, though, so you can finish the game with a very low-level character. 20747984.review:
Ganz gutes Spiel. Es ist auf jeden Fall die momentanen 10 €  wert. Das Spielprinzip ist nicht das neuste allerdings macht es durchaus Spaß kombiniert mit der Story. Vorallem das Mapdesign, also der Turm ist sehr ansprechend, da man ihn immer weiter hinauf ''klettert''. Zudem gibt es kaum Ladezeiten (solange man nicht stirbt kann man den Turm mit nur 4 kurzen Ladezeiten bezwingen).

Die Waffen (Nah- und Fernkampf) lassen sich 1-2 mal aufwerten, wobei ich das Gefühl hatte das viele Waffen mehr Schein als Sein waren und man diese jenen Waffen gar nicht benötigte, da viele auf gleicher Weise ihren Zweck erfüllten. 

Neben den Waffenupgrades kann man auch seine Charakter (insgesamt 3; die Upgrades sind charakterübergreifen) verbessern, d. h. ihnen mehr Leben geben, die Energie für die Schusswaffen erhöhen (es gibt keine Munition, lediglich Energie, die sich nach kurzem Warten wieder auflädt), Lebensregeneration freischalten/verbessern usw. . Die Anzahl an Upgrades ist von den Errungenschaften im Spiel abhängig. Hat man alle Errungenschaften des Spiels erreicht kann man seine Charakter auf die maximale Stufe verbessern.   

Nach einmaligem Durchspielen verging mir leider der Spaß, da es kaum noch Motivation gab. Man kann nur noch den ''Endboss'' unendliche Male besiegen und alles auf maximale Stufe verbessern, was für mich aber nicht wirklich unterhaltsam ist.

20741373.review:
An open world, predominantly a huge vertical tower that is traversed via foot, checkpoint teleporter and freefall is the setting for this twin stick ARPG.

Slick sound design and brilliant old school b-movie aesthetics featuring stop motion style enemies straight out of a Ray Harryhausen movie, sentient apes, robots, dinosaurs, huge ants and a giant ape are some of the stand out stars of this title.

It's also worth mentioning the brilliant voice acting, including narration in the form of a DVD release directors commentary from the movies "director".

A fun, value for money title, your looking at ~6 hours to complete and ~7.5-8 for achievement hunting if your into that sort of thing. I restarted after 3 or so hours and left it running for a time while AFK, hence my game time.

The camera got wonky for me twice only.

Played entirely with a gamepad

I intend to get it on PS4 at some stage down the track too.

If you've not seen many period sci-fi films, but even if you don't have a great understanding of them, some of the cliches in the may game cater to you. The nuclear ants, the wires holding things up, the spacesuits with the bubble helmets etc.

20737952.review: At long last The Deadly Tower of Monsters is getting a DVD release! Merely making this cult classic available in a modern format would be enough to secure a recommendation, but the commentary by director Dan Smith gives an incredible insight into what went on behind the scenes that made this movie the so bad it’s good classic that we all know and have come to love. I also must compliment the audio engineer who was working Mr. Smith in recording the commentary. While it’s a bit unusual to include someone who was not involved in the making of the film in the commentary (especially with the omission of the original actors, such as the lovely Stacy Sharp), his contributions and conversations with  Smith make the commentary even richer with details. I won’t spoil anything, but he even managed to dig up a huge collection of previously unseen footage, including many, many, deleted scenes, as well as a previously unreleased extended ending to the film. You will not regret adding this DVD to your collection!

NOW GO AND COMPARE THAT TO THE SYSTEM REQUIRMENTS AND SAY I DONT BLOW BY THE RECOMMENDED SYSTEM REQUIRMENTS!!!!!!  I really wanted to play and love this game but apparently I'm not allowed to. So long story short i refunded.

Don't look at my review and base your decision to purchase the game or not. Within 24 hours of posting this comment one of the developers commented on my review. 20722538.review:
Another great game by Ace, my go to developer for strange concepts that they make work. This one is a great platformer, disguised as an old directors cut B-movie, with the director narrating the happenings in a similar way to bastion, but with less focus on the actual character and more on how they did this scene or made that prop. 

The game itself is more or less one huge level - the tower. And it's grand. It's rare to see a game so vertically inspired as this, and the developers make good use of it. Secrets frequently require you to drop down on them, or shoot them from above, and you have the ability to teleport from the air (or the ground briefly after landing) back to where you jumped from, so if you miss what you were aiming for or just feel like skydiving, it's null sweat. The view itself is phenominal once you start jumping from high up.

The graphics themselves are neat, but the art style itself is of course very different. Often enemies are clearly just people in suits, or are stop-motion animated. I personally find this amusing and interesting, but I know people who dislike it. The music fits the game well enough, and is similar to the music used in their other games, but if I'm being honest I can't really think of any of the tunes off the top of my head, so I can't say it's too memorable, maybe that will change as I play.

Look, all you really want is a recommendation, right? I say yes, wholeheartedly and unreservedly, and follow that up by saying you should also go and buy every other game ACE team has ever made, because they are all amazing. They get a strange concept that most probably wouldn't recognize the potential of, and make it work gloriously. I think I've said this before, but at this point every ACE game that comes out is an instabuy for me.

20718679.review: It reminds me of the games that you got with cereal in the way back. Played it a little, it is fun and all, especially for movie fanatics, but in the long run, it really doesn't worth the money you have to pay for it.

20716992.review:
I loved every minute of this game, I just wish it had more minutes. Unfortunately, once you finish the story, there really isn't anything else to do unless you want to go chase achievements. 

There isn't a hard mode, and when the story is over there are so few monsters left that there isn't a point to upgrading your weapons or leveling further.  Oh, and that commentary that was a big part of what made the game so fun? That's over, too. Even if you could motivate yourself to go do achievements, it's really not fun without that ambiance that the commentary provided. 

A hard mode would fix some of this; even maybe a Diablo-style difficulty scale that would demand upgrading your weapons and leveling up in order to succeed at higher levels. It would still be the same game with the same story each time around, but at least there would be a reason for a second playthrough. 

I'm still recommending it, because it was so much fun the first time. Here's hoping for motivation to do it again.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters ist ein sehr spaßiger Platformer/Hack'n'Slasher im SciFi B-Movie Stil aus den 70' Jahren.
Es ist voll mit Anspielungen, ulkigen Stop-Motion Animationen und anderen Hollywood reifen Effekten.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist sehr angenehm und es ist relativ einfach alle Aufgaben zu beenden.
Mit 8 Stunden Spielzeit ist es für den Preis sehr angenehm und ich habe die Zeit sehr genossen.
(Auch wenn ich es Umsonst bekommen habe)
Nur manchmal nervt der Erzähler etwas, was aber nicht wirklich schlimm ist.

Leute,die Platformer und alte sciFi Filme mögen sollten dieses kleine Spielchen sich nicht entgehen lassen.
Ich hoffe, dass die Entwickler einen weiteren Teil entwickeln werden :)

20711655.review:
When I saw the first trailer few months back I knew I wanted this game and I'm not disappointed.
I'm near the very end at 5 hours in, and I think this is enough length for this game.
Really funny 'commentary track' makes up for the average platform/action gameplay.

If you like the humor of Portal 2 or The Stanley Parable, then you'll love this game! :)

PRO
+50's sci-fi vibe
+very funny director's commentary
+creature/weapon variation

CONS
-sometimes bad checkpoint system
-lack of orientation
-gameplay mechanics become boring after the first 2-3 hours

All in all I highly recommend this game (or rather an experience) for everyone loving the old sci-fi movies and has an affinity for 4th wall breaking jokes and dvd commentaries! :)

10/8

20695926.review:
I'm usually not a big fan of arcade isometric(ish) shooters, but the theme of this one caught my eye, and I thought I'd give it a go.  In short, it's a lot of fun - though I'd recommend cranking up the default difficulty a bit, as it's extremely easy.

You play either a male or a female 'actor' who is travelling up a tower as part of a B-grade science-fiction movie. The director is giving the DVD commentary while you're doing it, and the creatures are a combination of people in rubber-suits, or clearly stop-motion models.  It's corny, and of course it's supposed to be.  You can even see the strings on the spaceships.

I really quite like it.  

I was playing it on an Xbox controller, but found it a little frustrating. I switched to WASD/Mouse, and to be honest (apart from still needing to get used to some of the keys) it's much nicer. I guess it all comes down to what you prefer.

The sound is good. The music is typically B-grade scifi. The plot is non-existant, but the game itself is engaging enough.
Nothing's been particularly difficult so far.

If you're not a fan of the B-grade movie thing, then the attention to detail on this one is probably going to be lost on you Without this theme, it's really nothing amazing to write home about. With it, however, it's a lot of fun.

Whether it'll hold attention for subsequent play-throughs, I don't know.

Currently on around 35% special. Certainly worth the money so far.

EDIT - Took me five hours to complete on 'regular' mode, and probably will need to sit idle for a while before I can be bothered replaying it, but it was fun while it lasted. Nice twist at the end, though the final boss fight was a bit of a let-down, given some of the more fun boss fights earlier on.
If I was to give any advice, I'd say crank this up to HARD before playing. You'll get more mileage out of it, I suspect.

20695212.review:
Anyone remember Escape From the Planet of Robot Monsters? These developers do. This game is so charming, and so much fun, and so packed full of variety, that for once it just seems churlish to pick apart the bad points. So here we go... Slightly annoying camera, got stuck in a few bits of scenery, film scratches, but no filmic technicolour look or film softening added to the image to nail the era. It's a little rough, basically. And YET, every time you're feeling a little bored, a new fun power-up appears, a new monster makes you laugh, you discover a mini-pilotwings challenge. A new kitsch-y homage, a new idea lies around every corner. The music is FANTASTIC, nailing the old sci-fi sound. This is a game packed with attention to detail, love and craft.

My one major niggle - the grating Director's commentary. The VO script is a great compliment to the main action, adding backstory, staving off repetition... but the actor? He's somewhere between Troy McClure and Bruce Campbell, but somehow, sadly, simply too self-aware in his delivery, it's too broad. The script is good, he doesn't play it dryly enough. He's just not funny. So it becomes annoying. I guess nothing can be done about that now.

Otherwise, superb all round. More imagination and heart than most other games on the steam store. Here's to some original thinking.

20691704.review:
Purée, ce jeu: M.D.R!
 La dernière fois que je me suis bidonné tout seul comme ça sur un jeu, c'était avec le trop court Jazzpunk.
 Là j'ai peur que mes voisins (mes vieux) téléphonent à l'hopital psychiatrique.
 Ils enchainent finement gags sur gags. Bon je dis ça, mais pour bien apprécier, il faut avoir vu un minimum de film s.f rétros des années 50/70 quand même, comme du King-kong, la planète des singes, Metropolis, les envahisseurs de la planète rouge, etc. 
Tous ces films kitsch qualifiés de "nanars" désormais.
 (Sans un minimum de cette culture, j'imagine mal que l'on puisse apprécier, je ne sais pas).
 Certes ce sont des film pas très drôles sur le fond, mais l'équipe de Ace team a dû de faire de lourdes séances de visionnages avec poil à gratter afin de transformer tout ça en gags mortels et pour notre bon plaisir.
                                           xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
De quoi ça parle?
 On va incarner trois acteurs du film dont je te laisse deviner le titre...
Oui, il s'appelle "The Deadly Tower of Monsters", patate. Je n'en dis pas plus sur le scénario pour ne pas spoiler.

On joue à la vue tactique, clavier/mulot comme les pros ou pad comme les noobs :D (donc lègèrement au dessus);
 la caméra est dirigiste sans être contraignante, en déplaçant la souris l'on voit ce que l'on doit voir. 
Il y a différentes loots qui permettent de booster armes (càc et à distance) et les personnages.
Que dire de plus sans étaler de trop? Les graphismes et effets rétros sont magnifique et au top du kitsch (on a le choix entre grain VHS (top) et DVD (aucun intérêt).
La musique? Comment dire... Ils ont dû faire des séance de spiritisme avec d'augustes compositeurs du siècle dernier: ça sonne d'époque, rien à redire, c'est à sa place.
On a un petit pad de téléportation bien pratique qui évite les allez retours sur une carte vertigineuse et une fonction téléportation qui permet de se jeter dans le vide pour récupérer sa loot et hop on reviens à l'endroit du saut, sauf bien sure si l'on n'a pas appuyé à temps et c'est retour au point de sauvegarde directe. (C'est des acteurs, on recommence la scène avec un nouvel acteur, le précédent étant DCD ou hospitalisé suivant l'action).
Et des saut vertigineux, on va en manger à se guérir du mal de l'altitude.
Toute la grande partie des gags provient du réalisateur et son assistant qui commentent chacune de tes actions ou bien qui se vante de tels effets, tel costume ou telle anecdote débile façon réalisateur prétentieux assis sur sa chaise à l'ombre des caméras.
C'est drôle et très bien fait.
Bon je vais arrêter le roman, simplement, tu peux l'achètes les yeux fermés si tu as envie de te vider complètement l'esprit à moyen terme (la carte est immense) car j'estime, en tant que vieux roublard, que ce jeu vaut le double du prix non soldé, un vrai travail d'orfèvre.

20686664.review:
Kolejna rewelacyjna gra ACE TEAM.
Akcja gry przedstawia nam film The Deadly Tower of Monsters i historie jego kręcenia, które w przerewelacyjny sposób opowiada nam reżyser.
Gra wzorowana jest na filmach z lat 50,60 i FLASH GORDONA, Planeta Małp, King Kong  robi to wyśmienicie. Wszystkie bajery z tych filmów są zawarte w tej grze od animacji postaci, po ich designe,designe świata, kiczowate dialogi, nabijki z klasyków gatunku, latające postaci na sznurkach i masę innych.
Rozgrywka to typowa gra platformowa z elementami walki. Lewym przyciskiem atakujemy wręcz prawym strzelamy, a bronie OMG to też wszystko zerżnięte z tych filmów sa też miecze świetlne i komentarz do nich cud miód malina.
Każda broń możemy zmodyfikować za zbierane tryby a są ich 3 rodzaje: niebieski, srebrny, złoty.
Do gry oddano nam 3 bohaterów których odblokowujemy wraz z postepem. najśmieszniejszy jest robot wzorowany charakterem na HK 47. Każdą z danych postaci lvl podnoszac jej życie zadawany dmg energię pistoleu.
Aby wymaksować gre będziemy musieli róźnymi osobami odblokowywać przejścia ponieważ gra to typowy przykład gry typu METROID, że wraz z postępem odblokowujemy coś tam aby pójsc dalej.

Wrogowie coż można o nich powiedzieć ich designe powala, od małp, po dinozaury, mrówki, luzdzi z krokodylami, latajace mózgi w spodkach, ufo z dwoma parami rąk i wielkimi głowami jak gąbka, po naukowca w hełmie z żarówkami, piratów i mase innych, robotowi ze Scremmerów.

Graficznie gra wygląda prześlicznie dzięki rewelacyjnemu designowi, Każda miejscówka jest jak osobny film to trzeba naprawde zobaczyc jaki kawał roboty odwalili panowie z ACE TEAM. tak samo postaci potworów sa animowane poklatkowo jak w tych starych filmach a na wszystko nalożono film starej tasmy VHS. Gra działa na UE 3.0 więc działa bez problemów.

Voice acting jest patetyczny i kiczowaty ale taki miał być a komentarz rezysera wymiata. Muzyka równiez stoi na poziomie ale to ACE TEAM u nich muzyka zawsze była super.

Jak dla mnie zaskoczenie stycznia.

Grafika 10/10 za designe
Dźwięk 10/10 za muzyke i kiczowaty voice acting
Gameplay 10/10 za długa rozgrywkę, i Metroidowy styl rozgrywki. dobrą mechanikę walki i platformowe elementy.

20684454.review:
It's honestly hard to even lsit out all the things I love about this game, but in short: ACE Team has done it again, and I honestly can't decide if I like this or Abyss Odyssey more. Despite being a more story-driven game, DTM still bosts some replayability for all of its little secrets. Just reading the achievment list left me scratching my head: at no point was I ever aware that there was a even Ghost Pirate Ship with some kind of boss on it to fight. The combat is solid and enjoyable, the parrying is competent and functional for sure, and the ever changing environments and enemies keep the experience fresh.

This has to be the most honest B-Movie parody I've seen though. They just keeping pulling out more and more random monsters that will just be in the game for a few minutes and never again, and it's clearly intentional, and enjoyable, just waiting to see what is going to top the fight with a large dog wearing a vacuum cleaner and christmas lights. The director commentary was honestly fun; I thought it was just something they did for the trailer, and didn't realize it was like the premise of the entire game: the way it tells both the game's story, and the story of the movie's production is really neat and creative, and at no point does the game become "just a game", it really stays consistent from start to finish.

20682040.review:
You cannot go wrong with this game! It's got everything you like to make fun of when you watch old films :

- Spaceships with pieces of string attached to them
- Ridiculous lines
- Awesome retro-futuristic weapons
- Monkeys, dinosaurs, weird blobs, giant ants... They're all there, and they move like in the old films

The game you are playing is meant to be the DVD rerelease of a film, as you play you get to hear the comments of the director of the film looking back on his creation. The comments are usually funny, and interesting because he ends up talking about real 60's films problems and special FX.

I highly recommend it, like I say, you cannot go wrong with the game!

10/10

20676948.review:
Solo llevo tres horas y me queda una buena porción de juego, pero difícilmente va a cambiar mi opinión sobre este (en todo caso podría mejorar). Simple y llanamente, una genialidad con una jugabilidad perfecta. Es uno de esos juegos en los que se nota mimo por parte de los desarrolladores, el hecho de haber pensado cada mecánica y que todo funcione, tenga sentido y sea altamente divertido. Pero no es solo una joya jugable, también es un juego original conceptualmente (visionado de un DVD escuchando los comentarios del director), con un aspecto visual muy atractivo y artísticamente único, y una música fabulosa que encaja perfectamente con el ambiente de peli de serie B. 
En resumen, todo un éxito de ACE Team, divertidísimo y para disfrutar con calma, explorando el escenario gracias a la mecánica del salto al vacio, o el fantástico sistema de checkpoints. Acción, exploración y mucho humor en un juego que nadie debería dejar pasar.

Editado: pasado en algo más de seis horas. Me he dejado alguna cosilla por completar, pero en general lo he hecho casi todo. Buena duración y muy buen juego. La parte final muy divertida, un guión simpático :)

20671743.review: The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a really fun game. It's a 3rd person brawler with a 50's sci-fi aesthetic that is out of this world. This is the best looking game I've ever played. All of the environments are richly detailed and interesting to look at. The retro future look is done so well here. It's even better than in the Fallout series. The only problem I had with the look was some of the enemies are supposed to look like choppy stop-motion animation monsters, but they just come across looking poorly animated instead of that classic stop-motion animation look. The soundtrack has some really good songs that further sell the feel of the game world.  The combat is standard, but the sci-fi themed weapons are a lot of fun to use. The goal of the game is essentially to get to the top of a tower to defeat the big baddie.  This game is really more about the journey than the destination, though. The setup of the game is that a director is giving commentary on one of his old films so he's constantly explaining what's going on in the action and supposed back stories for actors that worked on the 'film'. This commentary adds yet another layer to the campy of fun of the game that is a constant blast to play through. The campaign itself took less than 5 hours to finish, but this is such a fun game world to explore that I bothered to get all the achievements. I was completely dazzled and blown away by this game. I highly recommend The Deadly Tower of Monsters!

20671034.review:
MUITO DIVERTIDO E NOSTÁLGICO!

Um game que carrega a essência dos jogos antigos, não pela ambietação , mas por ter simples jogabilidade e focado mais na diversão do que ter gráficos excepcionais. Em The Deadly Tower of Monsters, você se aventura num mundo de sátira aos filmes antigos de ficção cientifica referente aos anos 30/40. Até os movimentos dos inimigos teve o frame reduzido(proposital), principalmente dos dinossauros, para lembrar os efeitos especiais dos daquela época, achei engraçado. Haha
O mundo deste jogo é gigante, se baseia unicamente numa torre que tem vários estágios , que parece que não acaba nunca, garantindo boas horas de jogatina. Fazia bom tempo que eu não jogava um bom  jogo de aventura como este, alías um EXCELENTE game de aventura! Parabéns aos desenvolvedores! :D

Nota: 10/10

20668519.review:
Ein super lustiger TwinStick-Shooter der sein Geld echt wert ist. :)
Die Spielzeit ist zwar mit knapp 5std etwas gering obwohl man bestimmt noch nen bisken mehr investieren kann um alle Nebenmissionen abzuschließen aber für den Preis kann man echt nicht meckern.

Grade wenn man einen Bezug zu alten B-Movies hat wird man hier mit all den Anspielungen viel anfangen können.
Man kann sagen, daß man fast von Anfang bis Ende ein Dauergrinsen auf den Lippen hat aufgrund der immer neuen Monster welche man aus alten Filmen kennt oder wegen der Fäden an denen manche Viecher hängen und dem StopMotion-Effekt und und und...es kommt einfach alle paar Minuten was Neues hinzu. ^^

Die Musik passt sich dem Spielgeschehen an und ist auch den alten Sci-Fi-Filmen nachempfunden.
Allerdings wiederholen sich die Stücke ab nem gewissen Moment was mich aber nicht störte.

Die Dialoge etc. reißen das ganze Game lang nicht ab. Die "Audiokommentare" laufen während dem Spiel im Hintergrund ab und haben Witz und Charme.
Manchmal ist man fast traurig wenn man nen bisken was davon nicht mitbekommt weil man vll grade zu sehr ins Spiel selber vertieft ist. :D

Ansonsten grafisch natürlich kein HAMMER aber für das worum es hier geht genau richtig.
Außerdem handelt es sich hier um einen der besseren TwinStick-Shootern. Da gibt es ja auf Steam unendlich viele und "The Deadly Tower of Monsters" hebt sich gut aus der Masse hervor.
Die Steuerung ist sehr genau und man hat in den ganzen Sprungpassagen nie das Gefühl die Kontrolle zu verlieren.
Als Schmankerl ist es möglich durch Erkunderdrang div. Bauteile zu finden mit denen man seine Nah- und Fernkampfwaffen aufrüsten kann.
Welche Waffen ihr mitnehmt bleibt euch überlassen denn alles in allem gibt es nicht DIE Überwaffe sondern nur deine persöhnliche Lieblingswaffe...und sei es die Peitsche die aussieht wie ein Oktopusarm. ^^
Die Nebenmissionen sehen erst aus wie normale Errungenschaften aber schalten Fähigkeiten im Spiel frei welche dich besser werden lassen dank eines Skilltrees.
Ergo hat man auch einen Anreiz div. kleine Missionen abzuschließen um es sich im Spielverlauf etwas einfacher machen zu können.

Greift also ruhig zu, bereuen werdet ihr bei diesem Preis absolut nichts! :)

20658282.review:
Ever wanted to be in a "B" movie that could be featured in an episode of Mystery Science Theater 3000? This game is probably about the closest that any of us can reasonably expect to come to such an experience...


The game is a basic isometric hack and slash adventure game. Action-wise it is not trying to reinvent the genre. However it is cast in a very inventive way: You are acting out the actions of the protagonists of a classic "B" movie being re-released on DVD while the director of the movie gives commentary about the film's production.

The presentation of the game is outstanding. It looks very much like an old sci-fi/horror flick from the 50's or 60's, complete with cheesy special effects such as visible strings holding flying creatures aloft. 

"The effects guys promised me the strings wouldn't be visible..."

In addition to the awesome graphical presentation the director of the film is constantly talking about the production whilst throwing off many off-color stories of his egomaniacal excesses and abuses of power. This commentary is absolutely hilarious at times. Best of all, the narrator reacts to the things that you do, especially when you do things that are off-script or if you take your time in an area. 

To sum it up, the game is a hilarious sendup of the best of the worst of Hollywood and a fun action game at the same time. Highly recommended, especially to anyone old enough to have at least seen these types of movies on late night tv.

20655342.review:
An excelent game. It is a comedy, but the comedy does not get in the way of the gameplay and actually improves on the experience. Secrets and collectables can improve the gameplay thourgh upgrades, but I found that I did not need to collect them all to finish the game. 

This game encourages exploration but it has a streamlined sense of continual progression. This is what I would say is it's greatest strength. You can fall down the Deadly Tower to get bonuses or reach secret areas without losing any progress. 

In fact... there are two mechanics which I say make this game flow perfectly, without which would have made The Deadly Tower of Monsters a frustrating mess otherwise:
1) Checkpoints that, once you reach them for the first time, you can teleport to at any moment. This makes exploration breezy and also allows the player to have a sense of progression and sucess. 
2) An ability that allows you to teleport back to a platform you just fell from. This inclusion was pure genious. First, you can fall great hieghts to get items like rings and not have to backtrack. If you miss a landing (which you will do A LOT) you can try again immediately. If an enemy knocks you off a platform... it is no loss, simply teleport back into the fight!

These two gameplay elements, in my opinion, make this game wonderful.

There are some other points of note:
Pros:
-Loading times are great. You can seemlessly fall down to a lower level without a loading screen. Teleporting up to a higher level happens in moments. 
-It runs very well. If you don't like the esthetic (choppy, like an old movie would be)... you can change that. 
-A large variety of enemies. 
-The hilarity of dying (the load *thump* and subsequent ragdolling, combined with the comentary, always gets me).
-I would call the sound design great. The soundtrack in particular really captures the feel of an old 30's sci-fi b-movie like Flash Gordon.

Cons:
-The upgrade system is a bit... janky... (gold is so abundant it does not factor into anything, for example. I forgot I had it). 
-The camera can be a bit wonky sometimes.
-Some weapons are utterly useless (bye bye shiv). Others are very OP. (lasergun FTW!)
-Movement in general can be frustrating at certain moments. Three of note are: Trying to land on a small platform using the jetpack, using sprint on conveyor belts, one or two sections where the camrea angle makes platforming a nightmare.

Overall I enjoyed The Deadly Tower of Monsters very, very much! Probably one of ACE Team's best games yet, if not their best game yet.

20652883.review:
The game is not perfect, no game ever is. However what this game does it does with impecible skill. I streamed the first 2 acts of the game tonight and very much look forward to finishing it.

The developer managed to capture the essence of the classic B-Movies and Sci Fi TV shows of the 60s and 70s and put it into a game. This is definitely a game that I can see being a little lost on the younger generation that havent been able to appreciate the quality of those old B Movies. Anyone that has will totally love this.

The music and voice acting could have been taking directly from one of those old shows and fits the game perfectly. Some people may feel like some of the animations are missing a few frames and a little jerky. But this is exactly how the stop motion was done and they have copied it great.

There are so many nice little touches in this game. Highly recommended for the price, especially to fans of classic sci fi.

20651485.review:
Damn, the Deadly Tower of Monsters! *Reviewing 1O1 - always write the name of the game on the review* is a love letter to the golden era of the Science Fiction B movies from the 50's and 60's, the ambience is like a love child between Forbidden Planet, Barbarella, Fiend Without a Face, Them!, Robison Crusoe on Mars... and many others, is like it was directed by Roger Corman with Ray Harryhausen dealing with the special effects, and the gang of the Mystery Science Theater 3000 doing the commentary audio with a well written humor (kinda in a Futurama way), and alot of references like "how to produce/direct a science fiction flick" with some references to some similar behind the scenes episodes of Star Trek original series, Lost in Space, or BBC's Doctor Who. 

The gameplay of this Deadly Tower of Monsters is the typical Hack-and-Slashing/Base Jumping game, but believe me all the background makes it clearly a must have for any Movie buff or Sci-fi junkie, like me and even if you're not a big old B movies junkie, and if you enjoyed the ambience of games like Destroy all Humans, Stubbs the Zombie, or even directing movies in the Lionshead studio game The Movies, then you should check this game.

At least give it a try for the plastic Dinossaurs and the Atomic Ants guided by white apes! 

For a really long time I haven't buy a game in the week of it's release, without even read a single review, this was money well spent, I only have 1 hour and stuff of playing but I'll give it a 10 out of 10!

20642924.review:
Un bon jeu d'aventures aux références rétro des années 60.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters, est un film de série B qui a tout pour plaire, des monstres, des décors réalistes et des effets spéciaux impressionnants. Le scénario est simple, vous êtes D.ick Starspeed et votre vaisseau s'est écrasé sur une île hostile. Votre objectif est d'inteindre le sommet de la tour avec vos acolytes, Scarlet Nova et Robot. Sauf que cela ne va pas être de tout repos, car la tour est remplis de monstres.

Dès le lancement du jeu, vous êtes dans cette ambiance des 60's, un narrateur se fait entendre. C'est Dan Smith, le réalisateur du film qui nous parle. Il a été engagé par les distributeurs de la version DVD pour commenter son film. Pendant notre périple, impossible d'échapper à des explications et autres secrets de tournage. L'autodérision est de mise.

Pour infos je suis actuellement à 2h de jeu et je pense encore être loin de la fin.

Le Jeu
C'est un jeu d'aventure type hack'n'slash avec des phases de plateformes. La carte est une sorte d'open world, il est possible de sauter en chute libre depuis la tour pour atteindre la terre ferme. Et les objectifs secrets ne manquent pas (atteindre des cercles en chute libre, détruires des cibles réparties dans l'île...)

Le personnage peut lancer des sorts, utiliser des armes aux corps à corps et à distance. Il est possible de modifier les armes grâce aux engrenages que l'on peut trouver durant le jeu. Le jet-pack permet de ralentir sa chute ou encore d'atteindre certaines plateformes. Un arbre de talent est également disponible pour augmenter ses caractéristiques.

Les monstres sont nombreux des ptérodactyles mécaniques aux singes animés image par image. Pour l'instant j'ai pu affronter deux boss, et le deuxième n'était déjà pas facile (bon signe).

Malgré que le jeu soit bon, j'ai noté des soucis.
Bug de collisions, le personnage se retrouve parfois coincé dans les décors. Dès le début j'ai dû relancer un checkpoint car mon personnage était bloqué dans un arbre.
La caméra se comporte d'une manière un peu bizarre, il faut s'adapter, car il y a un léger retour sur mouvement.

The Deadly Tower of Monsters est un bon jeu indépendant qui est encore une fois un jeu original et remplis de références, je recommande. 
En plus on a un calendrier gratuit :D

20642604.review: If you're expecting a Diablo style game, look elsewhere. The big "sticker" for me was the sudden revelation of twin-stick shooter controls, ala How to Survive. Not really my "thing" when I wanna play a game for a couple hours in my off-time, but great as a pick-up game. If you're into twin-stick controls and VERY light RPG elements, it could be your game. The humor is there if you grew up with B-movie sci-fi, but otherwise the Director Commentary will get old, especially when you're lost.

20642497.review: I completed the game in 4hrs gameplay time. I did this game in one sitting and honestly it was great fun, the interactions between the narrator and the characters actions can be quite funny at times. This said however there isnt much to do after completion, sure you can collect the missions which are basically achievements but even that wasnt something to keep me wanting to play more on an finished save. I think maybe some dlc would be fun, like a new area to extend the tower or perhaps go lower. Anyways as far as combat goes it does vary. Different probs such as gun and melee weapons are unlocked as you go but some arent really worth using. For example the first weapon you get in the game i stuck with because it was fast and did damage, i only ever swapped it when i got the lightsaber as it allowed me to do the same thing but with stun every so often and reflecting bullets. Idk maybe a small thing that is wrong with the game and it didnt push me enough to hate the game but i wish the weapons were more balance i guess. So overall the game is great, has and interesting and creative story along with some blast from the past. This game is great for the price of 7.25 but maybe not so much if it was any higher as of how quickly i completed it. Will i go back and play it? sure maybe in a couple of days, heck id even love to speed run it. Just try it yourself :D

20641159.review:
After my first play through I can say that Deadly Tower of Monsters is a lot of fun. The voice acting/narration/commentary is well acted and very entertaining. The gameplay is solid though not noteworthy. The story line is original and funny while staying interesting enough to keep me invested for the full 10 hour playthough (some of which was wandering, looking for secrets, working on achievements, etc..). However even with all the dicking around the game was still longer than expected for the pricetag.

The game does a fantastic job of offering up a comical homage to the b-movies of old. Enemies on strings, stop motion enemies, someones nephew in a suit...it's got all the clichés. The final act was a nice touch but I'll leave it at that to avoid spoilers. 

I hit a couple glitches during the game that prevented acess to the next section after defeating the enemies causing me to have to go back to the last checkpoint and rerun the section. But these were very few and far between and the checkpoints are frequent so it didn't damper the experience.

I picked this title up on sale for just under $10 but even at full price the game is worth the money.

20639653.review:
A smoker friendly review -

The Deadly Tower of Monsters is a isometric brawler with great presntation and a sense of humour. The levels are laid out like old time movie sets, and the effects are made to look like old time special effects: You can see the string on the ship while flying, The jungle trees are made of plastic and the Dinosaurs are stop motion animated. Its all set up like your watching a director's commentary on the DVD release of a schlocky Sci-fi film from the Drive In days. The narrator is a great touch, breaking the fourth wall and basically talking jive the entire game.  The action is basic but the presentation makes up for it kind of like the deadpool game.  Would definately reccomend and its kind of a trip after a smoke.

20639466.review:
The Deadly Tower of Monsters will take you to a wacky as hell adventure with some of the most amazing narrative comedy I've seen in ages.

now lets break down the good from the bad:

good:

- great visuals/audio
- Narrative, Narrative, Narrative.
- good story/expose of the world

bad:

- Lackluster mechanics.
- lack of replay ability (and short ~4-6 hours total gameplay)
- MASSIVE screen tearing, regardless of settings

See video review here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2ymHlAtCDko&ab_channel=GuyLogic


Now, if you LIKE the commentary - 15 euro's is worth it 10 times over. but if you DON'T like it... avoid, because the game is wholly driven by it's narrative and comedy.

20637683.review: ACE team's  record is untarnished.  Again, they deliver an amazing game that is both fun to play and brilliantly original.  The whole B-movie premise is wonderfully realized, with so many special efects, enemies and props making me squak "Hey!  I remember this from *********** movie back in the day!"  Who would have thought that stop motion's big comeback would be in a computer game?!   The game plays well with either a keyboard/mouse or gamepad, and has a very pleasing flow, with ample things to explore, upgrades to purchase and secrets to collect, along with damn near every sci fi cliche monster to interact with/shoot in the face.   I love it.  The music is gloriously campy while still retaining it's quality, and the sound effects are perfect.  Really, I can't believe this was ten bucks at launch.    Bravo again, ACE!

20635173.review:
The game is a little rough around the edges at times. The camera can be a bit wonky when using a keyboard and mouse, more so if you try and go somewhere the game never meant for you to go. The level desgin is amazing and leads to very solid platforming 99% of the time. The fact that you are almost constently moving up with no loading screens really gives you a sense of hight and then jumping off the tower to go get some hidden item really shows how much thought they put into the game and the titular tower.

While the game is solid all around and fun the real place it shines is the love for B-movies. The sense of humor and the presentation are spot on. The VHS effects, the stop motion animation on enemies, the set pieces, all of it just works togeather. This is the video game you wanted as a kid, even if thats back when video games were pong. Yet you don't have to be old and or a fan of B-movies to enjoy the game and its off beat sense of humor. It's early in the year but this has already earned a place on my personal top games of the year list and if people have any sense it will make it on theirs as well.

20635171.review:
I've only put a few hours into this game but it is an awesome game! The adventure, monsters, commentary, platforming, and so much more. This is a game you must experience. Especially if you watched those old movies where they special fx was made in clay. The game isn't even about the heroes of the game. It's more or less about the director of this "movie". As you play the game, You hear the director, hilariously, speak of how this movie was made. The director is what is making the game for me, amongst others.

The monsters: in the time that I have played, I have killed crabs, lizards, yetis, slime blobs, 3 different kind of dinosaurs, ufo's, king kong-type gorilla, and I'm sure I've missed more. But each of these monsters are unique in how they attack. So I love that aspect of it.

The Combat: It's amazing. Shoot, melee, special skills, and roll. The melee weapons and guns have been rolling in so far. I'm sure I still have much more to find. Only downside, You can only hold two of each at a time. 

Final Summary: I would give them game a chance. But if you're a kid, I don't think you would understand the humor in the game. As it does use the movies of old as a reference.

20632509.review:
This game is simply amazing. I am a massive fan of ACE Team. Their imaginative creations never cease to amaze. Yet again they have produced another winner, with a game that takes on a surrealistic approach to movies with amazing visuals and audio. 

Firstly may I say, that this game could be enjoyed simply for the voice acting and audio. The game basically revolves around you watching a director's cut of an old film, except you are obviously playing as the main character of the film, an astronaut who has crash landed on an alien planet. The Director will commentate on your surroundings, the story and pretty much everything else. For instance I started spinning around and he just started going on about how the main actor loved to spin in circles, it was even the reason they chose him during the role casting sessions! Even if you go afk he will start to say things like "At this point he forgot his lines and didn't know what to do". So yeah, if you like a laugh, buy this game right now!

The music and visuals are both equally great. The game should run fine on nearly all systems as it isn't too demanding, and is capped to 60fps. The visuals and audio can have one of two filters, either VHS or DVD. These obviously change the quality of both and add a different feel to the game. I highly suggest using VHS as this is how the devs intended the game to be played. The characters and enemies are all amazingly detailed, kingkong and dinosaurs are stop motion animated, giving them that nostalgic and authentic look and feel. Kingkong's hand when he grabs you is even on a stick! This game stays true to so many movie tropes it's unbelievable and equates to the funniest game I've had the pleasure of playing in a long time.

Gameplay itself is very solid, as I'm not a massive fan of top down games, torchlight etc... But this game gets it right. Behind the great visuals, audio, and "story" is a solid set of combat mechanics. You find new weapons, can upgrade them, and do powerful special abilities. Throw in the massive variety of enemies and you've got yourself a really fulfilling and satisfying game.

My only gripe with the game so far is the options menu. I think that some of the labels should be changed when using a keyboard, for instance to apply changes it just says press the "app" key. Turns out this is enter, which is pretty much common sense. But I think it should just say "enter". As I said, this is just a tiny flaw that if fixed up will make the game a classic.

Do I suggest buying this? Yes! Go buy it now, you won't regret it. If you are a fan of ACE Team there's even more reason to buy it, help support these guys. They make really individual games that I wish other people took inspiration from. If you love movies, then yeah. You may wanna buy this simply for the near infinite references and elbow nudges to famous movies.

20629913.review:
Полная версия здесь - http://www.vgblogs.ru/2016/01/the-deadly-tower-of-monsters-mnenie.html

Прохождение первой главы:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQHSUyeaKis
Помнится лет двадцать назад, а может и того раньше, я тоже впервые столкнулся с фильмами тех лет - большое спасибо пиратскому "Небесному каналу", вклинивавшемуся в федеральную сетку вещания (да, бывало и такое). "Синбад и Глаз Тигра ", "Битва титанов", "Война миров", "Вожди Атлантиды", "Нечто из иного мира"... Всего и не перечислить. Но я прекрасно помню, как удивляли и поражали кукольные монстры и дешёвая пиротехника - в первую очередь, благодаря безудержной фантазии создателей.

Вот и The Deadly Tower of Monsters целиком и полностью стилизована под дешёвую космооперу, отреставрированную и переизданную на DVD. Со всеми вытекающими: отчаянно переигрывающими актёрами, вываливающими на зрителей пафосные бессодержательные реплики, невменяемым сюжетом, и конечно же невероятными спецэффектами, представленными в основном работами аниматоров и декораторов. Космические корабли передвигаются исключительно при помощи тросов, пластмассовые декорации изображают джунгли далёкой планеты Гравория, а актёры в костюмах строят из себя инопланетных жителей. И совершенно невозможно обойтись без злобного галактического императора в кадре, измывающегося над порабощёнными народами почём зря.

Вот только игра, к счастью, не насмехается и не ёрничает над целым пластом культуры минувших дней, а скорее по доброму иронизирует. И ещё она насквозь пропитана тоской и светлой грустью по славному прошлому.

А вот в плане наполнения новый проект ACE Team нисколько не поражает воображение, даже наоборот, заставляет недоумевать. Дело в том, что фантазии чилийцев хватило почему-то только на нестандартные внешность и подачу, в которые бережно завернули просроченный кривоватый изометрический экшен, слегка приправленный элементами платформера, ролевой игры и метроидвании. Большую часть времени вам придётся отмахиваться от толп врагов врукопашную, палить в них из бластеров и импульсных пистолетов, перекатываться в попытках увернуться от ударов и ломать голову над тем, как добраться до того самого секрета.

Разработчики, кажется, вообще слабо понимают, что делают и городят на ровном месте фичи ради фич. К примеру, зачем вообще нужна прокачка характеристик персонажа, если игру можно спокойно пройти и без неё? Неужели ради того, чтобы заставить игроков охотиться за достижениями (очки опыта начисляют строго за выполнение "побочных заданий")? К улучшению оружия в обмен на собранные ресурсы претензий нет, это работает как надо. Зато полно претензий к не самому отзывчивому управлению, порой заставляющему месить воздух в попытках попасть по очередному рычагу, переключателю, а то и противнику.

Впрочем, в работах студии и раньше форма довлела - нет, даже доминировала - над содержанием, поэтому разбирать на составляющие и критиковать новинку не имеет смысла. А всё потому, что самое главное в игре вовсе не антураж, герои, сюжет или механика. Альфа и омега The Deadly Tower of Monsters - это комментарии режиссёра и сценариста Дэна Смита, снявшего фильм, кажется, "лет сто назад". Приём неутомимого и энергичного закадрового рассказчика, дающего свою оценку событиям на экране, хорошо себя зарекомендовал в последние годы. Идеально реализован он и ACE Team: человек, снявший всю эту очаровательную пургу, практически безостановочно объясняет и дополняет картину происходящего, подтрунивает над статистами, бедноватым визуалом и вспоминает о минувшем. Как правило, подобная приятная болтовня отвлекает от затянутых моментов и откровенно скучных эпизодов. Так что игру незаметно для себя проходишь на одном дыхании, а в памяти оседают сплошь яркие впечатления.

А какой тут шикарный и по-хорошему неожиданный финал!

Невероятно, но факт: ACE Team умудряется удивлять нас и сейчас, когда, казалось бы, мы видели всё на свете и не осталось тем, не затронутых в играх. The Deadly Tower of Monsters можно и нужно пожурить за отдельные недостатки, в конце концов, она всё-таки недостаточно "игра" в привычном понимании слова. С другой стороны, это очередной пример того, как чилийские разработчики снова сумели прыгнуть выше головы и выкатили на суд публики очередной небольшой шедевр.

И пожалуй это лучшее, что могло произойти в наше время с классической голливудской кинофантастикой.

Дисклеймер: ревью-код

Whoa Flashback!

These were the movies I grew up with and before you think to yourself, 'Good Grief! How old IS this chump?', lets just state I'm a product of the early '70's man.. Groovy..

So TDToM was on my wishlist since it was on Steam. The old throwback SciFi movie plots, the weapons, the Monsters!

I really enjoy the visual appeal and the voice acting, thus-far, has been superb! Corney jokes and witticisms abound but does not detract as they actually progress with your game-play. Dinosaurs? Yes Dinosaurs! But how one particular large specimen was realized is a funny story.. lol..
